title: Graphic Design Intern
description:
**YOUR MISSION AT VOI**
**Role**
 As a Design Intern, you will support our commercial initiatives across both online and offline channels, contributing to the design and layout of marketing materials, tenders, and presentations. This role offers an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on experience and work alongside our Senior Designer on a variety of projects and play a key role in enhancing our visual communications, ensuring that our brand is represented with consistency and creativity. To put it into specifics you will:
   

  

* Support the design and layout of tender documents and other commercial proposals.
* Create and edit presentations, especially in Google Slides, ensuring alignment with brand standards.
* Assist in designing visual assets for both online and offline marketing campaigns.
* Collaborate with the commercial team to produce digital and print materials, including stickers, hangers, social media assets, and brochures.
* Work within established brand guidelines to ensure cohesive and professional visual communication.
* Participate in brainstorming and creative sessions to contribute ideas and feedback.


**What You Need To Embark**
 We’re looking for a collaborative and curious Design Intern who is currently studying Graphic Design or a related field. In addition to being fluent in English we believe the right person has:
   

  

* Experience in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Slides) and Figma.
* Understanding of graphic design principles, typography, and colour theory.
* Ability to work both independently and collaboratively within a team.
* Attention to details.


**WHY VOI?**
 Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voiage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To
   

  

* Join Europes #1 micromobility company
* Work with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
* Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


 Since 2018,
 **Voi** 
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
   

  

**Diversity Matters**
 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

title: CRO Analyst & UX Designer to Samsung
job_function: Analyst, Business Development, and Information Technology
company_industry: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing and Computers and Electronics Manufacturing
description:
*We are currently looking for a CRO Analyst & UX Designer to an exciting opportunity at Samsung! This is an until further notice consultancy opportunity, starting as soon as possible.* 




  





**About the company:** 




  





*Help Us Create What Can´t Be Done* 




 Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. is a global leader in technology, opening new possibilities for people everywhere. Through relentless innovation and discovery, we are transforming the worlds of TVs, smartphones, tablets, PCs, cameras, home appliances, printers, LTE systems, medical devices, semiconductors and LED solutions. We employ 286,000 people across 80 countries with annual sales of US$269.billion. To discover more, please visit www.samsung.com.
 



  





**About the role:** 




  






 Purpose of the role:
 








 We are seeking a CRO Analyst & UX Designer to enhance our eCommerce user experience, optimize interfaces using data insights from heatmaps, session recordings, and user flows.
 



 Job Scope & Key Deliverables:
 



  




* User Experience & Interface Optimization: Design and refine high-converting, user-friendly eCommerce experiences, focusing on navigation, layout, and usability.
* Data-Driven Enhancements: Analyse heatmaps, session recordings, and user flow reports to identify friction points and usability issues.
* Landing Page & Funnel Design: Develop and test optimized page layouts, CTAs, and forms to drive better engagement and conversions.
* Conversion-Focused UI Design: Ensure visual hierarchy, accessibility, and responsiveness are optimized for desktop and mobile users.
* Cross-Team Collaboration: Work with site owners, Analysts, Developers, and Marketing to implement data-backed UX improvements.
* Ongoing Optimization & Testing: Continuously test and improve design elements based on real-time data and user feedback.



  






 Role Tasks:
 




  





 Some of the tasks you will do:
 


* UX/UI Audits & Enhancements: Conduct usability audits, analyze heatmaps and user flows, and propose layout improvements.
* A/B Testing & Experimentation: Design alternative UI elements, navigation structures, and CTA placements for testing.
* Mobile-First & Responsive Design: Ensure seamless, mobile-optimized experiences that improve conversion rates.
* Collaboration & Implementation Support: Work with developers to ensure proper execution of CRO and UX changes.
* Reporting & UX Insights: Share UX findings and conversion insights with stakeholders, making recommendations for ongoing improvements.



  





**About You:** 




  






 What makes this role interesting for a candidate?
 




  





 This role is perfect for someone who loves getting into the details, testing new ideas, and collaborating with a team to drive data-backed improvements.
 







 If you´re analytical, creative, and eager to make an impact, we´d love to hear from you!
 








 Main competence:
 







* Analysing and Interpreting - Shows evidence of clear analytical thinking. Gets to the heart of complex problems and issues. Applies own expertise effectively. Quickly learns new technology. Communicates well in writing.
* Organising and Executing - Plans ahead and works in a systematic and organised way. Follows directions and procedures. Focuses on customer satisfaction and delivers a quality service or product to the agreed standards.
* Supporting and Co-operating - Supports others and shows respect and positive regard for them in social situations. Puts people first, working effectively with individuals and teams, clients and staff. Behaves consistently with clear personal values that complement those of the organization.








 Most relevant qualifications, education and training:
 







* Degree in UX/UI Design, Business, Data Analytics, or a related field.
* Experience in e-commerce, CRO, A/B testing, and UX optimization.
* Familiarity with customer journey mapping and conversion funnel analysis.








 Most relevant previous work experience:
 







* Strong understanding of user behavior, site navigation, checkout flows, and purchase patterns.
* Hands-on experience with A/B testing, heatmap analysis, and usability testing tools.
* Knowledge of customer journey mapping and conversion funnel analysis.
* Experience working with Jira, Adobe Target, Adobe Analytics, Content Square, Figma.
* Experience with content management systems and front-end UX implementation.
* Ability to interpret data insights into actionable design improvements.








 Required language skills:
 








 Fluency in English & Swedish
 








 Required travel days per year:
 








 10 days, to Poland
 



  





**Interested:** 




 If you are up for the challenge and reckon that this position fits your profile, we would like to hear from you. Apply today, as we are reviewing applications ongoingly and the position might be filled before the application deadline.

title: UX-designer med kommunikationsbakgrund
description:
**UX-designer med kommunikationsbakgrund** 




  





 Vill du kombinera UX-design och strategisk kommunikation i internationella projekt? Boulder söker nu en UX-designer med stark känsla för språk, innehåll och användarupplevelse till ett spännande kunduppdrag. Tjänsten är en heltidsanställning i Stockholm, med start mellan juni och augusti 2025.
 



  





**Om Boulder** 




 Boulder är ett konsultbolag som brinner för digitala lösningar där teknik, affär och användarupplevelse möts. Våra kunder är innovativa företag som vill skapa verklig förändring.
 



  





 Läs mer på www.boulder.se
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som UX-designer med kommunikationsbakgrund kommer du att ha en central roll i ett projekt som kräver både skarp designförmåga och en tydlig kommunikativ ton. Du ansvarar för att ta fram användarvänliga lösningar för webb och mobil, samtidigt som du producerar UX-texter och utbildningsmaterial anpassat för en global målgrupp.
 



  





**Vi söker dig som har:** 




 • Minst 7 års erfarenhet av UX-design med fokus på research, prototypframtagning och användartester.
 



 • Mycket goda kunskaper i Figma och en trygghet i att arbeta iterativt.
 



 • Starka färdigheter i UX-writing på engelska – du kan skapa tydlig, funktionell text för onboarding, produktfunktioner och internkommunikation.
 



 • Erfarenhet av att ta fram kommunikationsstrategier, utbildningsmaterial och videoinnehåll.
 



 • Mycket god skriftlig och muntlig engelska och vana vid att arbeta i distribuerade, internationella team.
 



  





**Meriterande:** 




 • Akademisk bakgrund inom kommunikation, media, UX eller juridik.
 



 • Grundläggande förståelse för legala frågor kopplade till digitala lösningar, särskilt skatterätt.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder dig:** 




 • En kreativ miljö där UX och kommunikation värderas högt.
 



 • Arbete i globala projekt där din kompetens får verklig påverkan.
 



 • Starka utvecklingsmöjligheter och konkurrenskraftiga villkor.
 



  





 Vi utvärderar löpande!

title: Sportsbook - Design Manager
description:
Looking for
 

 your next challenge?
 

 Betsson
 

 Sportsbook is now hiring!
 


  
 



  

**About the role** 
  



 As a Product Design Manager at Betsson you lead, mentor and facilitate, you will be responsible for a team of Product Designers. Together with the Head of Design and your team you’ll ensure the delivery of top-notch user-centric UI/UX for our Sportsbook Product. Your contributions will play a critical role in the overall success of the Sportsbook Product.
 

  
 



  



 You strive to constantly elevate our product by creating compelling, useful, engaging user interfaces, and experiences. Rooted in user data and in collaboration with both the business and tech side, you’ll together with your team explore and execute different design approaches, to aid specific user needs and compliance regulations on our various markets. All to ensure that the product flows logically and looks beautifully on any device or market across multiple brands serving millions of customers. 
 

  
 



  

**About us** 
  




 The
 

 Betsson
 

 Group’s mission is to put customers at the heart of our business through unrivalled customer experiences, and you will play a crucial part in achieving that mission. Our Sportsbook Platform is ours and developed in-house – from the Architecture to our Trading teams – we have an in-house platform which hosts our brands offering Sports betting for our customers. 
 


  
 



  

**Your responsibilities** 
  

  
* You
 

 facilitate
 

 growth and effective processes for your team
  
* You assume ownership and advocate proactively for improved UI/UX solutions to ensure our iGaming product is not only up to date, but market leading
  
* Together with your team you solve customer pain points where UI/UX improvements are based on data and user insights
  
* You collaborate closely with the Head of Design, other designers, research, product owners, stakeholders, QA, and developers.
 

 You’ll
 

 ensure effective ways of working for your team, strive for excellence while showing enthusiasm in a fast-paced ever evolving fun and supporting environment
  
* You
 

 maintain
 

 and develop our Design System in collaboration with your team to secure consistency and a
 

 state of the art
 

 design language throughout our product
  


  

**What you bring** 
  

  
* Ability to clearly communicate and demonstrate new workflows, solutions and ideas to the rest of the design team, stakeholders, and multidisciplinary team(s)
  
* Passionate about learning and educating people in your team and the company about design values
  
* You foster empathy, an ability to put other people’s interests first
  
* Proven knowledge about
 

 maintaining
 

 a mature Design System
  
* Extensive experience creating visually pleasing and interactive prototypes through industry standard software such as Figma or similar
  
* Experience as a Product Designer but also experience of successfully leading other Product Designers for complex digital products
  
* It would be considered an asset if you have experience working in the iGaming industry and if you have a genuine interest in Sports / Sports betting
  


  

 Where you'll be
   


 At Betsson Group we work with a Hybrid Work From Home (WFH) model, giving you the flexibility of working 3 days in the office and 2 days at home.
 


  

 What We Offer
   

  
* Monthly Allowance for Lunch
  
* Private & Life Plan Insurance for you and your family
  
* Team Building Budget
  
* Annual Wellness Allowance
  
* Corporate Travel Insurance
  
* Events and initiatives both Local (Quarterly Meetings) and Global
  
* Professional Development Programs & Internal Career Opportunities
  
* Milestone Birthday
  


  



 Much like riding a rollercoaster, sometimes life at Betsson can be lightning fast with twists and turns but always FUN! Then again, what else would you expect from a business 75% millennial and 1900 strong, spread across 7 offices! We recognize it may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you’re a go-getter, initiator and always striving to push the boundaries and challenge yourself, then you’ll fit right in.
 

  
 



  



 We offer numerous challenges where your skills will be put to good use! We encourage innovation, independence and celebrate success where you will be part of a multi-cultural and diverse company, with people from all over the world.
 

  
 



  


**Challenge Accepted?** 



  


***Check out the Betsson Group Blog to find out what our employees are talking about.***



  


***By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our***
***Privacy Policy***

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
Job description:
   

  


**Driven by our vision of 'Progress for Humanity' – at Hyundai we work relentlessly to make high-quality, environmentally-friendly mobility available for all. The industry is re-inventing itself and we plan to lead this change with zero-emission vehicles, electrified powertrains, hydrogen fuel cell technology, and smart cities.** 




**At Hyundai, we don't just build cars – we are a leader in future mobility. At Hyundai, you get the opportunity to work in an international, dynamic, and challenging environment, where you will be encouraged to push boundaries and challenge conventions. We believe that the future of our organization lies in the passion and capabilities of individual members, and we support and encourage the development of their full potential.** 




  
 



**About the job:** 




 You will lead the full scope of digital marketing nationally – covering both strategic direction and hands-on execution. You are responsible for creating and executing digital marketing and media plans that drive traffic, leads, and strong brand perception, while delivering the best possible customer experience. With a strong digital and data-driven mindset, you will continuously optimize the performance of our campaigns across all digital touchpoints, with clear ownership of digital KPIs and budget. 
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Own and execute digital marketing and media plans that support brand perception and drive performance across key KPIs, such as traffic, leads, and customer journey engagement.
* Have responsibility for the digital media budget, in close alignment with the Marketing Manager and Head of marketing and ensure effective media planning and optimization for ROI and ROAS.
* Drive execution of the national commercial and campaign plan from a digital perspective – ensuring digital activities are delivered on time, within budget, and with impact.
* Create briefs and lead collaboration with internal stakeholders and vendors across all digital channels (paid, owned, earned).
* Monitor, analyze, and report on digital campaign performance using tools like Google Analytics, Meta Ads Manager, and platform dashboards. Drive data-driven optimization and A/B testing. Together with vendors if needed.
* Plan and execute paid campaigns on Meta, YouTube, Google Ads, and programmatic platforms. Coordinate with CRM Specialist, Marketing Manager and vendors where needed.
* Ensure a seamless customer journey through smart use of digital touchpoints, UX, segmentation, and personalization – with a constant focus on improving conversion and engagement.
  

  


 Profile description:
   

  

**Required education, experience, and skills:** 
* Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a digital marketing role with both strategic and hands-on responsibilities.
* Proven experience in digital media buying (Meta, YouTube, Google Ads) and performance marketing with a track record of strong ROAS.
* Experience with tools such as Google Analytics (GA4), Meta Ads Manager, YouTube Studio, and A/B testing platforms.
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in marketing, digital communication, or a related field.
* Familiarity with programmatic advertising, marketing automation, and personalization strategies is a plus.
* Experience in handling AEM and Content management is an advantage.
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish and English.



**Desired** 
**Competencies:** 



* Strategic thinking and strong planning ability in a dynamic environment.
* Strong analytical skills and confidence using data to drive decisions.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, both internally and with external partners.
* Curious and proactive – always looking for new opportunities to grow our digital maturity and customer value.
* Results-oriented with high attention to detail and a problem-solving mindset.



 Become part of a global company with a history of success and ambitious plans for the future. Please apply by creating your candidate profile and attaching your application documents
 **in English.**

title: Samsung - CRO Analyst & UX Designer
description:
**Purpose of the role:** 




 We are seeking a CRO Analyst & UX Designer to enhance our eCommerce user experience, optimize interfaces using data insights from heatmaps, session recordings, and user flows.
 



  





  





**Job Scope & Key Deliverables:** 




 • User Experience & Interface Optimization: Design and refine high-converting, user-friendly eCommerce experiences, focusing on navigation, layout, and usability.
 



 • Data-Driven Enhancements: Analyse heatmaps, session recordings, and user flow reports to identify friction points and usability issues.
 



 • Landing Page & Funnel Design: Develop and test optimized page layouts, CTAs, and forms to drive better engagement and conversions.
 



 • Conversion-Focused UI Design: Ensure visual hierarchy, accessibility, and responsiveness are optimized for desktop and mobile users.
 



 • Cross-Team Collaboration: Work with site owners, Analysts, Developers, and Marketing to implement data-backed UX improvements.
 



 • Ongoing Optimization & Testing: Continuously test and improve design elements based on real-time data and user feedback.
 



  





  





**Role Tasks:** 




 • UX/UI Audits & Enhancements: Conduct usability audits, analyze heatmaps and user flows, and propose layout improvements.
 



 • A/B Testing & Experimentation: Design alternative UI elements, navigation structures, and CTA placements for testing.
 



 • Mobile-First & Responsive Design: Ensure seamless, mobile-optimized experiences that improve conversion rates.
 



 • Collaboration & Implementation Support: Work with developers to ensure proper execution of CRO and UX changes.
 



 • Reporting & UX Insights: Share UX findings and conversion insights with stakeholders, making recommendations for ongoing improvements.
 



  





  





**What makes this role interesting for a candidate?** 




 This role is perfect for someone who loves getting into the details, testing new ideas, and collaborating with a team to drive data-backed improvements.
 



 If you’re analytical, creative, and eager to make an impact, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





  





**Main competence:** 




 Analysing and Interpreting - Shows evidence of clear analytical thinking. Gets to the heart of complex problems and issues. Applies own expertise effectively. Quickly learns new technology. Communicates well in writing.
 



 Organising and Executing - Plans ahead and works in a systematic and organised way. Follows directions and procedures. Focuses on customer satisfaction and delivers a quality service or product to the agreed standards.
 



 Supporting and Co-operating - Supports others and shows respect and positive regard for them in social situations. Puts people first, working effectively with individuals and teams, clients and staff. Behaves consistently with clear personal values that complement those of the organization.
 



  





  





**Most relevant qualifications, education and training:** 




 • Degree in UX/UI Design, Business, Data Analytics, or a related field.
 



 • Experience in e-commerce, CRO, A/B testing, and UX optimization.
 



 • Familiarity with customer journey mapping and conversion funnel analysis.
 



  





  





**Most relevant previous work experience:** 




 • Strong understanding of user behavior, site navigation, checkout flows, and purchase patterns.
 



 • Hands-on experience with A/B testing, heatmap analysis, and usability testing tools.
 



 • Knowledge of customer journey mapping and conversion funnel analysis.
 



 • Experience working with Jira, Adobe Target, Adobe Analytics, Content Square, Figma.
 



 • Experience with content management systems and front-end UX implementation.
 



 • Ability to interpret data insights into actionable design improvements.
 



  





  





**Required language skills:** 




 • Fluency in English & Swedish
 



  





  





**Required travel days per year:** 




 • 10 days, to Poland
 



  





  





**How to apply:** 




  





  





 In this recruitment process, Samsung is working with Academic Search. For more question, please contact Consultant Manager, Ella Johansson, ella.johansson@academicsearch.se. You apply by clicking on the ”Apply now” button below, where you enter your personal details, enclose CV and cover letter written in English. All information is handled confidentially in accordance with Academic Search Integrity Policy as well as the new data protection act, GDPR. This means that we can only process applications coming through the applications system. Thank you for your understanding.
 



  





  





 Academic Search International is one of Scandinavia’s most merited companies within Executive Search & Interim Management. Our focus is people with documented manager- and specialist competences. We have close collaborations with national and international companies with strong brands and purpose. Our mission is to unite the best qualified candidates with the toughest challenges at the most interesting companies in Sweden. Our values are KNOWLEDGE, ENGAGEMENT, RESPONSIBILITY and COLLABORATION. Through these values, we make a difference in all our relationships. www.academicsearch.se

title: CRO Analyst/Content Specialist
company_industry: Wholesale Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics and Retail Appliances, Electrical, and Electronic Equipment
description:
We are currently looking for an CRO Analyst/Content Specialist to an exciting opportunity with our client Samsung! This is a consultancy opportunity starting as soon as possible and the assignment is until further notice.
 



  





**About the company:** 




*Help Us Create What Can´t Be Done* 




 Everything we do at Samsung is driven by an unyielding passion for excellence—and an unfaltering commitment to develop the best products and services on the market. In today´s fast-paced global economy, change is constant and innovation is critical to a company´s survival. As we have done for 80 years, we set our sights on the future, anticipating market needs and demands so we can steer our company toward long-term success.
 



  





**Purpose of the role:** 




 We´re looking for a hands-on CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) & Content Specialist to join our team and play a key role in optimizing our eStore´s conversion rates and user experience. You will be a part of the Marcom & CX team, involved in projects and improvements where specific skills and recommendations are needed. Working closely with site owner, marketing, UX, and data analytics, diving into analytics dashboards, run A/B tests, and refine on-page content to boost engagement and sales.
 



  





**Job Scope & Key Deliverables:** 



* End-to-End CRO Accountability: Own conversion rate optimization strategy together with other CX Team members, analysing customer behaviour and implementing data-driven improvements across the eStore.
* Experience & Content Optimization: Continuously refine key flows, A/B test layouts, and optimize on-page content to improve engagement and conversion.
* Data-Driven Decision Making: Use analytics tools to monitor performance, identify bottlenecks, and implement data-backed improvements.
* Traffic & Funnel Optimization: Ensure alignment between traffic sources and landing page experiences to maximize conversion rates.
* Performance Monitoring & Insights: Track key CRO metrics, including bounce rate, time on page, exit rates, and conversion paths.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Communicate test results, insights, and recommendations to leadership and cross-functional teams.
* Collaboration: Collaborate with European Office representatives - CRO consultants, analysts, and content specialists to drive initiatives and align on goals, timelines, and success metrics.



  





**Role Tasks:** 



* Daily Performance Monitoring: Review eStore analytics dashboards, track traffic trends, and analyze conversion funnels.
* A/B Testing & Experimentation: Develop A/B and conduct tests to optimize product pages, category layouts, and checkout flows.
* Content & Visual Merchandising: Update and test banners, product highlights, and promotional elements to ensure maximum engagement and click-through rates.
* Collaboration & Communication: Work closely with site owners Marketing, UX, and Data Analytics teams to align on optimization strategies.
* Reporting & Insights: Provide weekly/monthly reports on key CRO metrics, highlighting wins and areas for further testing.



  





**What makes this role interesting for a candidate?** 



* This role is perfect for someone who loves getting into the details, testing new ideas, and collaborating with a team to drive data-backed improvements.
* If you´re analytical, creative, and eager to make an impact, we´d love to hear from you!



  





**Main competence:** 



* Analysing and Interpreting - Shows evidence of clear analytical thinking. Gets to the heart of complex problems and issues. Applies own expertise effectively. Quickly learns new technology. Communicates well in writing.
* Organising and Executing - Plans ahead and works in a systematic and organised way. Follows directions and procedures. Focuses on customer satisfaction and delivers a quality service or product to the agreed standards.
* Supporting and Co-operating - Supports others and shows respect and positive regard for them in social situations. Puts people first, working effectively with individuals and teams, clients and staff. Behaves consistently with clear personal values that complement those of the organization.



  





**Most relevant qualifications, education and training:** 



* Degree in Business, Data Analytics, or related field
* Experience in e-commerce, CRO, A/B testing, and UX optimization
* Strong understanding of site navigation, checkout flows, and purchase behavior.
* Hands-on experience with A/B testing and analytics tools.
* Familiarity with customer journey mapping and conversion funnel analysis.



  





**Most relevant previous work experience:** 



* Comfortable with content management systems, analytics tools, and an ability to interpret data into clear next steps.
* Experience working with Jira, Adobe Target, Adobe Analytics, Content Square, Figma.
* Strong multitasking skills with experience managing CRO initiatives.
* Ability to communicate test results and insights to cross-functional teams.
* Analytical thinker with a passion for experimentation and continuous improvement.
* Skilled at identifying and solving conversion bottlenecks. Customer-focused and data-driven, with a strong drive to achieve results and exceed targets.
* Experience in preparing decision support materials for A/B test approval, ensuring alignment with objectives and guidelines to drive data-driven decision-making.



  





**Required language skills:** 



* Fluency in English & Swedish



  





**Required travel days per year:** 



* 10 days, to Poland



  





**Sounds interesting?** 




 If you are up for the challenge and reckon that this position fits your profile, we would like to hear from you. Apply today, as we are reviewing applications ongoingly and the position might be filled before the application deadline.

title: Enterprise Solution Architect
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 Do you want to be part of a team designing the architecture for Ericsson’s digital transformation? At Ericsson, we've identified a set of digital capabilities tied together in different customer and employee journeys. We aim to improve our customers’ experience and end-to-end workflow efficiency by using data, new innovative ways of working, and fit-for-purpose modern technology.
   

  

 As an Enterprise Solution Architect you will work in an agile team and be responsible for the design and blueprinting architecture, realized by internal software engineers or external vendors. You would be responsible for continuously matching business requirements, aligned with perspectives from business process, information architecture, data architecture and IT architecture along with focus on the functionality aspects. You are entrusted with creating business value, by balancing the functional requirements against other non-functional/quality requirements, by evaluating necessary priorities and compromises, while defining the best fit solution.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Ensure alignment with our target architecture and security directives, ranging from integration patterns to buy/build recommendations, guiding and steering agile development teams with architecture guardrails and advice.
* Present solution architecture to formal review boards when applicable.
* Influence and share architectural good practices within Group IT and across Ericsson.
* Be working in close collaboration with Product Owners, Business Analysts, Data Scientists, Service designers, UX designers, Software Engineers, Business SME's, Agile Coaches etc. as well as peer architect roles including Enterprise-, Security-, Business- and Information Architects.
* Be an ambassador for enterprise architecture and an active contributor in internal and external architecture communities.


**Skills You Bring**
* An understanding of how to build and implement full-stack enterprise-grade web and mobile solutions (cloud native, containers, public cloud PaaS services, security built-in, API first design etc.) as well as integration with Commercial-off-the-shelf and Software-as-a-Service solutions.
* Ability to collaborate with a diverse team of people from different backgrounds, field of expertise, level of seniority across different parts of the world.
* A genuine interest in technology, eager to learn and keep up with the latest trends like AI/ML, automation and public cloud.
* Well versed with Enterprise Architecture Modelling tools (such as LeanIX, ARIS, Sparx, Archi, etc.)
* Knowledge of Enterprise Architecture frameworks (such as TOGAF, Zachman, etc.)
* An Agile and experimentation mindset – where you would take informed decision quickly, seek feedback actively and adjust decisively.


**Nice to have**
* A background designing digital solutions for either Supply & Logistics, Sourcing, Finance/ERP, Telecom Network Roll-out or customer journey workflows in a B2B scenario.
* Expertise in digital contract platforms (e.g., DocuSign, Adobe Sign, CLM).
* Experience with leading CPQ platforms (e.g., Salesforce CPQ, Oracle CPQ).
* Strong in Supply Chain Planning and Integrated Business Planning.
* Knowledge/experience in BMC Helix, SuccessFactors, SAP S/4 systems
* Knowledge of integration patterns, data management and workflow automation.


**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 [[Sweden]] || [[Stockholm]]
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 [[Anitha Pulluru]]
   

  

**Hiring Manager:** 
 [[Khalid Cruz]]
   

  

 ]]>

title: SAP Fiori Developer
description:

 As an SAP Fiori Developer, you will be responsible for the
 **design, development, testing, and support** 
 of Fiori/UI5 applications within an
 **S/4HANA greenfield implementation project** 
 . Your role will involve close collaboration with functional teams, business users, and other developers to deliver high-quality user interfaces and seamless user experiences.
 



  





**Key responsibilities include:** 



* Develop and customize SAP Fiori/UI5 applications based on business requirements.
* Participate in the
 **end-to-end lifecycle** 
 of application development: requirements gathering, design, development, testing, deployment, and support.
* Work on
 **S/4HANA greenfield implementation projects** 
 , ensuring alignment with SAP best practices and Fiori guidelines.
* Collaborate with SAP functional consultants and business stakeholders to design modern and responsive UI/UX.
* Perform application troubleshooting, bug fixing, and performance tuning.
* Ensure quality and timely delivery of development activities as per project plans.
* Keep up to date with the latest trends and technologies in the SAP Fiori/UI5 and S/4HANA space.



  





**Required Skills & Qualifications:** 



* Minimum
 **10 years of experience** 
 in SAP UI/UX development, with a focus on
 **SAP Fiori and SAPUI5** 
 .
* Strong experience with
 **S/4HANA implementation projects** 
 —preferably greenfield setups.
* Proficient in HTML5, JavaScript, CSS, OData services, SAP Gateway, and Fiori Elements.
* Experience working with SAP Web IDE and SAP Business Application Studio.
* Familiarity with version control tools like Git and CI/CD practices.
* Good understanding of SAP backend technologies (ABAP knowledge is a plus).
* Excellent communication skills and ability to work in a multicultural team environment.
* Ability to contribute to
 **ongoing initiatives** 
 across the SAP landscape.

title: Senior Banknote Designer
company_industry: International Trade and Development, Paper and Forest Product Manufacturing, and Manufacturing
description:
Join Our Diverse Team At Crane Currency As a Senior Banknote Designer In Tumba Or Malta And Be a Part Of Our Journey Towards Innovation And Excellence. Who We Are
   

  

 Crane Currency is a premier industrial technology company and a pioneer in currency manufacturing and advanced micro-optics technology for securing physical products. Yes, chances are you have our product in your wallet right now! Our sophisticated equipment and software leverages proprietary core capabilities with detection and sensing technologies. Around the world, our customers trust us to anticipate their needs with innovative, reliable, and high-quality currency & authentication solutions and services—just as they have for generations.
   

  

**How You Will Make An Impact**
 This role provides you an opportunity where millions of people one day may be holding your design work. Our customers look to you and the global design team to bring their currency and security design dreams into reality. You will utilize your skills, and develop new ones, to design our customer's currency or security products. You will design functional works of art that will forever be embedded into history.
   

  

 In your role as a Banknote Designer at Crane Currency you will:
   

  

* Design Banknotes Create secure, visually appealing designs for new and existing banknotes. Develop design proposals and presentations for business.
* Create and prototype security features, ensuring their functionality and quality throughout the design process.
* Incorporate Security Features: Integrate advanced anti-counterfeiting measures into Banknote Designs to prevent fraud.
* Conduct Research: Investigate cultural and historical elements to incorporate into banknote designs, ensuring they are meaningful and relevant.
* Stay Updated on Trends: Keep abreast of the latest trends in design and security to continuously improve banknote designs.
* Collaborate with Stakeholders: Work with government officials, security experts, and printing companies to ensure designs meet all requirements.
* Increase the quantity and efficiency of the design team output and ensure the quality, creativity and innovation of the team’s output are at the highest level.


****Knowledge and expertise that matter most for this role:****
****Required:****
* 3-5-year University level education and/or working experience within Arts & Crafts, Graphic design, Fine arts, Product Design or similar.
* Minimum 3-5 years of experience in designing banknotes, security features and printing methods.
* Minimum 3-5 years of demonstrated experience in security software (Corvina, The One) and Adobe such as Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign.
* Experience in managing multiple work streams and meeting deadlines for customers and production through teamwork.
* Fluent in English, all other languages are a benefit.
* All candidates must submit a portfolio/personal website to be considered.


**Preferred** 
  

  

* Artistic graphic design talent with project management skills and a passion for learning and professional development.
* Experience as an effective communicator in design team collaborations, with strong interpersonal and graphic design skills.


****Malta - Benefits****
****How we will care for you:****
 We offer top-notch benefits including free health insurance, personal development opportunities, well-being and community engagement activities, competitive compensation, and a transport allowance. Discover more about our benefits here
   

  

****Tumba-Benefits****
**How We Will Care For You**
 We offer top-notch medical benefits including a wellness allowance and reimbursement for medicines and medical care, opportunities for personal development, community engagement activities, competitive compensation, vacation, parental leave, and multiple tiers of retirement plans. Discover more about our benefits here
   

  

**What Drives Our Team**
 We are a passionate team of 1,200 creators and problem solvers, united by our purpose, we give people confidence every day in moments that matter. This comes to life through our Shared Values:
   

  

* People Matter
* Do the Right Thing
* Trusted Partner
* Innovate for Growth
* Always Improving


**Learn More About Our Values And Culture**
 You can also check us out at:
   

  

**Where We Are**
*This role can be based in Tumba or Malta.*
 Information about Malta, Ħal Far: Ħal Far is the largest industrial estate in Malta. It is at the southern extreme of Malta, between the localities of Birżebbuġa , Safi and Żurrieq . Check out what makes Malta a great place to live and work here:
   

  

 Information about Tumba, Stockholm: Located in the historic Tumba Bruk area, ten-minute walking distance from the train station, 30 km south of Stockholm, and about 20 minutes from Stockholm Central Station. Check out what makes Tumba a great place to live and work here:
   

  

 Crane Currency is a drug free workplace.
   

  

 Crane NXT is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, national origin or any other characteristic protected under applicable local law.

title: Cyber Security Project Manager
description:
**About Us**



Integrity360 is one of Europe’s leading cyber security specialists operating from office locations spread out across Europe, providing a comprehensive range of professional, support and managed cyber security services for our 300+ clients. With four top-class Security Operation Centers, we offer a complete end-to-end security services covering our clients’ security from every angle. Our services include Managed Security, Cyber Security Testing, Incident Response, Security Integration, PCI Compliance and Cyber Risk & Assurance services.

  

What sets Integrity360 apart is our excellent team of people that drive the business forward. The company was founded with a focus on technical expertise and that philosophy remains today. The skills and experience in our company are some of the greatest in the industry and clients remain with Integrity360 because they can rely on and trust us to go above and beyond to ensure their needs are met. Listed multiple times on Gartner Market Guides for Managed Security Services.

 **Job Overview:**



We are seeking an experienced and highly-skilled Cyber Security Project Manager to oversee the planning, execution, and delivery of complex security projects within our organization. The successful candidate will have experience of managing straight consultancy projects, as well as onboarding new services into a Managed Services environment.



The role requires the management of cross-functional teams, coordinating with Presales, Professional Services and Service Delivery and key client stakeholders to ensure the successful deployment of security initiatives that protect IT infrastructure, data, and digital assets.

  

You will have a strong background in Project Management with a proven track record in cyber security, coupled with strong leadership skills and the ability to navigate a fast-paced and dynamic environment.



The successful candidate will have experience across a number of the technologies we provide, such as EDR, XDR, NDR, MDR, TVM, Firewalls etc and will ideally have delivered projects using products from class-leading vendors including Microsoft, Rapid7, CrowdStrike, Trellix, Sentinel One, Splunk, Qualys, DarkTrace, Vectra, Fortinet and Checkpoint.

  


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Project Management: Lead the end-to-end lifecycle of cyber security projects from handover to completion, including initiation, planning, execution, monitoring, and closure, aligning with business goals and security objectives.
* Stakeholder Management: Collaborate with internal teams, clients, external vendors and senior leadership to define project requirements, timelines and deliverables. Communicate project status, risks, and issues to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
* Risk Management: Identify and assess security risks throughout the project lifecycle. Develop and implement mitigation strategies to address risks and ensure minimal impact to project timelines and organizational security posture.
* Team Coordination: Work closely with cybersecurity engineers, analysts, IT staff, and third-party vendors to ensure seamless collaboration and resource allocation. Facilitate project team meetings and track progress against milestones.
* Security Requirements Management: Ensure that all projects adhere to internal security policies, industry standards, and regulatory requirements (e.g., GDPR, NIST, ISO 27001).
* Budget and Resource Management: Oversee the project budget, ensuring efficient use of resources. Track project expenditures and adjust project plans as necessary to meet budgetary constraints.
* Documentation & Reporting: Maintain comprehensive project documentation, including project plans, RAID logs, project change documentation, risk/issue acceptance, progress reports, and post-implementation reviews. Provide regular updates to executive leadership on project health and security posture improvements.
* Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities to enhance processes and practices, contributing to the overall improvement of the organization’s project delivery function.

  


**Qualifications:**


* Education: Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Cybersecurity, Computer Science, or a related field. A Master’s degree or professional certifications (e.g., PMP, CISSP, CISM, CISA) is a plus.
* Experience:
	+ At least five years experience managing IT projects, including a minimum of two years managing cyber security projects, preferably within large enterprise environments.
	+ A minimum of two years experience of working within a Managed Services environment, delivering multiple concurrent projects to a range of clients operating in multiple sectors.
* Technical Skills:
	+ Strong understanding of cyber security concepts, risk management and security frameworks (e.g., NIST, ISO 27001, CIS Controls).
	+ Familiarity with security technologies such as firewalls, intrusion detection systems (IDS), endpoint protection, encryption, identity and access management (IAM) and security information and event management (SIEM).
	+ Experience with cloud security, application security and network security is highly desirable.
* Project Management Skills:
	+ Expertise in project management methodologies (Waterfall, Agile etc.).
	+ Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining quality and deadlines.
	+ Strong organizational, time management and multitasking skills.
* Communication Skills:
	+ Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex cyber security concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
	+ Strong presentation skills and the ability to lead meetings and briefings with executives.
* Certifications (Preferred):
	+ Prince2 Practitioner
	+ PMP (Project Management Professional)
	+ CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional)
	+ CISM (Certified Information Security Manager)
	+ ITIL or other relevant certifications.

**Personal Attributes:**


* Strong leadership and team-building skills, with a collaborative and solution-oriented approach.
* Analytical mindset with an ability to proactively identify and address potential issues.
* Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines while maintaining a focus on security best practices.
* Detail-oriented and highly organized, with the ability to manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.

title: Systemingenjör - IT-Infrastruktur
description:
Vill du vara en av oss som jobbar för ett starkare försvar av Sverige? Framtidens utmaningar och hot ställer nya krav på oss, vilket gör att Försvarsmakten är under omvandling och tillväxt.


**Vi erbjuder dig**  

I Försvarsmakten finns en stark värdegrund som bygger på öppenhet, resultat och ansvar. Verksamheten erbjuder stor variation och komplexitet samt stora krav på IT-säkerhet vilket innebär goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och förutsättningar för intern karriärrörlighet. Våra anställda har ett flertal olika förmåner, bland annat:


* Kompetensutveckling utifrån verksamhetens behov och individuella karriärsmål
* Tre timmar träning i veckan på arbetstid samt ersättning för träningskläder och startavgifter
* Bra balans mellan arbete och fritid med flexibel arbetstid samt 28 - 35 semesterdagar beroende på ålder
* Lönetillägg vid föräldraledighet och VAB samt möjlighet att växla semesterdagar mot extra pensionsavsättning


**Om enheten**  

Ledningsstödsenheten (LSE) stödjer i huvudsak ledningar och staber på militärstrategisk-, operativ- och taktisk nivå men även FM som helhet och  

garnisonsknutna OrgE. Stödet genomförs på ett sådant sätt att de olika staberna och ledningarna kan verka med sina ledningsstödsystem dygnet runt, året om.


**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**  

Som systemingenjör med inriktning IT-infrastruktur har du en viktig roll där du tillsammans med dina kollegor är delaktiga i införandet av nya tekniska lösningar för Försvarsmakten samt vidmakthåller och förvaltar befintliga tekniska lösningar. Vi arbetar i en utvecklande miljö präglat av ambition, teknisk kompetens och möjlighet till personlig utveckling. Vi söker dig som gärna tar dig an nya utmaningar och med ansvarskänsla arbetar lösningsorienterat. Du kommer ansvara för och delta i arbetet med drift och teknisk förvaltning av delar av Försvarsmaktens IT-infrastruktur. Du kommer bl.a. att arbeta med drift och incidenter, design, framtagande av konfigurationsanvisningar, policys och förvaltning av ingående komponenter. Du jobbar i ett team som består av skickliga och erfarna kollegor som hjälper dig at komma in i rollen på bästa sätt. Arbetet är omväxlande och utförs i huvudsak i Försvarsmaktens lokaler på Gärdet i Stockholm. En stor del av våra uppdrag bedrivs i projektform där du förväntas agera som teknisk rådgivare och delprojektledare.

  

**Kvalifikationer**


* Eftergymnasial utbildning med inriktning mot IT/Teknik och datakommunikation  

eller motsvarande kunskaper som av arbetsgivaren bedöms likvärdiga
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av utveckling, drift eller förvaltning av tekniska system
* Generellt goda kunskaper inom IT- och nätverksteknik
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att arbete i komplexa och säkerhetstunga IT-miljöer
* God förmåga att kommunicera i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska
* B-körkort
  


**Personliga egenskaper**  

Vi söker dig som är engagerad och serviceinriktad. Du är van att leda och engagera och har en stor personlig drivkraft. Du är prestigelös, hjälpsam och har god analytisk förmåga. Du är kvalitetsmedveten, utvecklingsorienterad och har sinne för ordning och god planering. Stor vikt kommer att läggas vid personlig lämplighet.


**Meriterande**


* Relevant arbetslivserfarenhet av arbetsledning alternativt projektledning
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av att arbeta med signalskyddsnära IT-säkerhetsprodukter t.ex. brandväggar och kryptosystem
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av Försvarsmaktens IT-infrastruktur, både mjukvara och hårdvara
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av Försvarsmaktens ledningsstödssystem
* Kunskap om operativsystem för servrar och virtualisering
* Erfarenhet av förvaltning av tekniska system inom IT/Telecom
* Erfarenhet av IT-säkerhetsarbete / Utbildning inom IT-säk
* Erfarenhet av arbete med produkter såsom Cisco, Aruba, Fortinet och Palo Alto
* Vana att arbeta processorienterat (tex. ITIL)
* Genomförd militär grundutbildning

**Övrigt**  

Arbetsort: Stockholm.  

Befattningen är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid som civilt anställd och inleds med sex månaders provanställning för dig som inte är anställd inom Försvarsmakten.  

Resor och beredskap i tjänsten förekommer.  

Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.  

Individuell lönesättning tillämpas.


**Upplysningar om befattningen**


Vill du veta mer om befattningen är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Fredrik Ulvstig.  

För upplysningar angående anställningsvillkor kontakta HR-generalist Diana Oros


08-788 75 00 (växel).

  

  

**Fackliga företrädare**


SACO Agneta Landquist  

OFR/S Martin Sparr  

OFR/O Heikki Videll  

SEKO Matz Felix  

  

Samtliga nås genom växeln: 08-788 75 00.

**Ansökan**  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-05-23.**
company_description: Försvarsmakten är en svensk statlig förvaltningsmyndighet som ansvarar för landets säkerhet.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Our mission is to deliver breakthrough products that enable and empower those that own and operate the supply chains of the world. Our vision and mission drive everything that we do and are at the core of our strategy. Our people sit at the centre of all of this.


WiseTech Global provides the world’s most comprehensive solution for companies operating in the increasingly complex world of logistics. It has never been a more important time for organisations to have a resilient supply chain. Our industry-leading flagship product, CargoWise, is centralising logistics operations on a single global database, delivering business continuity, scalability and security.


At the very core of this is our CargoWise Native Customs functionality. This platform accounts for over 75% of global manufactured trade flows, a number that is growing year on year. Our target is for this to get to 90%. To help facilitate this growth, we are looking for ambitious engineers, who want to solve deeply complex problems with others of a similar mindset. The work you do in this team has a genuine, meaningful real world impact.


We trust our developers to get the job done with minimal distractions and micromanagement. We empower our people to grow and develop continuously throughout their career and view everyone as potential people leaders. Problem solving skills, curiosity and passion are the key skills we look for in our Engineers, but for your own interest the technology you can expect to work on will be:


* Working across MS technologies such as C#, SQL Server and ASP.Net
* Strong approach to quality, using Test Driven Development
* Experience with CI/CD
* Understanding of design patterns on principles of design


If you have what it takes to connect the unconnected and tie together the many moving parts of the world’s supply chains - then apply. Link your GitHub or your Stack Overflow account. Stand out in your application, and we will help you stand out in your career.


#### **About WiseTech Global**


Having listed on the ASX in 2016, WiseTech Global is now an ASX 50, AU$15 billion+ company that is serious about expansion and technical innovation. Through a combination of organic growth and targeted acquisitions, our global employee head count has increased rapidly, and we’re far from slowing down.


We are known for our vibrant, dynamic workplace where personal and professional fulfilment and company success go hand in hand. Working at WiseTech provides you with the ability to work in an industry leading culture with high levels of autonomy and ownership.


#### **Before you Apply**


*From time to time, WiseTech Global may use an external service provider to assess applications on our behalf. Accordingly, by applying for this role and providing your personal information to WiseTech Global, you consent to WiseTech Global providing this information to our external service providers who are required to treat such information with strict confidentiality in line with privacy and data protection laws and regulations.*

title: Universitetsadjunkt i datavetenskap
description:
Välkommen till Linnéuniversitetet! Här möter du 2 200 medarbetare och 40 000 studenter som tillsammans följer visionen att sätta kunskap i rörelse för en hållbar samhällsutveckling. Hos oss bedrivs forskning och utbildning med blicken mot framtiden. Vår närhet till näringsliv, både lokalt och globalt, ger oss lång räckvidd och möjlighet till förändring som skapar avtryck. Allt som behövs är en plats där idéer får utrymme att mötas och växa. Det är det vi skapat – och du är inbjuden.  

  

Change starts here!  




Fakulteten för teknik har en bred verksamhet som spänner över nio olika institutioner genom vilka Linnéuniversitetet tillhandahåller utbildning och bedriver forskning. Utbildningarna inom teknik omfattar allt från korta utbildningar på några få veckor eller månader till femåriga civilingenjörsutbildningar. Forskningen svarar upp mot samhällets behov inom flera breda fält med grundläggande forskning och tillämpad forskning i samverkan med samhällets aktörer.



Institutionen för datavetenskap och medieteknik ansvarar för ett stort antal utbildningar på grund- och avancerad nivå inom datavetenskap, mjukvaruutveckling och medieteknik. Institutionen har utbildningsprogram på grund- och avancerad nivå samt civilingenjörsprogram.



Institutionen för datavetenskap och medieteknik bedriver forskning kopplad till Linnaeus University Centre for Data Intensive Sciences and Applications (DISA, https://lnu.se/disa). DISA är Linnéuniversitetets spetsforskningsmiljö som arbetar med insamling, analys och nyttogörande av stora datamängder. Centrat har sin tyngdpunkt inom datavetenskap, men har ett mångvetenskapligt perspektiv genom ett samarbete mellan forskare från universitetets samtliga fakulteter.


**Ämnesområde för befattningen:** *Datavetenskap.*


**Placeringsort tillsvidare:** Placeringsort *Växjö*. Eftersom Linnéuniversitetet finns i både Växjö och Kalmar förekommer resor mellan orterna.


**Anställningens omfattning:** 100%, *tillsvidare*


**Tillträde:** Tillträde enligt överenskommelse. I normalfallet tillämpas provanställning.


### **Arbetsbeskrivning:**


### **Arbetsuppgifterna omfattar i huvudsak undervisning, akademisk administration, samverkansuppdrag och egen kompetensutveckling**



Undervisningen består av kurser inom ämnesområdet datavetenskap med särskild inriktning på kurser inom grundläggande programmering och systemutveckling. Förutom undervisning och kursutveckling ingår viss handledning av projektarbeten och handledarskap av examensarbeten. Ämnet bedriver utbildningar förlagda på campus såväl som på distans under vår-, sommar- och hösttermin.



En del av tjänsten omfattar den del av institutionens verksamhet som sker i samverkan med näringsliv, offentliga institutioner och civilsamhället. Adjunkten förväntas även arbeta med den egna kompetensutvecklingen i nära anslutning till någon av institutionens forskningsmiljöer och projekt.


### **Behörighet**



Behörig att anställas som universitetsadjunkt vid Linnéuniversitetet är den som har avlagt magisterexamen i datavetenskap eller har motsvarande kompetens, samt visat pedagogisk skicklighet. Med motsvarande kompetens avses i regel examen från lärarutbildning mot skolans senare år och gymnasiet, eller utländskt universitet med i huvudsak samma nivå och kvalitet som svensk magisterexamen i datavetenskap.



Utöver visad pedagogisk skicklighet ska den sökande ha genomgått en högskolepedagogisk utbildning eller bedömts ha motsvarande skicklighet.



För behörighet till denna anställning krävs dessutom yrkeserfarenhet som lärare, utbildare eller utvecklare inom tjänstens ämne – datavetenskap – och särskilda inriktning mot programmering och systemutveckling.



För denna anställning krävs god förmåga att undervisa på svenska, samt god förmåga att uttrycka sig skriftligt och muntligt på svenska.



För denna anställning krävs dessutom visad samarbetsförmåga och administrativ kompetens.


### **Bedömningsgrunder**



Som bedömningsgrunder vid anställning av en universitetsadjunkt ska graden av skicklighet som är ett krav för behörighet för anställning gälla.



Utöver behörighet (se ovan) ses som särskilt meriterande dokumenterad erfarenhet från specifika teknikområden inom datavetenskap såsom programmering, webbutveckling, databaser, datorteknik eller inbyggda system. Erfarenhet från akademisk administration är också särskilt meriterande.



När universitetet anställer nya lärare ska de sökande väljas som genom en kvalitativ helhetsbedömning bedöms ha de bästa förutsättningarna att genomföra och utveckla aktuella arbetsuppgifter samt bidra till en framgångsrik utveckling av verksamheten.


### **Kontaktpersoner:**



Prefekt, Arianit Kurti, arianit.kurti@lnu.se, 0470 70 83 75



Ämnesföreträdare Welf Löwe, welf.lowe@lnu.se, 0470 70 84 95



HR-partner: Erika Hjelmer, erika.hjelmer@lnu.se, 0470 82 06



Välkommen in med din ansökan. Sista dag för ansökan är 20 maj 2025.


Linnéuniversitetet har ambitionen att tillvarata de kvaliteter som en jämn könsfördelning och mångfald tillför organisationen.  

  

Registrera din ansökan via knappen "Ansök" längst ned i annonsen. Din ansökan ska utformas enligt Mall för ansökan som du hittar i Kompletterande riktlinjer -  

Anställningsordning under rubriken "viktiga dokument" längst ned under annonsen. De meriter Du åberopar ska Du styrka med intyg och de ska bifogas digitalt i din ansökan. Övriga handlingar, t ex olika typer av vetenskapliga arbeten, ska skickas in digitalt tillsammans med ansökan. Ansökan och övriga handlingar ska märkas med anställningens diarienummer. Alla handlingar som åberopas ska vara inkomna till universitetet senast kl. 23.59 sista ansökningsdagen.  

  

Vi undanber oss telefonsamtal från försäljare av jobbannonser.  

  

  

Linnéuniversitetet är en arbetsgivare som uppfyller kraven i den Europeiska stadgan för forskare och följer riktlinjerna för rekrytering. Därför har universitetet fått HR Excellence in Research-certifieringen.  

  

Vänligen notera att legitimation ska uppvisas vid intervjutillfället.

  

  

Länk till den här sidan  

https://lnu.se/mot-linneuniversitetet/jobba-hos-oss/lediga-jobb/?rmpage=job&rmjob=8543&rmlang=SE

title: Intermediate Software Engineer (DevOps)
description:
**What makes us Qlik****?**  

A Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ Leader for 14 years in a row, Qlik transforms complex data landscapes into actionable insights, driving strategic business outcomes. Serving over 40,000 global customers, our portfolio leverages pervasive data quality and advanced AI/ML capabilities that lead to better decisions, faster.  

We excel in integration and governance solutions that work with diverse data sources, and our real-time analytics uncover hidden patterns, empowering teams to address complex challenges and seize new opportunities. **The****Intermediate** **Software Engineer (****DevOps****)****Role**  

As an Intermediate Software Engineer (DevOps) in the Platform Engineering team, we develop a platform for R&D, based on Kubernetes on AWS, to enable them to use a ‘production-like’ environment to develop and test new features and fixes there, run the full system test cycle, and deliver quickly.  

We also develop, manage, and maintain the strategic Qlik SaaS service pipeline flow and services. We own and automate the service release process, using build tools and Git actions that build and create, test, and deploy docker images into staging and production environments.  

You will be part of a critical team, focused on developing and maintaining CI/CD solutions for development and SRE teams, using new technology and current tools in the AWS environment, and building the next generation pipeline toward a SaaS environment. We currently have many goals to achieve, as we seek to improve efficiency for ourselves and the organization by focusing on automation and streamlining.  

It is an exciting time to join the team as we are currently designing some new internal processes and running POCs on new and current tools and solutions in the AWS environment.**Here’s how you’ll be making an impact:**  

* Develop solutions for CI/CD for our Saas product in an AWS environment.
* Develop and maintain an organization-wide ’production-like’ environment for service development and QA teams.
* Collaborate with the development teams and with SRE teams to supply a stable deployment solution.
* Developing Internal Developer Portals, like Backstage or Port.
* Support the R&D organization as an expert on our development toolset, and solve production problems efficiently.

 **We’re looking for a teammate with:**  

* Deep knowledge of Kubernetes.
* Experience with the AWS Cloud environment.
* Knowledge of the GitOps methodology and SaaS processes.
* Experience working with the GitHub API, GitHub actions and workflows.
* General programming skills in languages like Typescript, java, GO or equivalent, using json and yaml.
* Experience developing and managing CI/CD processes.
* Experience with process automation and scripting
* Managing infrastructure with code using tools like Crossplane, Terraform, Pulumi.
* GitOps and tools like ArgoCD.

 **Th****e****l****ocation** **for this role is****:**  

Lund, Sweden **Apply** **now and** **help** **change** **how** **the world****transforms complex data landscapes into action****able ins****ights and turns complex data challenges into new opportunities!** **More about Qlik and who we are****:**  

Find out more about life at Qlik on social: Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube, and X/Twitter, and to see all other opportunities to join us and our values, check out our Careers Page.  

What else do we offer?  

* Genuine career progression pathways and mentoring programs
* Culture of innovation, technology, collaboration, and openness
* Flexible, diverse, and international work environment

  

Giving back is a huge part of our culture. Alongside an extra “change the world” day plus another for personal development, we also highly encourage participation in our Corporate Responsibility Employee Programs ***If you need assistance applying for a role due to a disability, please submit your request via email to*** ***accessibilityta*** ***@*** ***qlik.com******.*** ***Any information you provide will be treated according to Qlik’s*** ***Recruitment Privacy Notice******. Qlik may only respond to emails related to accommodation requests.***  

Qlik is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Qlik via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Qlik. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Qlik as a result of the referral or through other means.
company_description: Qlik is a global software company headquartered in King of Prussia, Pennsylvania. Qlik provides an end-to-end, real-time data integration and analytics cloud platform.

title: IT-säkerhetsarkitekt
description:
**Soros Consulting söker IT-säkerhetsarkitekt** 

Vi söker en erfaren **IT-säkerhetsarkitekt** med minst **10 års erfarenhet** av liknande roller.

**Om uppdraget:**

Du kommer att:

* Medverka i utvecklingen av IT-säkerhetsenhetens arkitekturarbete.
* Leda och samordna utvecklingen av nya IT-säkerhetstjänster, inklusive personalledning.
* Arbeta med arkitekturer för moderna IT-infrastrukturer och applikationssäkerhet.
* Modellera olika säkerhetsarkitekturer och utveckla kontrollmekanismer samt uppföljningsverktyg.
* Ansvara för och genomföra komplexa IT-revisioner.
* Projektleda komplexa förändringsprojekt inom IT-säkerhet.
* Konsultativt stödja komplexa verksamheter inom IT-säkerhet.

**Kompetenskrav:**

* Minst 10 års relevant erfarenhet av IT- och informationssäkerhet.
* Minst 10 års erfarenhet som IT-revisor inom komplexa säkerhetslösningar.
* Erfarenhet av arbete och kravställning av IT-tjänster mellan offentliga organisationer.
* Minst 10 års erfarenhet av ledarskap inom IT- och informationssäkerhet, exempelvis som CISO, CIO/IT-chef eller liknande.

**Meriterande:**

* Tidigare roll som CIO eller IT-chef.
* Tidigare roll som IT-säkerhetschef vid statlig myndighet.
* Erfarenhet från myndighetsgemensamma projekt och samarbeten.
* Erfarenhet av offentlig sektor där IT-tjänster köps av annan offentlig organisation.

**Personliga egenskaper:**

* Metodisk och helhetstänkande.
* Social och kommunikativ, en naturlig kontaktpunkt för olika intressenter.
* Samarbetande och lösningsorienterad i komplexa intressesituationer.

**Plats:** Stockholm (viss remote kan förekomma)  
**Start:** Efter genomförd säkerhetsprövning

**Omfattning:** HeltidVill du vara med och utveckla framtidens IT-säkerhet i en samhällsviktig verksamhet?  
Ansök snarast – vi går igenom ansökningar löpande!

Jobbtyp: Heltid

Erfarenhet:

* liknande roller.: 10 år (Obligatoriskt)

Arbetsort: På plats

title: Data & Cloud Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about transforming data into scalable, secure, and intelligent solutions? We are hiring Senior and Principal Data Engineers to join exciting projects at the forefront of analytics and innovation in the automotive and mobility sectors.

**What You’ll Do:**

* Design, build, and maintain scalable batch and streaming data pipelines.
* Engineer robust ETL workflows and medallion architecture-based data lakehouses.
* Develop and deploy data solutions using Python, PySpark, SQL, Airflow, and Databricks.
* Use and manage tools across Azure, AWS, Docker, and Linux environments.
* Operate with CI/CD principles using Git, DevOps, and Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
* Ensure data quality, security, and system performance via monitoring and validation.
* Work on advanced BI dashboards in Power BI.

**What we are looking for:**

* 6+ years of data engineering experience for senior roles; more for principal roles.
* Strong coding background in Python, SQL, and Shell scripting.
* Proficiency with cloud services like Azure Data Factory, AWS (Redshift, EMR, S3).
* Experience in data modeling and business intelligence.
* Comfortable with DevOps workflows and data platform operations.
* Strong communication skills and team-first mindset.
* Fluent in English

 **Nice to Have:**

* Experience with Power BI dashboards and BI project leadership.
* Familiarity with automotive data systems.
* Hands-on experience with regression, security, and system upgrade testing.


**Why Work With Us?**


You'll contribute to future-facing initiatives in autonomous driving, electric mobility, and global BI solutions. Whether it's within a startup environment or a powerhouse like the big automotive companies in Gothenburg , your work will directly impact the vehicles and technologies of tomorrow.  

  

Ready to make a data-driven difference? Apply now and power the future with us.

title: IT-Specialist Operations Center
description:
Do you have an eye for detail and are driven by ensuring that critical systems and services function flawlessly? Would you like to be part of a team at the heart of a leading online platform for trading and savings? We are looking for an IT-Specialist to join our Operations Center who shares our passion for security, stability, and efficiency.

**About the Role**  

As an IT-Specialist in our Operations Center, you will play a central role in ensuring that our critical systems are functioning optimally. You will monitor and analyze our services in real-time, quickly identify deviations, and take necessary actions to minimize the impact on the business. You will monitor our systems and services to proactively identify and manage issues before they affect operations.


You will also be responsible for:

* Managing incidents from initial identification to resolution, and communicating status and actions to relevant stakeholders.
* Working with technical support and coordinating with internal teams and external partners to ensure fast and effective problem resolution.
* Documenting events, solutions, and improvement suggestions to contribute to continuous improvements in our processes.
  


You will be part of our Operations Center team within our Operations Platform area, alongside four skilled colleagues, and play an important role in creating a stable and reliable operational environment while also contributing to the development and improvement of our processes for incident management and system monitoring.

**Who We Are Looking For**  

To fit this role as an IT-Specialist, we are looking for someone with experience in monitoring and incident management who wants to work on improving processes and workflows. To be successful in this position, we believe you need to thrive in a dynamic environment where you can use your analytical skills and solution-focused mindset to ensure stability and operational reliability. You are a communicative and service-oriented person who finds it easy to collaborate with others and can handle stressful situations in a structured manner.


We would prefer if you have:

* Experience in monitoring and incident management in an IT environment, preferably within banking, finance, or other business-critical industries.
* A basic technical understanding of networks, servers, and applications.
* Experience with monitoring tools and incident management systems.
* Experience working in cloud environments, preferably with a focus on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Fluency in Swedish, both spoken and written


To succeed in this role, you need to have the ability to make quick and well-founded decisions under pressure. You possess excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset, which makes you enjoy working with various teams and stakeholders. Additionally, you have a solution-oriented mindset to ensure efficient and stable operations.

**Application**:  

Submit your application by clicking the "Apply Now" button below the job posting. Please send your application as soon as possible, as the selection process is ongoing, but no later than 25/5. We do not accept applications via email due to GDPR. Feel free to contact Björn Lindholm, Engineering Manager, at bjorn.lindholm@avanza.se if you have any questions about the position.


Welcome with your application!

*Offers from recruitment agencies/advertisers are discouraged.*
