title: Account Manager
description:
**Är du – eller vill du växa och bli – en säljare i världsklass? Fenix Projects söker Account Managers till vårt kontor vid Stureplan i Stockholm. Vi ser på försäljning som vilken elitidrott som helst och är du redo att satsa seriöst lovar vi att hjälpa till att utveckla dig till en av mediebranschens främsta säljare.** 




**Fenix grundades 2013 och är i dag ett av Nordens ledande bolag inom affärsutveckling och försäljning av media. Vår affärsidé är att ständigt utveckla, förbättra och introducera nya marknadsföringskoncept tillsammans med stora publicister som Dagens Nyheter och Dagens industri.** 




  





**Vad vi förväntar oss av dig** 




 Som Account Manager hos oss förväntas du inte bara göra snabba affärer utan också skapa långsiktiga hållbara samarbeten. Vi sätter kundens bästa i fokus och strävar alltid efter att erbjuda de mest attraktiva produkterna på marknaden.
 



  





**Vi erbjuder dig** 




 Generös provisionsmodell: Vi erbjuder en fast marknadsmässig lön i kombination med en generös provisionsmodell. Vi tror på att premiera hög prestation och hårt arbete.
 



  





**Försäljning:** 
  Du kommer att erbjuda de mest innovativa medielösningarna som marknaden har att erbjuda. Vår produktportfölj består i dagsläget av innovativa och nytänkande lösningar inom digital native advertising och print.
 



  





**Teamet:** 
 Du får möjligheter att arbeta i ett team med några av Sveriges bästa mediesäljare, där vissa har över tio års erfarenhet inom framgångsrik försäljning och affärsutveckling inom media. Du är en teamplayer!
 



 En rolig arbetsplats: Vi värderar glädje på jobbet och arrangerar regelbundet olika aktiviteter, resor, tävlingar, after works, konferenser och temadagar. You name it.
 



  





**Personlig utveckling:** 
 Vi investerar i våra medarbetare och erbjuder flera utbildningsprogram samt regelbundna gästföreläsningar av Sveriges främsta experter inom försäljning, entreprenörskap och ledarskap.
 



 Spännande arbete i en växande organisation: Vi strävar efter att bli bäst inom varje område och erbjuder en platt organisation där du har möjlighet att bidra, växa och påverka bolagets utveckling.
 



  





**Karriärmöjligheter:** 
  Vi tror på individuell tillväxt och erbjuder dig möjligheter att forma din egen framtid hos oss. Det är du som bestämmer hur långt du vill gå, tex alla våra Sales Managers har börjat som Account Manager.
 



  





**Vi tycker det är ett plus om du har erfarenhet inom försäljning sedan tidigare men det är inget krav från vår sida. För oss är det viktigast att hitta dig som har talang och rätt attityd för att snabbt utvecklas i en högpresterande organisation.** 




  





**Vi söker dig som** 




 - Är topp-presterare: Du ser dig själv som en topp-presterande individ, oavsett om det är inom arbetslivet, studier, idrott eller på annat sätt.
 



 - Är resultatorienterad: Du är tävlingsinriktad och älskar att arbeta med tempo mot högt uppsatta mål.
 



 - Är strukturerad: Du är punktlig och har självdisciplin. Det är avgörande för att navigera i en dynamisk säljmiljö.
 



 - Är kommunikativ: Du kommer dagligen att interagera med beslutsfattare inom näringslivet. Det är viktigt att du kan uttrycka dig på ett välformulerat sätt, både i tal och skrift.
 



  





**Vill du bli bäst inom medieförsäljning och samtidigt forma din egen karriär, tveka inte att kontakta oss. Vi letar efter dig!** 




  





 Är det något du undrar över så kontakta gärna
 *Linda Wells 070 410 33 04, annars sök redan idag då vi anställer så fort vi hittar rätt!* 




  





 Läs gärna om Stina hos oss https://futuremediagroup.com/news/stina-fann-sitt-ovantade-dromjobb-som-saljare-det-var-nagot-jag-inte-riktigt-hade-sett-tidigare

title: Global Social Content Planner
company_industry: Marketing Services, Retail Apparel and Fashion, and Advertising Services
description:
**WE ARE LOOKING FOR** 




 We are looking for a Global Social Content Planner to join our inhouse Global Social Media team - a unique opportunity to shape the voice of a global, dynamic and fast-paced fashion brand that are on an exciting journey. Are you a structured strategist with a passion for social storytelling, content planning, and fashion?
 



  





 You are a detail-oriented doer with a creative edge, someone who thrives on managing complexity and turning strategies into action. You have a deep understanding of the social and digital ecosystem, know how to navigate multiple information flows from different stakeholders, and bring sharp judgment to content planning decisions that maximize impact.
 



  





**RESPONSIBILITIES AND TASKS** 




 As our Global Social Content Planner, you will be the driving force behind our social content planning. Working closely with cross-functional teams, you will ensure that our brand voice is consistent, relevant, and impactful across all digital touchpoints. From high-level seasonal calendars to reactive moments – you connect it all and ensure plans are always up to date.
 



  





**Your main responsibilities include, but are not limited to:** 



* Translate full-funnel marketing strategies into cohesive content calendars for paid and organic social channels.
* Lead the global content planning process—seasonal, monthly, weekly, and daily—ensuring alignment with brand priorities and key cultural and fashion moments.
* Manage and prioritize incoming information and requests from multiple stakeholders to build clear, actionable plans.
* Proactively make recommendations to optimize the publishing schedule and maximize content performance across platforms.
* Collaborate closely with marketing, creative, and media teams to ensure synergy across campaigns and touchpoints.
* Leverage data, audience insights, and platform best practices to refine planning and improve engagement.



  





**QUALIFICATIONS** 



* 3+ years of experience in content planning, social media management, ideally within fashion, retail, lifestyle, or agency environments.
* Proven ability to plan and manage 360° content across various social channels and ideally in more markets.
* Outstanding attention to detail, with a strong ability to organize, prioritize, and manage multiple projects and timelines.
* Strong judgment and a strategic mindset - you can recommend adjustments based on performance, trends, and business priorities.
* Deep knowledge of major social platforms (Instagram, TikTok, Pinterest, YouTube, Snap) and their content best practices.
* Expert at summarizing complex plans, visualizing them clearly in presentations and charts, and keeping them updated.
* A collaborative, proactive spirit, comfortable working across fast-moving cross-functional teams.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.



  





**OTHER INFORMATION** 




 It’s a temporary position, full time with start asap in May, 2025 and 6 month ahead. You will be based at H&M headquarters in Stockholm. Please apply as soon as possible!

title: AI/ML Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

* Lead technical planning and execution of ML engineering work, ensuring models and systems are delivered reliably and at scale.
* Translate data science outputs into production-grade machine learning pipelines using Python and AWS.
* Collaborate closely with the Lead Data Scientist to ensure handoff from modeling to deployment is smooth and robust.
* Design and maintain ML infrastructure using AWS SageMaker, S3, Lambda, Step Functions, etc.
* Define and own technical architecture for model deployment, monitoring, and retraining workflows.
* Manage technical sprint planning, task assignment, and capacity planning for the ML engineering team.
* Drive code quality, reproducibility, and automation in model training and deployment.

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**  

* Many years of experience within ML development.
* Previous experience within leadership or in a planning role.
* Proven experience with Python, including common ML libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, pandas, PyTorch/TensorFlow).
* Experience planning, assigning, and following up work using Linear (or similar tools like Jira), with a structured approach to sprint planning and progress tracking.
* Experience managing backlogs, sprint planning, and resource allocation for technical teams.
* Strong knowledge of AWS services, especially SageMaker, S3, Lambda, and Step Functions.
* Experience in building, deploying, and maintaining ML models in production environments.
* Comfortable working with CI/CD pipelines, version control (Git), and containerized environments (e.g., Docker).
* Strong communication skills and ability to align cross-functional teams.

  

**Meritorious**  

* Previous experience within fintech is a great plus

  

**Application deadline:** 30-04-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**DevOps Engineer ️ | Remote | Full-time**
------------------------------------------


Are you a proactive problem-solver with a passion for optimizing cloud infrastructure and streamlining deployment processes? Do you thrive in dynamic, collaborative environments where innovation, efficiency, and growth are at the heart of everything you do? If so, this opportunity is tailor-made for you!


Our client is a fast-moving digital development team specializing in web applications, primarily built with WordPress, PHP, JavaScript, MySQL, Redis, and Python scripting. Their infrastructure is powered by leading cloud services like DigitalOcean, AWS, and similar platforms. As their operations continue to grow, they are seeking a **DevOps Engineer** to strengthen and scale their systems.


This is your chance to step into a role where your expertise will directly impact system reliability, deployment efficiency, and overall product excellence. ️

### **What You’ll Be Doing ️**


Managing and optimizing infrastructure across cloud platforms such as DigitalOcean, AWS, and more.


Automating deployments, monitoring, and backup processes to ensure operational excellence.


Designing, implementing, and maintaining efficient CI/CD pipelines.


️ Improving system performance, security, and overall availability across platforms.


Collaborating with development teams to streamline application deployments built on WordPress, Node.js, PHP, JavaScript, MySQL, Redis, and Python scripts.


Leading WordPress site migrations with minimal downtime and smooth transitions.


️ Troubleshooting production issues swiftly to maintain service reliability.


### **What You Bring to the Table**

Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, IT, or related fields.


Minimum of 2 years’ experience in DevOps, Systems Administration, or similar roles.


️ Hands-on experience with cloud platforms like DigitalOcean, AWS, or equivalents.


Familiarity with containerization tools such as Docker or Kubernetes.


Strong scripting abilities in Bash, Python, or similar languages.


️ Solid understanding of web tech stacks including WordPress, PHP, JavaScript, Node.js, MySQL, and Redis.


Excellent troubleshooting skills, attention to detail, and a collaborative spirit.


### **Preferred Skills**

️ Experience with infrastructure as code (Terraform, Ansible).


Managing large-scale WordPress deployments.


Certifications in AWS or other cloud services.


Familiarity with monitoring tools like Prometheus, Grafana, or similar systems.


### **What’s in It for You**

Competitive salary based on experience and skills.


Clear opportunities for professional development and upskilling.


A supportive, forward-thinking work culture where your contributions truly matter.

title: Lead Data Platform Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Role:**  

* Design, implement and integrate core platform components for dataset catalog, storage standards, publishing SDKs, orchestration and metadata tracking
* Evaluate and integrate open-source tools like Flyte, Dagster, Amundsen, DataHub
* Help shape how Databricks fits into the platform strategy and make it play well with the rest of the platform
* Establish conventions and tooling for dataset formats (e.g. Parquet), versioning, access control, and schema definitions
* Help define and build the golden path for producing and consuming datasets across teams
* Embed platform thinking into everything — making the platform extensible, observable, and pleasant to use

  

**Essential requirements:**  

* Have 7+ years of hands-on software engineering experience, including building data-intensive systems or platforms
* Are familiar with data pipeline orchestration (Airflow, Flyte, Dagster, etc.)
* Know your way around cloud platforms, ideally with Azure, but GCP or AWS is also fine
* Are comfortable working with Databricks and its ecosystem – hands-on experience is a strong plus
* Understand the value of metadata, lineage, and data product ownership
* Have experience building or contributing to internal platforms, developer tools or shared services
* Are comfortable with Python and CLI tooling, and ideally know SQL as well
* Are pragmatic: you can balance speed and structure, you ship iteratively, and you’re not religious about tools
* Can work across team boundaries, explain your thinking clearly, and enjoy helping others succeed

  

**Meritorious:**  

* Experience integrating with tools like Power BI, Backstage, or open metadata catalogs
* Familiarity with Delta Lake and architectures (e.g. lakehouse)
* Background in data engineering, operations, or developer experience roles

  

**Last day to apply:** 05-05-2025

Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Full-Stack Engineer (Node.js, React)
description:
**Company Overview:** Vaimo is a leading full-service omnichannel agency dedicated to empowering brands, retailers, and manufacturers worldwide to create exceptional digital experiences. As a Vaimoer, you will engage with cutting-edge technologies in a rapidly growing international tech company. Our prestigious clients include Helly Hansen, Heineken, BAUHAUS, Jaguar, and Wimbledon. Join us to make a significant impact in the dynamic and expanding world of digital innovation!

**Role Overview:** As a Full-Stack Engineer, you will be responsible for designing and building highly available Composable Commerce solutions within a distributed architecture. You will adhere to the following principles:

* Headless
* Cloud-native
* Serverless
* Microservice
* Event-driven architecture

  

**Tech Stack:**

* **Backend:** TypeScript, Node.js, Express.js, Nest.js, Monorepo (Turborepo), Unit & Integration tests (Jest)
* **Cloud Services:** Azure (Functions, App Services, Event Grid, Logic Apps, Cosmos DB, etc.)
* **Infrastructure as Code:** Terraform
* **Frontend:** React.js
* **Version Control:** GitHub, Bitbucket

  

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with an international agile team to build large and medium-sized digital solutions for our clients.
* Plan, design, and develop high-quality integrations and backend-for-frontend solutions.
* Continuously enhance your skills and contribute to the development of best practices, sharing knowledge across cross-functional teams.

  

**Skills & Requirements:**

* Proficient in JavaScript/TypeScript and Node.js.
* Confident in writing automated tests (unit & integration).
* Knowledgeable in architectural and design patterns for microservices creation, communication, and orchestration.
* Skilled in designing and implementing integrations with distributed systems.
* Upper-Intermediate proficiency in English, both verbal and written.

  

**Nice to Have:**

* Experience with commerce platforms, preferably Commercetools.
* Experience with Serverless and Cloud-native development on GCP or AWS.
* Familiarity with DevOps tools (GitHub, Terraform, Docker).
* Experience with GraphQL on both client and server sides.
* Proficiency in front-end frameworks such as React.js and Next.js.
* Experience with Test-Driven Development (TDD) and Domain-Driven Design (DDD).

**Why Join Us?**  

Grow your software skills with top experts, technologies, and best practices. Become a certified expert in commerce platforms, Cloud Service Providers, and more.

**How to Apply**


If you are passionate about driving growth through strategic planning and resource management, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and interest in the role.

title: Senior Azure Site Reliability Engineer
description:
**Job Title**: Senior Azure Site Reliability Engineer  
**Reports** **To**: Azure Site Reliability Lead

**About us:**

Welcome to Pinnacle, the ultimate destination for sports enthusiasts seeking an exhilarating sportsbook and gaming experience! Established in 1998, we have solidified our position as one of the globe's foremost licensed online gaming companies. With our cutting-edge offerings, we guarantee an electrifying experience that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

Pinnacle invites you to join our team and become an instrumental figure in the exciting realm of sportsbetting. Our vibrant team is fueled by passion and driven by innovation, working together to redefine the landscape of sports betting and gaming. Together, we constantly strive to surpass limitations and deliver unparalleled experiences to sports enthusiasts worldwide. Prepare yourself for a thrilling journey and discover sports in an entirely new dimension with Pinnacle!

**Role Overview:**

Senior Azure Site Reliability Engineer will play a key part in designing, implementing, and optimizing company’s Azure cloud infrastructure solutions. The ideal candidate will bring a strong background in cloud technologies and Kubernetes to deliver Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Software as a Service (SaaS) solution based on industry best practices and current trends.

You will be responsible to provision and manage of cloud infrastructure on Azure public cloud to support organizational needs. is responsible for ensuring the reliability, availability, and performance of cloud-based infrastructure and applications deployed on Microsoft Azure. This role involves automating operations, monitoring system health, optimizing performance, and troubleshooting complex issues to maintain a highly available and secure cloud environment. The SRE will work closely with development, security, and IT operations teams to enhance cloud solutions, implement best practices, and support scalable and resilient systems.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Deploy and manage Azure cloud services including Virtual Machines, Storage, Redis, Azure SQL databases, virtual networks, and AKS clusters (Azure Kubernetes Service).
* Automate provisioning, configuration, and deployments using PowerShell, Bash, and Ansible.
* Deliver and deploy Azure infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (IaC), specifically Azure bicep
* Review, Configure and implement monitoring functionalities to provide best visibility and transparency to level 1 support teams.
* Implement and Troubleshoot CI/CD pipelines for application deployments in Azure DevOps, Team City, Octopus
* Maintain system reliability using Azure Monitor, Application Insights, Log Analytics, and Prometheus/Grafana, Splunk, Ops-Genie, Slack.
* Optimize performance and cost efficiency of Azure resources.
* Train junior members of the team to deliver best of breed solutions on top of Azure public cloud.
* Review, manage, and troubleshoot Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters.
* Review and Manage Cloud and On-Prem servers including AKS in terms of OS, RMQ Upgrades, Security Patches , Application Service support.
* Respond to system alerts, failures, and security incidents Perform root cause analysis (RCA) and implement preventive measures
* Provide Level 2 support in on-call capacity based on pre-approved schedule (including weekends)
* Review the network and security design for all infrastructure and applications hosted in Azure.
* Continuously promote better ways to deliver Infrastructure solutions on Azure cloud.
* Propose adoption of new approaches, patterns, techniques, and ideas recommended by industry standards and industry trends.
* Work closely with Software development and network teams to enhance platform reliability and identity better approaches.

**Experience and Qualifications:**

* 5+ years of proven experience in delivering infrastructure solutions on Azure cloud.
* 5+ years of hands-on with infrastructure design and deployment utilizing PaaS, SaaS and IaaS cloud offerings.
* 5+ years of hands-on with Linux and Windows Server Cloud and On-Prem
* 3+ years working with Azure ARM templates and Azure Biceps
* 3+ years of hands-on experience designing, building, and deploying containerized runtime environments based on Azure Kubernetes Services
* 1+ years of proven experience administering RabbitMQ clusters and Nginx
* Provent experience with scripting languages like: PowerShell, Python, JavaScript, Bash
* Experience using Splunk, Grafana, Ops-Genie is an asset

**Skills:**

* AZ-104 (Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate) - required
* AZ-305 (Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions) - required
* CKA (Certified Kubernetes Administrator ) - required
* LPIC-1 (Linux Essentials) - required
* AZ-800 (Windows Server Hybrid Core Infrastructure) - preferred

*We are an equal opportunity employer dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace. We prioritize hiring the best candidates based on their skills and qualifications, irrespective of race, gender, age, religion, or any other characteristic. Our strength lies in our diverse teams, and we proudly celebrate and empower everyone to embrace and promote diversity throughout their time with us.*

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: Remote

title: DevOps Engineer – fokus på testautomation & pipelines
description:
Är du en teknisk problemlösare med intresse för testautomation, pipelines och scriptning? Vill du arbeta i ett team med stor påverkan på ett av vår kunds mest centrala system – pensionsplattformen Lumera? Då kan det här vara helt rätt nästa steg i din karriär!
  
  

**OM TJÄNSTEN:**  

Vår kund söker nu en DevOps Engineer till sitt Lumera-team. Rollen passar dig som har några års erfarenhet inom DevOps, testautomation eller teknisk förvaltning – och som vill ta nästa steg i en miljö där teknik, säkerhet och stabilitet är i fokus.
  
  

Här arbetar du inte med att utveckla själva Lumera-systemet – det gör leverantören – utan med att kvalitetssäkra, automatisera och hantera miljöerna runt omkring. Du blir en nyckelspelare i att säkerställa att plattformen fungerar effektivt, kan deployas tryggt och är testad på ett smart sätt. Rollen är mer teknisk förvaltning än nyutveckling, men med högt tekniskt innehåll och stort lärande.
  
  

**ARBETSUPPGIFTER:**  

Arbeta med testautomation (Java-baserad) och underhåll av testfall
  
Bygga och underhålla pipelines i Azure DevOps
  
Scriptning och automation (PowerShell, SQL m.fl.)
  
Felsökning och incidenthantering i Lumera-systemet
  
Förvaltning och optimering av Lumera Core-miljön över tid
  
Använda verktyg som Git, Splunk och Dynatrace för monitorering, loggning och analys
  
  

**VI SÖKER DIG SOM:**  

Har några års erfarenhet inom testautomation, DevOps eller teknisk förvaltning
  
Har kunskap om CI/CD-flöden och verktyg som Azure DevOps
  
Har erfarenhet av scriptning (exempelvis PowerShell eller SQL)
  
Har ett stort tekniskt intresse och gillar att förstå hur system fungerar på djupet
  
Talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska och engelska
  
  

**Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:**  

Lumera eller andra system inom försäkring/pension
  
Monitoreringsverktyg som Dynatrace eller Splunk
  
Certifikathantering, SOAP/REST eller integrationer
  
  

Vi tror att du är tekniskt nyfiken, gillar att lära dig nya saker och dela med dig av kunskap. Vidare är du strukturerad och gillar ordning och reda i kod, miljöer och processer.
  
  

**OM ANSTÄLLNINGEN:**  

Detta är ett konsultuppdrag vilket innebär att du kommer till en början att vara anställd av Friday. Ambitionen från Kunden och vår sida är att du efter 12 månader blir direktanställd hos kunden.
  
  

**ÖVRIG INFO:**  

**Omfattning:** Heltid
  
**Start:** Omgående
  
**Placering:** Stockholm
  
**Rekryteringsansvarig:** Mattias Isik
  
**Lön:** Marknadsmässig

title: Senior Backend & Middleware Engineer till Hemfrid!
description:
**Vi söker en Senior Backend & Middleware Engineer!**

Hemfrid är den ledande aktören för tjänster i hemmet. Vi vill inte bara leverera tjänster av högsta kvalitet - vi vill öka människors livskvalitet. Vår avancerade techplattform säkerställer sömlös tillgång till våra toppklassiga tjänster och våra medarbetare delar samma mål: att ge våra kunder en enklare vardag.


Vi är en del av KEYTO Group koncernen och strävar efter att skapa den ledande, teknikdrivna fullserviceplattformen för hushållstjänster. Vi är dedikerade till att ‘unlock quality of life. Vi tror på styrkan i teknologi och integrerade tjänster för att driva branschen framåt samt skapa enkel tillgång till enastående tjänster och en smidig kundupplevelse.


**Om rollen**

Som Senior Backend & Middleware Engineer hos Hemfrid får du en nyckelroll i Tech-teamet, där du ansvarar för utveckling och drift av våra backend- och middlewarelösningar. Du leder tekniska forum och samarbetar nära med DevOps-, App-, Web- och Salesforce-teamen. Rollen kombinerar teknisk expertis inom utveckling, DevOps och infrastruktur med ett starkt tekniskt ledarskap, där du både driver strategiska teknikval och utvecklar teamets kompetens.


Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden inkluderar:


* Hantering av Cloudflare, Kubernetes, Helm charts samt CI/CD-pipelines i Azure DevOps och GitHub Actions.
* Säkerhets- och accesshantering via Azure AD, Key Vaults och API Management.
* Drift och underhåll av VMware, Linux-servrar och brandväggar, samt övervakning med Pingdom, New Relic och Graylog.
* Utveckling av microservices och integrationer samt hantering av komplexa dataflöden mellan affärskritiska system.
* Automatisering och datahantering med Azure Functions och Logic Apps.
* Leda och utveckla backend-teamet, driva roadmap och delta i arkitektur- och teknikbeslut.
* Prioritera leveranser samt stödja rekrytering och utveckling av teamet tillsammans med IT-chefen.
  


**Din profil**


Vi söker dig som:


* Har 5+ års erfarenhet av backend-utveckling och arkitekturdesign.
* Är van att arbeta med Azure/Cloud, Kubernetes och DevOps-processer.
* Har djup kunskap om integrationer, API-hantering och systemarkitektur.
* Är trygg i en formell eller informell ledarroll och har erfarenhet av att leda tekniska team.
* Trivs i en miljö där du får agera teknisk expert och mentor.
* Är lösningsorienterad och kan hantera incidenter och driftutmaningar effektivt.
  

**Teknologier & verktyg du bör behärska:**

* **Backend**: Erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande språk: Node.js, .NET, Python eller TypeScript. Erfarenhet av andra språk som Java eller Go är meriterande.
* **DevOps** & Infrastruktur: Azure, Kubernetes, Helm, Azure Pipelines, VMware.
* **Säkerhet** & Access: Azure AD, Key Vaults, API Management.
* **CI/CD & Versionshantering:** Azure Pipelines, GitHub, GitOps.
* **Övervakning & Incidenthantering:** New Relic, Pingdom, Graylog.
* **Databaser** & API: PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Percona, SQL Server, GraphQL, REST.

  

**Varför jobba hos Hemfrid?**

* **Spännande tekniska utmaningar:** Arbeta med moderna teknologier i en komplex systemmiljö.
* **Påverka teknikval & arkitektur:** Stor frihet att bidra till teknisk innovation.
* **Växa som ledare & mentor:** Stöd och utveckling av teamet är en central del av rollen, med goda möjligheter att växa inom organisationen.
* **Stabil & framtidsorienterad organisation:** En arbetsplats där teknik står i centrum och där vi strävar efter att ligga i framkant inom vår bransch.

  

Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst med start enligt överenskommelse. Vi hanterar ansökningarna löpande och genomför intervjuer kontinuerligt. Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt! Vi ser fram emot din ansökan.
company_description: Vi är idag 2.200 medarbetare som hjälper våra kunder med tjänster i hemmet, eller arbetar med bemanning, kundservice och annat.

title: ProServe Cloud Architect, AWS Professional Services Sweden
description:
• 5+ years of experience in cloud architecture, designing and implementing cloud solutions. 
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience
• Working knowledge of at least two technology domains, such as distributed internet-scale web or mobile applications, Serverless, Big Data, analytics, Machine Learning, enterprise workloads (SAP, VMware, Windows etc.), high-performance databases (SQL and/or NoSQL), complex networking implementations, highly secured workloads, etc. and a solid understanding Security and Compliance
  

The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking an experienced ProServe Cloud Architect (PCA) to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to understand their technical requirements and business objectives, designing and implementing tailored cloud solutions. You'll be a key player in the pre-sales process, providing technical expertise and guidance throughout the customer's cloud journey.
In this role, you'll be responsible for creating and leading the solution design to address customer business outcomes (CBO). Operating as the conduit between ProServe Account Executives and our Shared Delivery Teams (SDT), you’ll ensure proposed solutions are realistic, achievable, and optimize ProServe and/or our partners to maximize CBOs. As a PCA you are a trusted advisor to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions to address customer challenges. As a technical SME, you will share knowledge within the organization, through mentoring, training, creation of reusable artifacts and process improvements.
Your experience in designing technical solutions within the technology/consulting sector, will equip you with the ability to architect complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer, translating technical concepts into business value. Your success as a PCA will be linked to impacting the signing of SOWs, and the successful implementation of solutions which achieve CBOs while exceeding customer satisfaction (CSAT) expectations.
The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
Key job responsibilities
As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
• Designing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions to deliver customer business outcomes (CBOs) 
• Providing technical guidance and best practices during pre-sales and implementation phases
• Collaborating with Account Managers and Shared Delivery Teams to ensure proposed solutions are realistic and achievable
• Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
• Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts
About the team
Diverse Experiences: AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job below, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture - Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
Mentorship & Career Growth - We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
Work/Life Balance - We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  

* Advanced technology degree or AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) preferred
* Deep understanding of AWS services across compute, storage, networking, security, databases, machine learning, and serverless technologies
* Knowledge of security and compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR)
* Expertise in performance optimization and cost management for cloud environments
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences as part of pre-sales motion

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**Company Description**
 Technology is our how. And people are our why. For over two decades, we have been harnessing technology to drive meaningful change.
   

  

 By combining world-class engineering, industry expertise and a people-centric mindset, we consult and partner with leading brands from various industries to create dynamic platforms and intelligent digital experiences that drive innovation and transform businesses.
   

  

 From prototype to real-world impact - be part of a global shift by doing work that matters.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a skilled and experienced DevOps engineer to join our dynamic team in Stockholm, Sweden. As a DevOps engineer you will play a crucial role in driving and ensuring the successful delivery of high-quality software products.
   

  

* Knowledge and experience of DevOps concepts and tools, C++ programming skills.
* Define, and drive the product backlog, ensuring it aligns with business objectives and technical constraints
* Collaborate closely with development teams, stakeholders, and end-users to build and deliver.
* Create and refine features, user stories, acceptance criteria.
* Drive the release/iteration planning, review, retrospective, and workshops.
* Make informed decisions on product features and prioritization based on data and user feedback.
* Should be able to communicate product vision, goals, and progress to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Manage stakeholder expectations and resolve conflicts between business needs and technical limitations.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies.
* Ability to work three days in the office.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Telecommunications, or a related field
* 3-5 years of experience as a DevOps with C++ programming
* Proficiency in DevOps tools such as code build and test tools, Kubernetes, and Docker, scripting skills e.g., Bash, Python, or similar, etc.
* Excellent technical understanding of software development processes and best practices.
* Proven track record of successful product deliveries in a fast-paced environment.
* Outstanding communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
* Strong understanding of Agile methodologies, particularly Scrum and Kanban.
* Experience in creating product backlogs, user stories, and acceptance criteria.
* Demonstrated ability to manage multiple stakeholders and balance competing priorities.
* Any of the Scrum certifications would help.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment while also being decisive when needed.
* Communicate fluently in both Swedish and English.
* Certifications in AWS, Azure, or DevOps are a plus.


 Additional Information
   

  

 Discover some of the global benefits that empower our people to become the best version of themselves:
   

  

  

* Finance:
   

 Competitive salary package, share plan, company performance bonuses, value-based recognition awards, referral bonus;
* Career Development:
   

 Career coaching, global career opportunities, non-linear career paths, internal development programmes for management and technical leadership;
* Learning Opportunities:
   

 Complex projects, rotations, internal tech communities, training, certifications, coaching, online learning platforms subscriptions, pass-it-on sessions, workshops, conferences;
* Work-Life Balance:
   

 Hybrid work and flexible working hours, employee assistance programme;
* Health:
   

 Global internal wellbeing programme, access to wellbeing apps;
* Community:
   

 Global internal tech communities, hobby clubs and interest groups, inclusion and diversity programmes, events and celebrations.


 At Endava, we’re committed to creating an open, inclusive, and respectful environment where everyone feels safe, valued, and empowered to be their best. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives—because we know that inclusive teams help us deliver smarter, more innovative solutions for our customers. Hiring decisions are based on merit, skills, qualifications, and potential. If you need adjustments or support during the recruitment process, please let us know.

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
**TLDR;** 



* **Irori:** 
 Aims to be the Nr 1 cloud engineering consultancy provider in Stockholm. We believe in being fast moving, flexible and high trust →
 ***Making large impacts as a small team.***
* **Tech** 
 : Azure/GCP/AWS/OpenShift + Kubernetes + Ansible/Terraform + more →
 ***We really like DevEx***
* **Culture** 
 : Competence Development Day every month (we call it Firestarters) + Off-site Hackathon twice a year (one in the sun, the other in the cold) + Flat organization + Tech First + Incredibly stable in this rocky market →
 ***Continuous learning together***



  





  





**Cloud Engineering at Irori** 




 We help organizations design, build and run platforms with capabilities such as:
 


* Infrastructure automation
* Self-service
* Observability and incident response tooling
* Secure identity, policy, and secrets management
* Enhanced resilience: multi-cloud DR, backup, and failover



  





 We work hands-on with Kubernetes, Terraform, Helm, ArgoCD, Vault, and cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, and Azure. Our mission is to empower teams to move fast and safely, with solid tooling and a reliable platform as the foundation. You'll be part of platform teams, collaborate on real challenges, and build infrastructure that users depend on.
 



  





**You bring** 



* Over 5 years of experience in platform, cloud or infrastructure engineering
* Familiarity with cloud-native tooling (Kubernetes, GitOps, CI/CD, observability)
* Building and maintaining platforms, not just being a user
* Fluency in Swedish and ability to work on-site from Stockholm
* Ambition and willingness to learn



  





**Why Irori?** 




 We’re one of Stockholm’s strongest tech consultancies: fully booked, growing steadily, and grounded in a culture of knowledge sharing, adventure, and hands-on learning.
 



  





 We place learning in the center of what we do, hosting a competence day every month, off-site hackathons twice a year and of course pay for any certifications that you want to take. You’ll have space to grow and we make sure to create opportunities that align with your journey.
 



  





 We believe the best teams are built on trust, curiosity, and a shared drive to make things better. If that sounds like you, we’d love to talk.

title: DevSecOps Engineer (Security, Compliance & PCI-DSS)
description:
**This is Worldline.** 




  





 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
 



  





**The Opportunity** 




  





 The DevSecOps Engineer is responsible for managing and optimizing the security infrastructure of the Payment Engine, which processes approximately 2 million transactions daily. The primary focus of this role is ensuring the infrastructure's security, compliance, and adherence to PCI-DSS standards.
 



  





**Day-to-Day Responsibilities​** 




  




* Lead hands-on PCI-DSS assessments, ensuring compliance and successful audits.
* Lead and advice about the design, implementation, and continuous improvement of infrastructure security practices



  





**Who Are We Looking For** 




  





 We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:
 



  




* Strong proficiency with Linux environments
* Hands-on experience with Terraform
* Comprehensive understanding of PCI-DSS requirements and compliance processes
* Practical hands-on engineering experience for finding proactive solution



  





**Perks & Benefits** 




  





 At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
 


* Pension plan
* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2nd year
* Private Health Care Insurance (EuroAccident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.



  





**Shape the evolution.** 




  





 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
 



  





**Learn more about life at Worldline at
 
 jobs.worldline.com**




  





**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**

title: DevOps Engineer
company_industry: Technology, Information and Internet and Education
description:
**DevOps Engineer (Permanent) – Exciting Opportunity in a Fast-Growing Tech Company** 




  





 We’ve partnered with an exciting and rapidly growing client at the forefront of digital transformation. They’re delivering innovative solutions across a variety of industries and are now seeking a talented
 **DevOps Engineer** 
 to join their team on a
 **permanent basis** 
 . This is a fantastic opportunity to have a lasting impact on a dynamic and forward-thinking technology environment.
 



  





**About Us** 




  





 We are a forward-thinking technology company dedicated to solving complex challenges, leveraging cloud technology, and optimizing development processes to drive success. With a strong emphasis on collaboration and growth, we provide an environment where creativity and technical excellence are celebrated.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 




  




* Lead the development and deployment of high-quality DevOps solutions.
* Architect and implement CI/CD pipelines using tools like TeamCity, Octopus, and GitHub Actions.
* Manage cloud infrastructure on AWS, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance.
* Utilize logging and observability tools such as DataDog, CloudWatch, and Loggly to maintain system health.
* Oversee the deployment and management of .NET applications on AWS.
* Work with SQL Server, Containers, and CloudFormation to enhance our infrastructure.
* Drive best practices in DevOps, software development, and cloud security.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




  





**Core Requirements:** 




  




* Proven experience with CI/CD tools: TeamCity, Octopus, GitHub Actions, and Git.
* Strong hands-on experience with AWS cloud platform.
* Expertise in logging & observability tools such as DataDog, CloudWatch, and Loggly.
* Extensive experience running .NET applications on AWS.
* Solid understanding of SQL Server, Containers, and CloudFormation.



  





**Nice-to-Have Skills:** 




  




* Knowledge of cybersecurity best practices.
* Experience with the .NET tech stack & application development.
* Familiarity with CDK and gRPC.



  





**Why Join Us?** 




  




* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Hybrid working model (Thursday in-office).
* Work with a passionate and highly skilled team.
* Flexible working arrangements, including remote options.
* Ongoing opportunities for professional growth and career progression.
* A culture that fosters innovation, collaboration, and excellence.



  





 If you’re looking for a long-term role where you can truly make a difference, we’d love to hear from you.
 



  





**Apply now to become a key part of this exciting journey!**

title: Atlassian Sales Specialist
company_industry: Professional Training and Coaching, E-Learning Providers, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
In the Age of AI, Cprime reshapes operating models and rewires workflows to deliver enterprise transformation. We are your Intelligent Orchestration Partner, combining strategic consulting with industry-leading platforms to drive innovation, enhance efficiency, and shift your enterprise toward AI native thinking. For over 20 years, we've changed the way companies operate by transforming their people, processes, and technology, including partnering with 300 of the Fortune 500 companies. In this new era, Cprime helps companies unlock unprecedented speed and efficiency by embedding AI at the core of their business and infusing it into every function, process, and team.
   

  

 We are seeking a highly motivated Atlassian Sales Specialist to join our team and drive the growth of our Atlassian product and service offerings. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Atlassian’s suite of tools, including Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and other ecosystem products, with a proven track record in technology sales. This role is ideal for a results-oriented sales professional with strong technical acumen and experience in enterprise software sales.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and execute sales strategies to drive revenue growth for Atlassian solutions.
* Identify, engage, and nurture relationships with new and existing customers to understand their business needs.
* Work closely with technical teams to deliver tailored Atlassian solutions that align with customer requirements.
* Provide expert knowledge and demonstrations of Atlassian products, showcasing how they can improve team collaboration, productivity, and efficiency.
* Collaborate with marketing, customer success, and channel partners to create compelling sales campaigns.
* Manage the sales pipeline and forecast revenue opportunities using CRM tools.
* Stay updated on Atlassian product developments, market trends, and competitor offerings.
* Work with procurement teams to navigate enterprise-level sales processes, contracts, and pricing negotiations.


**Required Skills & Experience**
* Proven experience in technology/software sales, preferably with a focus on Atlassian products.
* Strong understanding of Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and other Atlassian ecosystem tools.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate value propositions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience in B2B enterprise sales, account management, or business development.
* Ability to develop relationships and influence decision-makers at various levels.
* Familiarity with Agile, DevOps, and ITSM practices is a plus.
* Proficiency in CRM tools such as Salesforce, HubSpot, or similar.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Atlassian certifications or strong hands-on experience with Atlassian tools.
* Background in IT consulting, SaaS sales, or enterprise software solutions.
* Experience working with Atlassian Solution Partners or resellers.
* A strong network in the Agile, DevOps, or ITSM communities.


 If you decide to apply for the position, any email, files, attachments and personal data which you provide shall be processed by Cprime, inc., are confidential, and intended solely for the use of the individual or entity to whom they are addressed. Your personal data shall be processed for the purposes of recruitment, recruitment policy and selection.
   

  

 Cprime embraces diversity and equal opportunity and we are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, personal circumstances and skills. Prior to the next stage in the recruiting process, we invite you to inform us confidentially if you may require any special accommodations in order to fully engage in our recruitment experience.

title: Sr. Cloud Architect, Professional Services
description:
**Description**
 The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (ProServe) team is seeking an experienced ProServe Cloud Architect (PCA) to join our team at Amazon Web Services (AWS). In this role, you'll work closely with customers to understand their technical requirements and business objectives, designing and implementing tailored cloud solutions. You'll be a key player in the pre-sales process, providing technical expertise and guidance throughout the customer's cloud journey.
   

  

 In this role, you'll be responsible for creating and leading the solution design to address customer business outcomes (CBO). Operating as the conduit between ProServe Account Executives and our Shared Delivery Teams (SDT), you’ll ensure proposed solutions are realistic, achievable, and optimize ProServe and/or our partners to maximize CBOs. As a PCA you are a trusted advisor to our customers, providing guidance on industry trends, emerging technologies, and innovative solutions to address customer challenges. As a technical SME, you will share knowledge within the organization, through mentoring, training, creation of reusable artifacts and process improvements.
   

  

 Your experience in designing technical solutions within the technology/consulting sector, will equip you with the ability to architect complex, scalable, and secure solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of each customer, translating technical concepts into business value. Your success as a PCA will be linked to impacting the signing of SOWs, and the successful implementation of solutions which achieve CBOs while exceeding customer satisfaction (CSAT) expectations.
   

  

 The AWS Professional Services organization is a global team of experts that help customers realize their desired business outcomes when using the AWS Cloud. We work together with customer teams and the AWS Partner Network (APN) to execute enterprise cloud computing initiatives. Our team provides assistance through a collection of offerings which help customers achieve specific outcomes related to enterprise cloud adoption. We also deliver focused guidance through our global specialty practices, which cover a variety of solutions, technologies, and industries.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As an experienced technology professional, you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Designing complex, scalable, and secure AWS solutions to deliver customer business outcomes (CBOs)
* Providing technical guidance and best practices during pre-sales and implementation phases
* Collaborating with Account Managers and Shared Delivery Teams to ensure proposed solutions are realistic and achievable
* Acting as a trusted advisor to customers on industry trends and emerging technologies
* Sharing knowledge within the organization through mentoring, training, and creating reusable artifacts


**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences: AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job below, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture - Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth - We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance - We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in cloud architecture, including designing and implementing cloud solutions.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field, or equivalent experience


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Advanced technology degree or AWS Professional level certifications (e.g., Solutions Architect Professional, DevOps Engineer Professional) preferred
* Deep understanding of AWS services across compute, storage, networking, security, databases, machine learning, and serverless technologies
* Knowledge of security and compliance standards (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR)
* Expertise in performance optimization and cost management for cloud environments
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences as part of pre-sales motion


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
