title: DevOps specialist  Inom Plattformleverans och Infrastruktur
description:
Är du redo att göra ett bestående avtryck? Intric har en djärv vision för framtiden, och vi pratar inte bara om tillväxt—Intric har som uppdrag att låta alla dra nytta av generativ AI genom att göra skapandet och implementeringen av AI-baserade verktyg enkla, öppna och säkra.
 



  





 Om Tjänsten:
 



 Intric söker en skicklig
 **Specialist inom Plattformleverans och Infrastruktur** 
 som kan leda leveransen av företagets AI-plattform till dess kunder. Denna roll är avgörande för att säkerställa att plattformen är skalbar, robust och pålitlig – så att teamet kan fokusera på innovation och strategiska mål.
 



  





 Dina uppgifter – där du gör skillnad:
 


* Plattformleverans
 **:** 
 Leda övergången från kodbas till kundklara leveranser och säkerställa en smidig leveransprocess.
* CI/CD:
 
 Bygg och förvalta pipelines för smidiga och säkra leveranser. Du ser till att kod kan pushas, testas och rullas ut – utan friktion.
* Skalbarhet & Utrullning:
 
 Designa lösningar som skalar effektivt i olika miljöer – moln och on-prem.
* Infrastrukturägandeskap: Du ansvarar för att infrastrukturen är robust, säker och under kontroll – inklusive övervakning, loggning och drift.
* ETL-pipelines
 **:** 
 Hantera och vidareutveckla våra ETL-flöden för att säkerställa snabb, säker och korrekt datahantering.
* Innovation & Utveckling
 **:** 
 När leveransen sitter kan du även vara med och bidra till Python-utveckling av nya funktioner i plattformen.



  





 Din bakgrund - vi tror att du har:
 


* Några års erfarenhet som DevOps eller liknande teknisk roll, gärna i komplexa miljöer.
* Van vid CI/CD och containerteknik.
* Jobbat med infrastruktur som kod och har koll på modern molninfrastruktur.
* Vana att arbeta nära utvecklingsteam och gillar när kod och drift hänger ihop.
* Ett öga för automation – du bygger hellre pipelines än gör saker manuellt.
* Goda Python-kunskaper, eller intresse att utveckla dem.
* Brinner för AI och dess potential att förändra världen



  





 Vem du är:
 


* Tänker långsiktigt: Du delar Intrics vision och vill följa med på resan.
* Är en "builder": Du trivs med att bygga något från grunden.
* Samarbetar naturligt: Du gillar att jobba nära andra drivna personer.
* Vill växa: Du ser fram emot att utvecklas i takt med att företaget växer.



  





**Varför jobba hos Intric?** 




 Hos Intric får du möjlighet att påverka, bygga upp, automatisera och förbättra från grunden. Plattformen Intric utvecklar är banbrytande, men vi vet att den bara kan bli så bra som infrastrukturen och leveransen bakom den. Och det är där du kommer in.
 



  





 Deras tech stack:
 


* Webbapplikation: Node, TypeScript, HTML/CSS, Svelte/Kit, Tailwind, Melt UI
* Infrastruktur: Docker, Git, Jira



  





 Anställning:
 



 Detta är en rekrytering, vilket innebär att du kommer att anställas direkt av företaget.
 



  





 Övrig information
 **:** 



* Anställningstyp: Heltid
* Startdatum: Enligt överenskommelse
* Plats: Stockholm/Vasastan
* Lön: Fast månadslön



  





 Ansök genom att klicka på länken nedan. Tänk på att skicka in din ansökan snabbt, då vi granskar kandidater löpande och annonsen kan stängas innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi går vidare till urvals- och intervjufas.
 



  





 OM FRIDAY:
 



 G
 *enom att vara en partner både till våra kandidater och kunder strävar vi efter att hitta den bästa matchningen. Det gör vi genom att lära känna våra kunder och kandidater på riktigt! Vi ser självklart till att kunskaps- och erfarenhetskrav matchar, men framför allt lägger vi vikt vid samsyn kring värderingar och företagskultur som båda parter värdesätter.* 




*Vår passion är att hjälpa människor till rätt roll, arbetsplats och sammanhang inom IT och teknik. Därför grundade vi Friday med ambition att hjälpa dig till jobbet som ger dig fredagskänslan – varje dag!* 




*Vi riktar oss främst till dig som är i början av din karriär eller studerar vid högskola/universitet inom IT och Teknik. Vår övertygelse är att människor uppnår sin fulla potential när man ser fram emot att gå till jobbet varje morgon. ”Friday – everyday”, hur låter det?*

title: Senior Platform Engineer
description:
Are you a talented IAM specialist and experience in modern IGA & PAM solutions? Fortum is on the lookout for someone to join our CloudOps & Platform Engineering team within the IAM & M365 technical squad.
   

  

 You can work from our offices in Espoo, Solna, or Wroclaw, with the added flexibility of hybrid work arrangements.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Senior Platform Engineer, you'll be at the heart of managing and optimizing Fortum's core authentication and collaboration environment. Your day-to-day will involve hands-on development in modern IGA & PAM solutions, installing, configuring, deploying, developing, and optimizing these solutions. You'll be the go-to person for operating the IGA & PAM solutions and developing workflows for identity lifecycle management. Plus, you'll manage and maintain together with the rest of the squad our Microsoft hybrid identity environments and support and optimize Microsoft hybrid Exchange environments.
   

  

 This role is all about collaboration. You'll work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our IAM and M365 services run smoothly. You'll be part of a dynamic team that focuses on security optimization, identity lifecycle management, and supporting various IT and business functions with their IAM needs. It's a great opportunity to grow your skills in a supportive and innovative environment.
   

  

**About You**
 We're looking for someone with the following:
   

  

  

* Fluent English language skills, both written and spoken.
* Experience with one or more complex IGA and/or PAM solutions (e.g., Sailpoint, Saviynt, OneIdentity, Delinea, SSH PrivX).
* A good understanding of IAM/IDM processes.
* Hands-on experience with LinuxOS and shell scripting, as well as PowerShell for AD & EntraID.
* A solid understanding of networks.
* Knowledge of AWS, Azure and/or on-prem datacenter environments.
* ITSM integration knowledge (ServiceNow) is a plus.
* Strong collaboration and communication skills.
* A team-oriented approach and a commitment to working together.


 Your ability to work collaboratively and communicate effectively will be key in this role. We're looking for someone who is proactive and committed to team working.
   

  

**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Submit your application in English latest on 14th of May. No cover letter needed. We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. If you have questions and would like to hear more about the position, please contact Hiring Manager Petri Miettinen at petri.miettinen@fortum.com or Recruitment Partner Lisa Kylberg at lisa.kylberg@partners.fortum.com.
   

  

 Contact details to union representatives in Sweden can be found on the bottom of
 **this page.**
 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.
   

  

**We are Fortum**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com

title: Cloud Engineer & Backend or Data Engineer
description:
**Our background** 




 The Fairlo story began thirty years ago with the family of our founders Jimmy and Shamon fleeing political turmoil and ending up in Sweden. Struggling to give her children all that they desired, Jimmy and Shamon’s mother took a small unsecured loan. It seemed like a good deal but it quickly turned sour as the loan increased in size in spite of the continuous payments. Much later, having grown up, the two brothers revisited this incident and it became the spark that ignited the Fairlo vision. The fact that a trusted bank took predatory advantage of their family, when they were the most vulnerable, became the starting point of a quest to create a fair credit service. Since the start about six years ago, we've been working tirelessly to live up to the vision of an honest and easy-to-understand credit service. Without toxic terms, sneaky fine print, and nasty surprises.
 



  





**About Fairlo** 




 Unfair rates, hidden fees, and rigid terms characterise the financial industry. We believe people deserve better. Fairlo is on a mission to level the playing field and outsmart the predatory credit market by creating fair financial services from scratch. Since launch, our customers solve temporary cash flow needs in real-time at unrivaled rates. With the aid of technology, we've created automated, easy-to-use services based on transparency and fairness. We pair our cutting-edge tech with unprecedented terms. Fair terms that continually beat traditional banks, popular credit cards, and checkout solutions alike.
 



  





**What you'll do** 




 As a Cloud engineer and Data / Backend engineer at Fairlo, you will play a central role in developing and maintaining our core technology. This role is uniquely split: 50% of your time will be dedicated to building and managing our AWS cloud, and the remaining 50% will be focused on either backend development or data engineering, depending on your background and interests.
 



  





 In your cloud work, you’ll design, implement, and manage scalable, secure, and reliable AWS architectures using tools like CloudFormation, Terraform, SAM, or CDK. You’ll take responsibility for platform security, performance, and scalability - ensuring our systems are ready to grow and evolve with us.
 



  





 If your strength lies in backend development, you’ll be building and optimizing backend services and APIs, primarily using Node.js.
 



  





 If your interest is more in data engineering, you’ll work on improving how we collect, store, and process data across our platform, helping build data pipelines, improve data quality, and support analytics and decision-making throughout Fairlo.
 



  





**What we are looking for** 




 We create products that solve real-life problems in a simple and honest way, and we’re looking for a Senior Backend Engineer / Data Engineer with strong AWS Cloud expertise to join us on our mission. If you’re a curious problem-solver and thrive in a high-trust, high-ownership environment, and have a passion for building top-notch technology - whether that’s code, systems, or data pipelines - we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





 In this role, you’ll split your focus between either backend development or data development, and building robust infrastructure on AWS. You’ll be expected to take ownership of ensuring the platform is secure, scalable, and reliable. This includes proactively establishing and maintaining a strong security posture, identifying opportunities for upgrades and optimizations, and driving continuous improvements.
 



  





 We embrace a startup mindset, where taking ownership and wearing multiple hats is encouraged. Your role will be shaped not just by our needs, but by your interests and imagination.
 



  





**Requirements** 




 We’re looking for a senior engineer with a role split evenly between cloud engineering and backend or data engineering. You should have strong programming and architectural skills, with a sharp focus on performance, reliability, and scalability. You should have experience in:
 



  





 Backend or Data Engineering
 



 Depending on your background, you bring deep expertise in one of the following areas
 *.* 



* Backend Development – Building, maintaining, and optimizing backend services using modern frameworks such as Node.js (preferred), .NET Core, or Java.



 Or
 


* Data Engineering – Designing and maintaining ETL pipelines, optimizing data workflows, and working with large-scale datasets to support analytics and operational needs.



  





 Cloud Engineering
 


* Cloud Architecture – Designing and implementing scalable, reliable, and secure solutions in AWS.
* Infrastructure as Code – Managing cloud infrastructure using tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, AWS SAM, or CDK.
* Platform Ownership – Proactively maintaining and improving the cloud platform, addressing security and performance needs, and ensuring operational excellence.



  





 To succeed in this role, you’ll need a self-driven and proactive mindset, a passion for identifying and solving challenges, and the ability to take initiative in securing and improving the platform.
 



  





**Benefits** 




 Joining Fairlo means you'll:
 


* Enjoy creative freedom and the opportunity to build outstanding services, selecting the architectural and technical frameworks that best suit your vision.
* Be part of building the financial world you’d like to live in.
* Get a competitive salary and benefits package.
* Hybrid working framework.
* High-end laptop and equipment.
* Top location in Heraklion or Stockholm, where our office combines convenience, comfort, and a vibrant local atmosphere.
* Being part of a team that will support each other, have fun together and thrive.
* 30 days of paid holidays per year on top of bank holidays.
* 3 extra free sick leave days per year (In Heraklion)
* Private health insurance.
* Life insurance



  





 At Fairlo, you’ll join a team that embodies the best of Swedish innovation and Greek warmth, creating a unique and inspiring work culture. Together, we’re revolutionizing financial services with cutting-edge technology and a passion for making a difference in people’s lives.
 



 You’ll work alongside a talented, driven, and supportive team, where collaboration and growth are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re ready to be part of a journey that blends culture, technology, and financial innovation, we’d love to hear from you.
 



  





 Let’s build the future of finance together, join us at Fairlo!

title: Backend Engineer
description:
**Brinner du för att utveckla backend-system i Python och vill jobba i ett mindre team med stor möjlighet att vara med och påverka?** 
 Vi söker en Backend Engineer som vill ta ansvar för att planera och driva projekt som maximerar Wallism värdeskapande. Tillsammans med ett team om sex engagerade kollegor i en öppen och tillitsfull miljö, där du rapporterar till och samarbetar tätt med Oscar, vår Systemarkitekt, får du vara med och bygga nästa generations e-handel för tapeter. Tillsammans skapar vi automatiserade och framåtlutade lösningar för bolagets globala försäljning.
 



 Om du har gedigen
 **erfarenhet av Python** 
 och trivs med att
 **både utveckla och optimera driftsmiljöer för att leverera värde till kunderna** 
 , ser vi fram emot din ansökan!
 



  





**Du kommer att:** 



* Vara med och utveckla och optimera infrastrukturen för vår webbplats och vårt microtjänstkluster.
* Bidra till design och implementering av en stabil och skalbar driftmiljö.
* Säkerställa en robust drift genom kontinuerlig utveckling och förbättring av vår infrastruktur.
* Analysera och optimera flöden för tillväxt
* Felsöka och avhjälpa problem på ett effektivt sätt.



  





**Vi tror att du har:** 




* Minst fem års god erfarenhet som inom backend
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Python, inklusive erfarenhet av vanliga ramverk och bibliotek.
* God förmåga att dokumentera tekniska lösningar, API:er och processer.



  





**Vi ser gärna även att du har erfarenhet av något eller flera av dessa områden:** 



* Akademisk utbildning inom relevant IT-område.
* Erfarenhet av eventdriven arkitektur och olika typer av databaser (relationella, dokument, sök).
* God förståelse för DevOps-principer och CI/CD-pipelines.
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbete i team.
* Erfarenhet av containerisering (t.ex. Docker, Kubernetes) och Linux.
* Erfarenhet av TypeScript och/eller webbutveckling.



  





**Om bolaget:** 




 Vi på Wallism är ett teknikdrivet e-handelsbolag som omdefinierar marknaden för tapeter och muraler globalt. Genom vår strategiska satsning på mjukvaruutveckling skapar vi innovativa digitala lösningar och en sömlös kundupplevelse. Vår styrka ligger i vårt engagerade team, där varje medlem bidrar med sina unika färdigheter för att påverka produktens utveckling och vår fortsatta expansion. Vi verkar nu på över 20 marknader världen över, och trots vår snabba tillväxt behåller vi vårt fokus på personlig kundservice, vilket bevisas av vår höga kundnöjdhet och starka betyg på Trustpilot. Hos oss delar vi en gemensam passion för att utmana gränser och skapa en digital framtid där kreativitet och innovation möts.
 



  





 📍
 **Låter det intressant?** 
 Ansök idag och bli en del av vårt team!

title: Tech Lead till ICA Sverige
description:
Är du en erfaren IT-specialist med bevisad ledarskapsförmåga och utvecklingserfarenhet? Har du en passion för att skapa innovativa tekniska lösningar som integrerar de senaste teknologierna i både standardsystem och skräddarsydda lösningar? Om du är redo för en ledarroll som kombinerar praktiskt tekniskt arbete med strategiskt ansvar, vill vi gärna höra från dig!
   

  

**Om jobbet som Tech Lead**
 Som Tech Lead kommer du att spela en central roll i att driva utveckling, implementering och optimering av våra IT-applikationer för att uppnå affärs- och verksamhetsmål inom detaljhandel. Du kommer att samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team, leda teknisk utveckling, designa tekniska lösningar och anpassa utvecklingsinsatser efter affärsbehoven.
   

  

 Detta är en dynamisk roll där du inte bara leder och coachar ett team av utvecklare, utan även designar lösningar som möter affärsbehov och säkerställer skalbarhet, prestanda och underhållsbarhet. Du kommer att vara i centrum för produktutvecklingen, arbeta nära våra Product Owners, utvecklingsteam och andra avdelningar för att säkerställa att initiativ ligger i linje med affärsmålen och levereras i tid med hög kvalitet.
   

  

 Du kommer även att ge praktisk teknisk vägledning, implementera bästa praxis för kodning, automatiserad testning, CI/CD och DevOps-arbetsflöden, samt bidra till att ständigt förbättra applikationsutvecklingsprocesserna. Du kommer att främja en kultur av innovation och lärande och skapa en verklig påverkan på hela teamen och företaget.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med ny teknik som Platform as a Service (PaaS), Low-Code-plattformar och AI-baserade lösningar.
   

  

**Är du den vi söker?**
 För att trivas i rollen ser vi gärna att du har kandidatexamen (eller motsvarande) inom systemvetenskap, datavetenskap, informationsteknologi eller ett relaterat område. Du bör ha minst 5 års erfarenhet inom mjukvaruutveckling, inklusive erfarenhet av Java och minst ett skriptspråk. Du ska även ha erfarenhet av att skriva tekniska designdokument och stored procedures. Rollen kräver att du behärskar svenska och engelska obehindrat i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Vi letar efter en lagspelare som trivs med att skapa relation både med teamet och leverantörer, med positiv inställning och hög driv.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Ansök så snart som möjligt, vi gör löpande urval! Dock senast 2025-05-11.
   

  

 Vid frågor gällande tjänsten kontakta rekryterande chef, Mohit Sharma mohit.j.sharma@ica.se.
   

  

 ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter.  Vi värnar om goda arbetsmiljöförhållanden med mål om helt rökfria arbetsplatser. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.
   

  

 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA.

title: Product Marketing Manager – IoT & Embedded Systems
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation, and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office-based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder-led, profitable, and growing.
   

  

 The role of a Product Marketing Manager – IoT & Embedded Systems at Canonical
   

  

 At Canonical, since we released Ubuntu in 2004, we have had a direct impact on the growth of embedded systems world. From the very beginning, developers have trusted and used Ubuntu to build smart devices, leveraging open-source innovation and the support ecosystem from Canonical and the community. Over the last 10 years, we've worked closely with device innovators to provide the security, stability, and lifecycle management they need for long-term, production-grade deployments.
   

  

 Today, Solutions like Ubuntu Core and Ubuntu Pro for Devices empower enterprises to build and manage secure, and updatable smart devices in the field for over 10 years—from robotics to autonomous vehicles, and that's why our solutions are trusted by companies like Bosch, Continental, Dell, Qualcomm, Nvidia, Intel, Toyota, Mercedes-Benz, Audi, and T-Mobile.
   

  

 At Canonical, the product marketing team is not just marketing products—we're building the best Go-To-Market (GTM) engine in the open-source world. Our mission is to take the power of open-source innovation and bring it to businesses everywhere, from the data center to the edge. We're looking for a Product Marketing Manager (PMM) with a deep understanding of IoT, embedded systems, and edge computing to drive adoption and commercial success of our IoT portfolio. This is an exciting opportunity to shape how developers, enterprises, and device manufacturers leverage open-source technology to build the next generation of smart devices.
   

  

**Location:** 
*This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region*
**Why You'll Love This Role**
* You will own the IoT GTM strategy – Developing and executing marketing plans that drive awareness and adoption of Canonical's IoT solutions.
* You will tell compelling stories – Crafting clear, technical, and business-oriented messaging that resonates with developers, engineers, and decision-makers in the IoT space.
* You will work at the cutting edge – Helping enterprises modernize their IoT devices, from industrial automation to automotive, robotics, medical, and consumer electronics.
* You will collaborate with the best – Partnering with product, sales, regional marketing, communication and alliances teams to position Canonical's IoT solutions for growth.


**As a product marketing manager, you will:**
* Develop and execute go-to-market (GTM) strategies for a range of IoT products.
* Lead messaging and positioning efforts ensuring our products stand out in a competitive market.
* Lead content planning with product managers —from website copy to whitepapers, blogs, and sales enablement materials.
* Collaborate on marketing campaigns, partnering with regional marketing teams to execute integrated campaigns that drive pipeline growth.
* Launch new products and features, leading cross-functional teams to drive awareness and adoption.
* Run competitive analysis, staying ahead of market trends and evolving our positioning accordingly.
* Support the customer success team on driving customer engagement and growth, working on strategies to upsell and cross-sell across our customer base.
* Plan and execute global events, live webinars, and community meetups that align with our GTM priorities.


**What we are looking for in you**
* A passion for technology and open source—you get excited about innovation, software, and community-driven development.
* Strong storytelling skills—you know how to craft messaging that resonates with both technical and business audiences.
* Growth mindset—someone who thrives on experimentation, learning, and continuous improvement.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.


**Nice-to-have skills**
* Data-driven mindset, using insights to refine strategies and improve performance.
* Experience in product marketing for enterprise software, cloud, DevOps, or open-source solutions.
* Experience with demand generation, understanding how to translate GTM strategies into pipeline growth.
* Comfort working cross-functionally with product, sales, partners, and marketing teams.


**What we offer colleagues**
 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognize outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Team Member Assistance Program & Wellness Platform
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass and travel upgrades for long-haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open-source projects and the platform for AI, IoT, and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence; in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since our inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Kvantitativ utvecklare till Fjärde AP-fonden
description:
Har du ett brinnande intresse för programmering och finansiella marknader? Vill du vara med och vidareutveckla ett kvantitativt ramverk i en samhällsviktig organisation med långsiktigt uppdrag? Då kan detta vara rätt möjlighet för dig.
 



  





**Om tjänsten** 




 Som kvantitativ utvecklare hos Fjärde AP-fonden (AP4) får du en central roll i teamet för Allokering, Likvida Marknader och Analys (ALMA). ALMA är den enhet som ansvarar för implementationen av AP4s globala aktie-, ränte- och valutaexponering, övergripande allokering samt analys åt styrelse, vd och ALMAs mandat.
 



  





 Du kommer att arbeta med utveckling och underhåll av vårt kvantitativa analysramverk och dess databasmiljö. Arbetet sker i nära samarbete med portföljförvaltare och analytiker och innebär både nyutveckling och vidareutveckling av befintliga lösningar.
 



 Rollen passar dig som vill kombinera djup teknisk kompetens med förståelse för finansiella tillgångar och kapitalförvaltning.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter** 




 • Utveckling och förvaltning av kvantitativa modeller och analysramverk
 



 • Databasutveckling och integration av datakällor
 



 • Stöd till teamets analytiker och förvaltare i tekniska lösningar
 



 • Utveckling i molnmiljö och med moderna verktyg
 



  





**Lämplig bakgrund** 




 • Civilingenjör eller likvärdig teknisk utbildning
 



 • 3+ års erfarenhet av arbete som utvecklare
 



 • Bekväm med Python, Git, SQL, Docker, Linux
 



 • Erfarenhet av någon molnplattform (GCP, AWS, Azure)
 



  





 Meriterande erfarenhet är:
 



 • Erfarenhet av utveckling inom en större organisation
 



 • DevOps-erfarenhet
 



 • Erfarenhet av Azure, Snowflake eller NoSQL-databaser
 



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 Du har ett stort intresse för programmering och utvecklas gärna inom analysområdet. Du är noggrann, strukturerad och detaljorienterad – du bryr dig om kodkvalitet och dokumentation.
 



 Du trivs i team där man lär av varandra, bidrar till gemensamma mål och gärna delar med sig av kunskap. Du är självgående, hjälpsam och prestigelös – och tvekar inte att fråga när du stöter på hinder.
 



  





**Vad erbjuder vi** 




 • En nyckelroll i utvecklingen av AP4:s kvantitativa analysverktyg
 



 • Möjlighet att arbeta i teknikens framkant med koppling till finans
 



 • En inkluderande och värderingsdriven kultur där samarbete står i centrum
 



 • Kompetenta kollegor i en lärande miljö
 



 • Centralt beläget kontor i Stockholm city
 



  





**Om företaget** 




 Fjärde AP-fondens (AP4) uppdrag är att bidra till ekonomisk trygghet för dagens och morgondagens pensionärer. Vårt långsiktiga perspektiv, ansvarstagande som ägare och fokus på hållbarhet skapar möjligheter till hög avkastning till låg kostnad. AP4 förvaltade vid utgången av 2024 548 miljarder kronor, fördelat över flera tillgångsslag, i Sverige och internationellt och i såväl noterade som onoterade tillgångar. AP4:s avkastning 2024 var 10,1 procent och över tid har AP4:s goda avkastning givit ett betydande bidrag till det allmänna pensionssystemet.
 



  





 Våra medarbetares engagemang och kompetens är avgörande framgångsfaktorer vid förvaltningen av fondkapitalet. Vi är en flexibel kunskapsorganisation med djup specialistkompetens. AP4 tror på en inkluderande arbetsplats och arbetar aktivt för att skapa jämställdhet och mångfald i organisationen. Vår verksamhet kännetecknas av affärsmässighet, nytänkande, genomförandekraft och laganda. Läs mer om AP4 här: www.ap4.se
 



  





 Fjärde AP-fonden förbereds nu inför ett större förvaltat kapital
 



 AP4 genomför nu förberedelser för att ta emot och förvalta ett större kapital från och med 2026. Det innebär att AP4 kommer att stärka upp vissa befintliga enheter, vakanser och nyrekryteringar som har pausats under lagprocessen.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 I denna rekrytering samarbetar AP4 med SJR. Urval och intervjuer kommer att ske löpande – ansök därför gärna så snart som möjligt, dock senast 13 maj.
 



 Om du har du frågor om tjänsten, kring något som inte framgår av annonsen, är du varmt välkommen att maila dem till ansvarig rekryteringskonsult: hendrik.dahlgren@sjr.se
 



 Vänligen notera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via mail eller meddelanden på LinkedIn.

title: Applied AI Customer Engineer, Google Cloud (English, Nordics)
description:
**Note:** By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Stockholm, Sweden; Helsinki, Finland; Copenhagen, Denmark; Oslo, Norway.
  
  

**Minimum qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, AI, Applied Math, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* 10 years of experience in a customer-facing role in the enterprise technology space.
* Experience building conversational applications and contact center applications.
* Experience building integrations using one or more of the following languages: Python, Node.js, Go, or Java.
* Ability to communicate in English and one of the local nordics languages fluently to manage client relationships in the region.


**Preferred qualifications:**  

* Experience working with modern cloud architectures and technologies.
* Experience with contact center technologies and platforms (e.g., Avaya, Genesys, Cisco, Mitel, Twilio, Liveperson, etc.) or Cloud Contact Center solutions.
* Experience with Google Cloud's artificial intelligence solutions.
* Experience in business strategy, business development and translating customer needs into solutions.
* Ability to collaborate effectively across organizational boundaries and ambiguous, matrixed environments while building relationships to achieve business goals.


About the job
  
  

As an EMEA Applied AI Customer Engineer, you will be responsible for growing the adoption of Google’s Applied AI Customer Engagement Suite in EMEA by virtue of your experience in building conversational applications. You will form part of a highly specialized technical team that engages directly with customers and partners with the focus on generating value for customers with AI-driven customer engagement, and thereby accelerating the usage and adoption of Applied AI, and especially Conversational AI solutions on Google Cloud Platform.
  
In this role, you will work with cross-functional peers to support selected enterprise customers in their AI Customer Engagement journey, working closely with peers in Sales, Partner team, Product, and Engineering. You will support growing the ecosystem of partners by running technical workshops and training. You will run customer demonstrations and small proofs of concept and provide feedback to Global Product Leads and Product Management to ensure customer success, and influence the evolution of the product to meet customer needs.Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

* Secure technical wins with top EMEA customers, by showcasing the Google Cloud Customer Engagement Suite, Including Conversational Agents, Agent Assist, Conversational Insights and Google Contact Center AI Platform (CCaaS), etc.
* Build custom demos and presentations aligned with customers’ unique needs, running technical workshops, answering RFPs (Request for Proposal).
* Understand customers' needs to create and lead technical workshops, including creating and presenting content, building demos to illustrate customer value, and supporting customers post-sales to ensure continued success.
* Work with peers in the Google partner team, support efforts to build and nurture a community of AI partners and practitioners for Applied AI across EMEA.
* Ensure field readiness on Customer Engagement Suite, including contributing to internal training as a lead expert, and contributing to the internal and external Applied AI community.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See alsoGoogle's EEO Policy andEEO is the Law. title: Konsultuppdrag | Lead Data Platform Engineer
description:
Start Date: 2025-05-05  

End Date: 2025-11-07


Location: Stockholm/hybrid

  

We’re now looking for a hands-on Lead Data Platform Engineer to help us kickstart this journey. You’ll design and build key components, make pragmatic technology choices, and work closely with platform, infrastructure and engineering teams to create a scalable, developer-friendly data platform.  

  

We’re looking for someone who thrives on rolling up their sleeves — writing code, solving integration challenges, and delivering real value from day one — while also bringing a structured mindset, curiosity, and strategic thinking to help shape the platform long term.  

  

What You’ll Do  

* Design, implement and integrate core platform components for dataset catalog, storage standards, publishing SDKs, orchestration and metadata tracking
* Evaluate and integrate open-source tools like Flyte, Dagster, Amundsen, DataHub
* Help shape how Databricks fits into the platform strategy and make it play well with the rest of the platform
* Establish conventions and tooling for dataset formats (e.g. Parquet), versioning, access control, and schema definitions
* Help define and build the golden path for producing and consuming datasets across teams
* Embed platform thinking into everything — making the platform extensible, observable, and pleasant to use

  

You Might Be a Fit If You…  

* Have 7+ years of hands-on software engineering experience, including building data-intensive systems or platforms
* Are familiar with data pipeline orchestration (Airflow, Flyte, Dagster, etc.)
* Know your way around cloud platforms, ideally with Azure, but GCP or AWS is also fine
* Are comfortable working with Databricks and its ecosystem – hands-on experience is a strong plus
* Understand the value of metadata, lineage, and data product ownership
* Have experience building or contributing to internal platforms, developer tools or shared services
* Are comfortable with Python and CLI tooling, and ideally know SQL as well
* Are pragmatic: you can balance speed and structure, you ship iteratively, and you’re not religious about tools
* Can work across team boundaries, explain your thinking clearly, and enjoy helping others succeed

  

Nice to Have  

* Experience integrating with tools like Power BI, Backstage, or open metadata catalogs
* Familiarity with Delta Lake and architectures (e.g. lakehouse)
* Background in data engineering, operations, or developer experience roles
**Om oss**

*Senterprise Consulting är ett eget affärsområde inom Senterprise Sverige och är en ledande oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter.*  

*Genom aktiv headhunting och search och en omfattande teknisk förståelse hjälper Senterprise Sverige de främsta arbetsgivarna att hitta de mest lämpade kandidaterna för både anställning och konsultbehov.*  

*Läs vidare på* *www.senterprise.se*

title: AI Automation Lead
description:
**Sambla Group is a fintech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.**

**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Our vision is to democratize lending and empower customers to improve their personal finances. Through our well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahalaitos, Omalaina, Rahoitu and DigiFinans we support customers in consolidating and getting the best terms on their loans.**


As the AI & Automation Lead at Sambla Group, you will be responsible for spearheading the development and implementation of Generative AI, Intelligent Agents, and Robotic Process Automation (RPA) across our organization. Your role will involve not only technical leadership but also strategic vision to drive AI and automation adoption, maximize business benefits, and foster a culture of innovation.

  

**Responsibilities:**

* Identify and develop new use cases for Generative AI products, Intelligent Agents, and RPA solutions within the Sambla Group.
* Execute and build the Gen AI Platform strategy and a platform for the entire group.
* Lead and drive the adoption of various Gen AI solutions, Intelligent Agents, and RPA initiatives across Sambla Group, including developer experience, end-customer solutions, and automation via multi-agent workflows.
* Build, maintain, and lead an Engineering team to develop a robust Gen AI Platform and its use cases.
* Execute scaling mechanisms to transition projects from idea to proof-of-concept/value to production.
* Maintain effective stakeholder management to ensure alignment and support, and effectively communicate complex ideas.
* Design and guide best practices and architectural guidelines for AI model development, testing, deployment, monitoring, and auditing, with a focus on responsible tech.
* Strategize the deployment of AI & Automation to enhance customer experiences, optimize operational efficiencies, and bolster the company's competitive edge.

**Must-Have Requirements:**

* Deep demonstrable expertise in AI, particularly in LLM and RPA, with a strong background in data science or engineering.
* Proven track record in leading digital transformation projects and AI product development/deployment.
* Strong knowledge in Generative AI technologies, platforms, and Intelligent Agents.
* Expertise in project management and agile methodologies.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.


In addition to the must-have requirements, candidates with experience in cloud-based AI solutions, familiarity with data privacy regulations, a background in machine learning and data analytics, and a vision aligned with redefining personal finances through cutting-edge technology will be highly regarded.

  


**What we offer:**

* Business in mind & people at heart – we deliver results together and celebrate our achievements.
* A varied and challenging role in a multinational and highly innovative company, where we value the development of our employees
* We are strong believers in creating a fun workplace where people enjoy coming to work.
* A friendly culture with openness and respect for one another, with the possibility to influence and make a difference on society and people’s everyday lives.  

  

Please note!
  

As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

title: Head of Data Architecture and Governance
description:
**Sambla Group is a tech company with a clear goal – to make loans better for all. We need you, your ambition and your skills on our journey. We have become the fast-growing fintech company that we are today - bridging the gap between borrowers and lenders - thanks to all the 300+ amazing people who work here.**

**Our success is the result of the commitment to deliver the best customer journey and consumer finance products in the industry. Together with well known brands such as Sambla, Advisa, Rahoitu, DigiFinans and Omalaina we help customers improve their personal finances by comparing and consolidating their loans.**

**We at Sambla Group are looking for a Head of Data Architect and Governance!** To lead the design, implementation, and evolution of our data architecture and governance framework. This role is critical in building a scalable, reliable, and secure data foundation that supports current reporting and analytics needs while paving the way for next-generation, AI-driven solutions. You will mentor a talented team, champion data best practices across the organization, and ensure our data assets are managed effectively, ethically, and in compliance with regulations like GDPR and DORA.


We are looking for a unique blend of technical depth, strategic thinking, leadership capability, and a genuine excitement for building something impactful in a fast-paced scale-up environment.

### **Essential Experience & Skills:**

**Proven Leadership**: Demonstrable experience (minimum 3-5 years) leading, managing, and mentoring technical teams (Data Engineers, Architects, Analysts).

**Data Architecture Expertise**: Deep understanding and hands-on experience designing, building, and managing modern, scalable data warehouse solutions, particularly on cloud platforms (GCP/BigQuery strongly preferred).

**Data Modeling Mastery:** Expertise in various data modeling techniques and best practices for analytical workloads. Proven ability to design robust and understandable data models.

**Data Governance Implementation**: Track record of successfully defining, implementing, and operationalizing data governance frameworks, policies, and processes in mid-to-large sized organizations.

**Modern Data Stack Proficiency:** Strong hands-on experience with tools like dbt and cloud data warehouses (BigQuery preferred, Snowflake/Redshift acceptable). Solid understanding of ELT paradigms.

**BI Tooling Architecture:** Experience designing data structures optimized for BI tools, specifically Power BI.

**Stakeholder Management:** Proven ability to effectively engage with, influence, and manage expectations of diverse stakeholders (technical and non-technical) across different levels in mid-to-large organizations.

**Regulatory Awareness:** Solid understanding and practical experience working with data privacy regulations, particularly GDPR, within data architecture and governance contexts (tracking, monitoring, compliance).

**Technical Foundations:** Expert-level SQL skills are mandatory.

**Communication:** Exceptional communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills in English. (Swedish or another Nordic language is a plus).

### **Desirable Experience & Skills:**

  

Experience working within the Fintech or Financial Services industry.


Experience thriving in a fast-paced, high-growth scale-up environment.


Direct, hands-on experience with the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) data stack (BigQuery, Dataflow, Pub/Sub, etc.).


Experience evaluating, selecting, and implementing Metadata Management or Data Catalog tools.


Familiarity with designing data solutions that support AI/ML workloads and data science workflows.


Proficiency in Python for data engineering or scripting tasks.


Experience with Data Quality specific tooling.


Knowledge of specific governance frameworks like DAMA-DMBOK.

### **Personal Attributes:**

  

Dynamic & Ambitious: Energetic, proactive, and eager to take on challenges and drive significant impact. Not afraid to roll up sleeves when needed.


Personable & Collaborative: Excellent interpersonal skills; builds rapport easily and fosters a positive, collaborative team environment. Adept at influencing and working across teams.


Strategic Thinker, Pragmatic Doer: Ability to develop a long-term vision while simultaneously delivering tangible results in the short-to-medium term. Balances perfection with pragmatism.


Passionate & Enthusiastic: Genuinely excited by the potential of data, innovative technologies (including AI), and the opportunity to contribute to a mission-driven scale-up helping customers manage their finances.


Structured & Detail-Oriented: Possesses strong organizational skills and attention to detail, crucial for architecture and governance.


Problem Solver: Analytical mindset with a knack for identifying issues and designing effective solutions.


Adaptable: Comfortable navigating ambiguity and evolving priorities typical of a scale-up environment.

**Why Join Us?**
----------------


This is a unique opportunity to shape the data foundation of a rapidly growing Nordic fintech leader. You will have significant autonomy, lead a talented team, work with a modern tech stack, and play a key role in enabling our next phase of growth and innovation, including harnessing the power of AI. If you are an ambitious, personable leader passionate about data architecture and governance, excited to make a tangible impact in a dynamic scale-up, we want to hear from you.

  

Please note!  

As part of our efforts to foster an unbiased recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to not include picture, gender, ethnicity, religion, disability, sexual orientation or age in your CV.

title: Senior Azure Cloud Platform Engineer
description:
**Job Title**: Senior Azure Cloud Platform Engineer  
**Reports** **To**: Azure Cloud Platform Lead  
**Location**: Remote

**About us:**

Welcome to Pinnacle, the ultimate destination for sports enthusiasts seeking an exhilarating sportsbook and gaming experience! Established in 1998, we have solidified our position as one of the globe's foremost licensed online gaming companies. With our cutting-edge offerings, we guarantee an electrifying experience that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

Pinnacle invites you to join our team and become an instrumental figure in the exciting realm of sportsbetting. Our vibrant team is fueled by passion and driven by innovation, working together to redefine the landscape of sports betting and gaming. Together, we constantly strive to surpass limitations and deliver unparalleled experiences to sports enthusiasts worldwide. Prepare yourself for a thrilling journey and discover sports in an entirely new dimension with Pinnacle!

**Role Overview**

Senior Azure Cloud Platform Engineer will play a key part in designing, implementing, and optimizing company’s Azure cloud infrastructure solutions. The ideal candidate will bring a strong background in cloud technologies, hands-on experience with implementation of infrastructure as code (IaC) approach with leveraging tools such as Azure ARM templates and Azure Bicep and Kubernetes to automate and deliver Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Software as a Service (SaaS) solutions based on industry best practices and current trends. You will be responsible to provision and manage of cloud infrastructure on Azure public cloud to support organizational needs. You will work closely with IT and Software development teams to ensure the delivery of best of breed solutions that meet or exceed RTO/RPO requirements.

The selected candidate should have extensive experience in Azure as well as design of containerized solutions based on Azure Kubernetes Services.

**Key Responsibilities:** 

* Design, build and deliver Azure native cloud solutions to support organizational migration to the cloud.
* Configure and implement monitoring functionalities to provide best visibility and transparency to level 1 support teams.
* Train junior members of the team to deliver best of breed solutions on top of Azure public cloud.
* Design and manage upgrade and migration life cycles for all systems that are hosted in Azure cloud.
* Participate in production incidents resolution task force to minimize downtime.
* Be part of network and security design for all infrastructure and applications hosted in Azure.
* Provide support to software development and RnD teams to evaluate, implement and monitor technology solutions.
* Continuously promote better ways to deliver Infrastructure solutions on Azure cloud.
* Propose adoption of new approaches, patterns, techniques, and ideas recommended by industry standards and industry trends.
* Work closely with IT, Software development and RnD teams to understand pain points of current solutions and identify better approaches to hosting company’s solutions on the cloud.

**Experience:**

* 5+ years of proven experience in delivering infrastructure solutions on Azure cloud.
* 5+ years of hands-on with infrastructure design and deployment utilizing PaaS, SaaS and IaaS cloud offerings.
* 5+ years working with Azure ARM templates and Azure Biceps
* 3+ years of hands-on experience designing, building, and deploying containerized runtime environments based on Azure Kubernetes Services
* Provent experience with scripting languages like: PowerShell, Python, JavaScript

**Qualifications:** 

* AZ-104 (Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate) - **required**
* AZ-305 (Designing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions**)\* –** required\*
* CKA (Certified Kubernetes Administrator) - **required**
* Solid expertise using code repositories like GIT is a must.
* Experience delivering deployment solutions using GitOps approach is a big plus
* Strong analytic, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail
* Flexible and able to adapt to operational requirements and priority changes.
* Self-motivated, team player, tasks coordination, action Adapt to changes in technology and results oriented.
* Well organized, good communication and reporting skills
* Strong understanding of the software deployment life cycle

**This role requires candidates to have their core working hours aligned with business operations in either Europe or North America, depending on assignment. Successful candidates must be able to work within these time zones to support regional offices, ensure effective collaboration, and provide timely operational support. Flexibility may be required for occasional meetings or critical incidents outside of core hours.**

*We are an equal opportunity employer dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace. We prioritize hiring the best candidates based on their skills and qualifications, irrespective of race, gender, age, religion, or any other characteristic. Our strength lies in our diverse teams, and we proudly celebrate and empower everyone to embrace and promote diversity throughout their time with us.*

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: Remote

title: Azure Kubernetes Engineer
description:
**Job Title**: Azure Kubernetes Engineer  
**Reports** **To**: Azure Cloud Practice Team Lead  
**Location**: Remote

**About us:**

Welcome to Pinnacle, the ultimate destination for sports enthusiasts seeking an exhilarating sportsbook and gaming experience! Established in 1998, we have solidified our position as one of the globe's foremost licensed online gaming companies. With our cutting-edge offerings, we guarantee an electrifying experience that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

Pinnacle invites you to join our team and become an instrumental figure in the exciting realm of sportsbetting. Our vibrant team is fueled by passion and driven by innovation, working together to redefine the landscape of sports betting and gaming. Together, we constantly strive to surpass limitations and deliver unparalleled experiences to sports enthusiasts worldwide. Prepare yourself for a thrilling journey and discover sports in an entirely new dimension with Pinnacle!

**Role Overview**

We are seeking a highly skilled **Kubernetes Specialist** to join our **Azure Cloud Practice Team.** This role will focus on migrating large and complex systems to **Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)** while ensuring best practices in **Kubernetes networking, cluster design, security, and automation**. The ideal candidate will work closely with development teams, many of whom have limited Kubernetes experience, to enable seamless application modernization.

This role offers an exciting opportunity to work on cutting-edge technologies, contribute to high-impact projects, and collaborate with a team of industry experts. If you are looking for a challenging yet rewarding position that allows you to make a significant impact, we encourage you to apply.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Migration & Optimization**

* Design and execute full application migrations to AKS.
* Refactor workloads and optimize Kubernetes environments for performance, security, and scalability.
* Implement blue/green cluster and node pool strategies for zero-downtime deployments.

**Kubernetes Design & Development**

* Architect and manage multi-cluster, multi-region deployments with robust networking configurations.
* Develop custom controllers, operators, and automation scripts to enhance AKS management.
* Implement service mesh solutions to improve microservices networking and security.

**Security, Compliance & Best Practices**

* Enforce Pod Security Standards, Kubernetes Role-Based Access Control (RBAC), and compliance frameworks.
* Implement network policies, security controls, and container runtime security strategies.
* Ensure adherence to Azure security best practices for Kubernetes workloads.

**Collaboration & Developer Enablement**

* Work closely with developers to provide guidance on Kubernetes YAML files, Helm charts, and Kustomize overlays.
* Enable development teams to self-manage their Kubernetes deployments using GitOps practices.
* Advocate for best practices in containerization, CI/CD, and infrastructure as code.

**Required Qualifications:**

**Technical Skills & Experience**

* **5+ years of experience** working with Kubernetes and containerized environments.
* Strong expertise in AKS cluster design, deep Kubernetes networking, and security policies.
* Experience with multi-cluster, multi-region Kubernetes deployments.
* Hands-on experience with blue/green deployments, node pool strategies, and workload optimization.
* Proficiency in Helm, Kustomize, Terraform, and automation scripting (Bash, Python, or PowerShell).
* Knowledge of Azure networking, identity management, and security best practices for Kubernetes.
* Proven experience managing environment and deployments to AKS using GitOps solutions like ArgoCD is a must

**Certifications**

* **Mandatory:**
* Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA)
* Certified Kubernetes Application Developer (CKAD)
* Microsoft Azure Solutions Architect Expert (AZ-305)
* **Preferred:**
* Certified Kubernetes Security Specialist (CKS)
* Microsoft Azure Administrator Associate (AZ-104)

**Nice-to-Have Skills**

* Experience with OpenTelemetry, Prometheus, Grafana, or Azure Monitor for observability.
* Exposure to policy enforcement tools such as Kyverno or OPA/Gatekeeper.

**Work Environment & Expectations**

* Embedded within the Azure Cloud Practice Team, collaborating closely with development teams.

**This role requires candidates to have their core working hours aligned with business operations in either Europe or North America, depending on assignment. Successful candidates must be able to work within these time zones to support regional offices, ensure effective collaboration, and provide timely operational support. Flexibility may be required for occasional meetings or critical incidents outside of core hours.**

*We are an equal opportunity employer dedicated to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace. We prioritize hiring the best candidates based on their skills and qualifications, irrespective of race, gender, age, religion, or any other characteristic. Our strength lies in our diverse teams, and we proudly celebrate and empower everyone to embrace and promote diversity throughout their time with us.*

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: Remote

title: Data Scientist in Husqvarna Groups new AI org!
description:
*Imagine a place where your passion for technology meets the thrill of innovation. Picture yourself as part of a dynamic team, driving tangible business impact - through innovative AI solutions.* *Welcome to our world!*
About this opportunity:
This is a chance to be part of a team that's passionate about building something meaningful. The thrill of working on research projects that push the boundaries of technology, a collaborative environment where your ideas are valued and your contributions make a real impact. The opportunity to proactively drive the agenda - and shape the future of AI.
Here, we are a close-knit team of people working in data, AI and cloud, with colleagues both in India and in Sweden. Our mission? To scale AI - and pioneer forward-leading technology, ensuring we stay ahead of the curve and deliver impactful solutions.
You will:
As a Data Scientist, you'll be at the heart of our innovation. You'll dive into data, build models, fine-tune algorithms, and deploy solutions in cloud environments. You'll collaborate with data architects, cloud experts, software developers and other IT specialists, weaving together your expertise - to create something extraordinary.* Develop and deliver AI solutions, including data pre-processing, analysis, modelling, deployment, and maintenance.
* Design, install, test, and maintain data management systems, to meet business requirements.
* Implement scripts for database maintenance, deployment, and ETL operations.
* Manage cloud services (AWS, Azure) and relevant cloud storage systems.
* Monitor data performance and modify infrastructure, to improve pipelines and models.
* Document feature lists, user stories, and roadmaps aligned with the product vision.
* Stay updated with technology trends in data science, data engineering, and AI.
* Execute academic and research projects relevant to the AI organization.
* Support ideation processes with technical and entrepreneurial expertise.
* Identify business opportunities through technology-driven innovation.
* Participate in knowledge-sharing activities, to elevate company expertise in AI.


Who We're Looking For:
A great communicator - in the realm of technology. Maybe you’ve started your journey in software development - and found your way into the world of AI. Maybe you've worked in startups (or another innovative environment), where you didn't just code - you pitched ideas, drove innovation, and created solutions that made a *difference*. In any environment, you see opportunity in uncertainty, and you like to challenge yourself to learn new areas.
Your craftsmanship in writing exceptional code and delivery of high-quality products are your strengths. You're not just a coder; you are also a team-player, a communicator, an innovator, a social person - who knows how to communicate complex concepts effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
At Husqvarna, we strive to have a work environment that is inclusive and diverse, where we believe that our differences are our strengths. Therefore, our winning culture is very important to us, which is why we go by the beliefs: We are Bold, We are Dedicated and We Care.
Your Skills and Qualifications:* A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field and at least 5 years of experience in developing and delivering data and AI solutions, as a Data Scientist, Data Engineer, Software Developer, or similar role. Knowledge of Python, SQL
* Familiarity with big data technologies, like Spark.
* Experience leading and collaborating on cross-functional projects.
* Experience with developing prescriptive solutions to support decision making and experimentation.


Location:
Location for this position is in Sweden at one of our offices in Stockholm, Huskvarna, or Jonsered (outside Gothenburg).
But, with our hybrid working environment, you'll have the flexibility to work both onsite and remotely, promoting work-life balance for all team members. We meet in the office at least 2-3 days a week (50%).
Your application:
If this sounds like the adventure you’ve been waiting for, we want to hear from you! Apply as soon as possible but no later than 2025-05-30. *We apply ongoing selection.*
For questions regarding the process, please contact Global Talent Acquisition Partner, Matilda Nordén matilda.norden@husqvarnagroup.com.
About Husqvarna:*Husqvarna Group is a global leader in innovative solutions for managing forests, parks, and gardens, as well as cutting equipment and diamond tools for the light construction and stone industries. With an innovative mindset, we are dedicated to deliver high-quality solutions ranging from robotic mowers to chainsaws, watering systems and power cutters, with a strong focus on our customers and future generations.**Founded in the Swedish town Huskvarna in 1689, we have been pioneers in our business for more than three centuries. Today, we are mainly operating under the Husqvarna and Gardena brands, serving consumers and professionals in over 100 countries through direct sales, dealers, and retailers. Headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, Husqvarna Group employs approximately 13,300 people in 40 countries and reported net sales of SEK 48,4 billion in 2024.* *Husqvarna Group is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm.*
Last date to apply:
30 May 2025

title: Konferenskoordinator sökes till vårt fantastiska team på Malmö Arena Hotel!
description:
Malmö Arena Hotel är ett familjeägt och färgrikt destinationshotell på bästa läge i Malmö Hyllie, endast 12 minuter från Köpenhamns flygplats. Med 395 rum är vi Malmös näst största hotell. Hos oss njuter du av en god natts sömn, kökets genuina mathantverk och den enastående utsikten i Skybaren. Hotellet ligger i Hyllie, Malmös mest hållbara stadsdel och ett av Nordens mest dynamiska mötes- och evenemangsområden. Vill du vara en del av Malmö Arena Hotel och bidra till att leverera en förstklassig service till våra gäster? Har du service ut i fingerspetsarna och brinner för att överträffa gästens förväntningar? Då är du den vi söker!
Är du en positiv och lösningsorienterad person som älskar att ge service i världsklass? Trivs du med högt tempo, ansvar och varierande arbetsdagar? Då kan det vara just dig vi letar efter! Vi söker nu en konferenskoordinator till konferensavdelningen på Malmö Arena Hotel. Tjänsten är ett föräldravikariat på ca 1 år med start i aug/sept. Vikariatet är på heltid.


**Om rollen**  

Som konferenskoordinator är du en nyckelperson för att våra konferensgäster ska känna sig välkomna, trivas och vilja komma tillbaka. Du hanterar förfrågningar, bokningar och planerar konferenser tillsammans med både gäster och kollegor.


**Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:**


* Hantera offerter, bokningar och konferensplanering.
* Säkerställa att lokaler är rätt möblerade, att tekniken fungerar som den ska och att allt är i toppskick.
* Daglig kontakt med gäster – från ankomst till avresa
* Löpande konferensservice, hålla snygga och rent i alla våra konferensutrymmen
* Användning av bokningssystem som Opera Cloud, Proposales och Truebooking
* Genomföra visningar med gäster
* Samarbeta med andra avdelningar och bidra till en positiv arbetsmiljö


**Vi söker dig som:**


* Har erfarenhet från hotell-, konferens- eller eventbranschen
* Är stresstålig, kommunikativ och lösningsorienterad
* Trivs med både service och fysisk aktivitet (ja, vi lyfter möbler och flyttar tunga väggar!)
* Är flexibel och kan jobba kvällar/helger vid behov
* Har hög arbetsmoral, är noggrann och lättlärd
* Gillar att jobba i team men är självgående


**Extra plus:**



Du gillar att komma med idéer, har ett öga för detaljer och förstår vikten av att gästen står i centrum – alltid.



Vi erbjuder dig en rolig och varierande tjänst där du får utvecklas, ta ansvar och göra skillnad varje dag.


**Låter det här som du?**  

Skicka in din ansökan redan idag och bli en del av vårt härliga gäng! Du ansökan via länken nedan. Skicka gärna in den snarast men absolut senast den 11 maj.

title: Mekanikkonstruktör inom Fordonsindustrin
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.


Om Capgemini Engineering Capgemini Engineering är världsledande inom ingenjörstjänster. Vårt globala team av ingenjörer, forskare och arkitekter hjälper de mest innovativa företagen att frigöra sin fulla potential. Från självkörande bilar till livräddande robotar - våra digitala och mjukvarutekniska experter tänker utanför ramarna och levererar unika FoU- och ingenjörstjänster inom alla branscher. Hos oss väntar en karriär full av möjligheter där du kan göra skillnad och där ingen dag är den andra lik.
  

Nu söker vi erfarna mekanikkonstruktörer till vårt fordonsteam i Göteborg. Är du redo att forma framtidens fordon? Bli en del av vår innovativa resa!
  

Vi letar efter någon med erfarenhet av att utveckla plast- eller plåtkomponenter, med fokus på antingen interiör eller exteriör design. Din förmåga att lösa problem med energi och kreativitet, kombinerat med ett genuint teknikintresse, kommer att vara avgörande för att bygga långvariga relationer med våra världsledande fordonstillverkare.
  

**Ditt ansvar:**  

* Driva design- och utvecklingsprocessen för interiöra/exteriöra fordonskomponenter - från koncept till färdig produkt
* Säkerställa projektleveranser enligt etablerade ansvarsområden, med fokus på tidplan, teknik och kostnad
* Samarbeta i tvärfunktionella team för att integrera komponenter i större system
* Skapa och hantera teknisk dokumentation, inklusive CAD-modeller och designverifieringsplaner
* Genomföra genomförbarhetsstudier och riskbedömningar för nya designkoncept
* Utveckla och ansvara för designverifieringsplanen
* Tillämpa fordonsspecifika standarder och processer genom hela utvecklingslivscykeln

**Din profil:**  

* Bachelor of Science eller högre inom mekanik, mekatronik eller liknande
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av mekanikkonstruktion
* Gedigen kunskap inom plast och/eller plåt
* God förståelse för fordonsspecifika standarder och processer
* Expertis i CAD-system (t.ex. CATIA V5, Creo)
* Erfarenhet av PLM- och PDM-system (t.ex. Teamcenter, Windchill PDM-Link, KOLA, KDP)
* Flytande engelska i tal och skrift (svenska och körkort är meriterande)
* Erfarenhet av personbilar och/eller tunga fordon är ett plus
* Proaktiv och positiv attityd med förmåga att hitta innovativa lösningar
* Entusiasm för teknisk utveckling och förmåga att inspirera andra

**Vi erbjuder:**  

* Spännande projekt med ledande företag inom fordonsindustrin
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling genom Capgemini Engineering Academy
* Innovativ och hållbarhetsfokuserad arbetsmiljö
* Balans mellan arbete och privatliv med extra semesterdagar

• Konkurrenskraftiga förmåner inklusive pensionsplan, försäkringar och friskvårdsbidrag • Deltagande i globala ingenjörsgemenskaper och interna nätverk
  

* Trygga anställningsvillkor genom kollektivavtal

Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och bidra till framtidens fordonsindustri? Ansök nu och var med och forma morgondagens mobilitet!
Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
