title: Senior Data Analyst to KYC-AML Data Analytics team \u007C SEB, Stockholm
description:
Are you a Senior Data Analyst who wants to create value through data and innovation and is motivated by delivering customer value with high quality? Do you also have a proactive attitude when it comes to continuous improvements and investigating new technologies and concepts and at the same time have experience of building data products in form of models or dashboards? If so, this is probably a position for you! **What you will be doing:**  

As a Senior Data Analyst, your role is crucial in driving the data architecture strategy across the KYC organization and its stakeholders. We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst that can work as a quantitative risk model developer to join our KYC-AML Data Analytics team.  

This role will focus on enhancing, validating, and maintaining Customer Due Diligence (CDD) models within the scope of the Anti-Money Laundering (AML) directive as well as delivering insights to the key stakeholders with dashboards and adhoc analysis or other data models. Collaboration, communication, and technical expertise are essential in this role. **Key Responsibilities:*** **Analyze and Interpret Complex Data Sets:** Analyze complex data-related problems, propose well-founded solutions, and drive the work from inception to completion.
* **Design and Implement Data Models and Architectures:** Ensure data models represent business concepts and requirements, adhere to industry best practices, and support data sharing, governance, and quality initiatives.
* **Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams:** Ensure data integrity and security by collaborating with business stakeholders, IT teams, and other cross-functional teams.

 **Who we are looking for:**  

You have a very good understanding of Data frameworks and how to implement it in an efficient way to an organization that is heading into a predominantly Cloud based environment. You are committed to providing high-level service and are a true team player with a strong ability to build relationships with colleagues. You are prestigeless and driven with a can-do attitude.  

You have a documented track record in working with data and analytics and know what is required to truly leverage it. **Qualifications:*** Applicants must possess native or professional-level proficiency in Swedish. Applications that do not meet this requirement will not be considered.
* Experience in working with BI tools such as Looker, Tableau, Power BI and data warehouses
* Proficiency in Python (or Scala, Rust, C++, Go, Julia)
* Expertise in data modeling, SQL, and data visualization tools.
* Experience in working with GCP Data Stack, especially BigQuery
* Strong knowledge of model monitoring techniques, performance metrics, and model validation methodologies
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to understand complex business requirements.
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
* Having worked in an agile setup.

 **Why Join SEB?**  

At SEB, we believe that diversity and inclusion are key to our success. We foster a value-driven culture where employees feel respected, valued, and empowered—no matter their background, beliefs, or identity. We look forward to receiving your application and learning more about how you can contribute to SEB. Welcome with your application! **Welcome with your application**  

Attach your CV and a personal letter describing yourself and how you can contribute to SEB. Since we meet candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 2025-05-18. In case of uncertainty or if you have questions about the position, please, contact Can Kuruca, can.kuruca@seb.se
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: SAM-Konsult
description:
Just nu söker vi inom Ateas affärsområde Software Cloud & Services dig som vill arbeta som Software Asset Management-konsult (SAM-konsult) med fokus på mjukvaruhantering och tillhörande tjänster. Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som präglas av medarbetare som brinner för att bygga Sverige med it, tar personligt ansvar och sätter laget före jaget. Vi kallar oss stolt för landslaget i informationsteknologi.


**Din roll**
------------



Vi söker dig som vill arbeta med att hjälpa våra kunder att optimera och hantera sina mjukvarulicenser och tillgångar med tydliga planer och långsiktiga mål. I rollen som SAM-konsult kommer du att arbeta nära våra kunder för att säkerställa att de får ut maximalt värde av sina mjukvaruinvesteringar. Du kommer att samarbeta med interna kundteam och våra strategiska partners för att leverera högkvalitativa tjänster och lösningar. Till din hjälp har du ett av IT-branschens starkaste varumärken, ett team med kollegor som sätter laget före jaget och en vältrimmad leveransorganisation. Atea jobbar med de flesta stora mjukvarutillverkare som exempelvis Adobe, AWS, Cisco, Citrix, Fortinet, Google, IBM, Microsoft, Oracle, Red Hat och VMware.


**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**


* Hjälpa våra kunder att optimera och hantera sina mjukvarulicenser och tillgångar på en operativ såväl som en strategisk och taktisk nivå.
* Guida våra kunder för att bli deras trusted advisor inom mjukvaruhantering, licensstrategier, licenser och licensavtal.
* Utföra licensrevisioner och compliance-kontroller för att säkerställa att kunderna följer licensavtal och regler.
* Analysera och rapportera om mjukvaruanvändning för att hjälpa och stötta kunder att få kontroll över sina mjukvarukostnader.
* Utbilda kunder och interna team om bästa praxis för mjukvaruhantering och licensoptimering.
* Utveckla och implementera strategier för effektiv mjukvaruhantering och
* Skapa och genomföra SAM-planer för att säkerställa långsiktig hållbarhet och effektivitet i kundernas mjukvaruhantering.

**Ditt Team**
-------------



Som SAM-konsult kommer du att rapportera till **André Kronvall, en konsultchef** som värdesätter ett nära och stöttande ledarskap. André arbetar aktivt för att vara tillgänglig och engagerad i dina framgångar och utveckling. Samtidigt förväntar han sig att du är självgående, drivande, kunna arbeta i team och tar fullt ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och mål.



För André är det också viktigt att du blir en del av teamet, där samarbete och laganda står i fokus. Han uppskattar när du bidrar till gruppens dynamik och tar initiativ när det behövs, samtidigt som han finns där för att stötta och vägleda vid behov.



Eftersom du arbetar i en nationell enhet har du kollegor över hela Sverige, ditt team finns från Malmö till Umeå och vi arbetar på en nationell nivå tillsammans med alla Ateas kontor. Tillsammans delar ni målet att fortsätta bygga Sverige med it, med Ateas starka varumärke och vältrimmade organisation som stöd.


**Vem är du?**
--------------



Vi tror på dig och dina personliga egenskaper, som också är avgörande för att du ska lyckas i rollen och trivas hos oss. Du är driven i ditt arbete och motiveras av att hjälpa våra kunder. Du tar fullt ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och är van att driva dina processer framåt på ett strukturerat och självständigt sätt mot tydliga deadlines. Du är bra på att skapa relationer, ger ett förtroendeingivande intryck och har alltid kundens bästa i fokus. Du söker lösningar på uppkomna problem, gillar utmaningar och fungerar konstruktivt både på egen hand och i grupp. För att lyckas i rollen tror vi även att du:


* Har god kunskap och erfarenhet inom it, gärna inom mjukvaruområdet. Meriterande om du tidigare har arbetat inom software asset management eller i en IT-projektledarroll.
* Drivs av att guida dina kunder framåt på deras digitaliseringsresa och att försöka förtjäna förtroendet som deras trusted advisor.
* Gillar förändring då arbetsuppgifterna skiftar i karaktär och omfattning.
* Har tidigare erfarenhet av mjukvaruhantering och licenshantering.
* Har förmågan att tänka strategiskt och utveckla långsiktiga planer för mjukvaruhantering.


**Om Atea**
-----------



Visste du att Atea är den ledande leverantören av IT-infrastruktur i Norden och Baltikum? I Sverige är vi runt 2700 medarbetare fördelade på 35 kontor runt om i hela landet. Vår styrka ligger i vår kombination av lokal närvaro, vårt omfattande och heltäckande erbjudande samt alla våra specialister. Tillsammans med våra kunder och partners bygger vi Sverige med IT och förbättra vardagen för skolbarn, lärare, äldre, sjukvård och näringslivet. Hos oss får du vara en del av världens mest hållbara IT-servicebolag, där vi är med och påskyndar omställningen mot en mer hållbar IT-värld.



På Atea blir du en del av en vardag och en kultur som präglas av framåtanda, laganda och humor. Vi har en vision om att vara "The Place to Be" – en plats där alla växer och trivs, med kollegor som bryr sig om dig, om kunderna och om samhället.


**Kontakt & mer information**
-----------------------------



Välkommen med din ansökan! Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Daniel Kermfors, försäljningschef, via andre.kronvall@atea.se eller 0738-622673. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av oss på Atea och vi undanber oss därför alla samtal och eventuella förslag från rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag.



Atea vill vara The Place To Be, den självklara platsen, för alla människor då vi värdesätter och jobbar aktivt med mångfald och inkludering.



Som ett kvalitativt led i vårt rekryteringsarbete genomgår våra slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om våra framtida medarbetare.


**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**

  


**Följ oss i sociala medier**

title: Business Development Professional
description:
Your Title: Business Development Professional (m/f/d)
Job Location: remote in Sweden or Norway, Netherlands, Finland and Belgium.
If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for driving business growth, we would love to hear from you.
What You Will Do
As the Business Development Professional, you will be responsible for evaluating and managing new strategic business opportunities such as mergers, acquisitions, partnerships, alliances, and joint ventures. You will oversee the development of strategic market and product line business plans and marketing programs to support sales in designated market segments. Your role will involve identifying volume and strategic customers and developing valuable partnerships. Additionally, you will analyze market data to identify trends and opportunities, develop strategic directions from market information, and create compelling market analysis presentations.
Joining Trimble as a Business Development Professional offers you the opportunity to play a pivotal role in our strategic growth initiatives.
Key Responsibilities:* Evaluate and Manage Strategic Business Opportunities: Identify and assess new strategic business opportunities including mergers, acquisitions, partnerships, alliances, and joint ventures. Lead negotiations and manage relationships with potential partners and stakeholders to ensure successful outcomes.
* Strategic Planning and Marketing Programs: Oversee the development of strategic market and product line business plans. Create and implement marketing programs to support sales in designated market segments. Work closely with sales and marketing teams to ensure alignment and effective execution of strategies.
* Identify Strategic Customers and Develop Partnerships: Identify volume and strategic customers to expand the company’s market presence. Develop and nurture partnerships that drive business growth and add value to the organization.
* Market Data Analysis and Strategic Direction: Analyze market data to identify trends and opportunities that can be leveraged for business growth. Develop strategic directions based on market information and company goals. Create and deliver compelling market analysis presentations to senior management and stakeholders.


What Skills & Experience You Should Bring* A minimum of 5 years of experience in a management role, preferably in a multinational environment with experience in business development, strategic planning, or a related role.
* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Geodesy, Civil Engineering, or a related field. Master's Degree or relevant advanced degree preferred.
* Proven track record of evaluating and managing strategic business opportunities.
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret market data and trends.
* Excellent strategic planning, negotiation, and relationship management skills.
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills.


About Trimble
Dedicated to the world’s tomorrow, Trimble is a technology company delivering solutions that enable our customers to work in new ways to measure, build, grow and move goods for a better quality of life. Core technologies in positioning, modeling, connectivity and data analytics connect the digital and physical worlds to improve productivity, quality, safety, transparency and sustainability. From purpose-built products and enterprise lifecycle solutions to industry cloud services, Trimble is transforming critical industries such as construction, geospatial, agriculture and transportation to power an interconnected world of work. For more information about Trimble (NASDAQ: TRMB), visit: *www.trimble.com*
About Your Location
In this role you will work from a remote office (home office).
A hybrid can be explored upon request and if a suitable Trimble location is nearby.
Trimble’s Inclusiveness Commitment
We believe in celebrating our differences. That is why our diversity is our strength. To us, that means actively participating in opportunities to be inclusive. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion have guided our current success while also moving our desire to improve. We actively seek to add members to our community who represent our customers and the places we live and work.
We have programs in place to make sure our people are seen, heard, and welcomed and most importantly that they know they belong, no matter who they are or where they are coming from.

title: Business Development Manager – Private Wireless
description:
Are you ready to be at the forefront of next-generation mobile technology?
  
Join CKH IOD and help shape the future of enterprise connectivity in Sweden and Denmark. As part of our international, innovation-driven team, you’ll bring smart, secure Private Network solutions to life – helping customers embrace the full potential of Industry 4.0.
  
  

About the Role
  
  

CKH Innovations Opportunities Development (IOD) is the innovation hub of global telecom group CK Hutchison. We’re here to explore what’s next – combining technology, creativity, and collaboration across borders.
  
  

In this role, you’ll be part of our Private Networks Centre of Excellence and report directly to IOD. However, your day-to-day work will be closely aligned with the B2B team at Tre Sweden, based in Stockholm. Together with colleagues at Tre Denmark and IOD’s international teams, you’ll identify and develop Private Network opportunities for large enterprises and multinational customers.
  
  

You’ll take the lead on securing new business – not just in selling dedicated private 4G/5G networks, but also related services like enhanced public coverage, consultancy, and Industry 4.0 applications. You’ll also represent us at industry events and contribute to marketing activities across both Sweden and Denmark.
  
  

Work with great people
  
Julia Maxén
  
Team Manager
  
"I want my team to have the best conditions to excel in their roles. By empowering each member to perform at their best, we not only grow stronger as a team but also drive Tre forward to new heights"
  
Henrik Sundvall
  
Digital Project Lead
  
"The absolute best thing about being a project manager at Tre is that I get to work broadly with colleagues from all parts of the organization and learn new things every day. I have the freedom to be myself – and be appreciated for it!"
  
Jayasri Battola
  
Developer
  
"The great work culture and the technology made me choose Tre. Working alongside great people in mixed team setups, with both experienced and new talents, along with the latest and greatest tools and technologies like Cloud and Azure."
  
  

You Can Look Forward To
  
  

* Leading high-value sales efforts and closing complex Private Network deals
* Working closely with senior stakeholders in Sweden, Denmark, and the broader CKH IOD team
* Driving digital transformation for some of the region’s largest enterprises
* Gaining hands-on experience with cutting-edge technologies and Industry 4.0 use cases
* Representing CKH IOD at public events and speaking engagements
* Influencing the strategic direction of our enterprise offering
* Thriving in a collaborative, fast-moving international environment


Who You Are
  
You’re a commercially driven sales leader with a strong grasp of technology and the ability to turn complex concepts into compelling business solutions. You’re experienced in navigating international, cross-functional environments and comfortable working with multiple stakeholders.
  
  

**Your background includes:**  

* A university degree
* Excellent communication skills in English and either Swedish or Danish
* A solid track record in business development and strategic sales
* Experience with telecom or infrastructure solutions – ideally including private 4G/5G networks
* A strategic mindset and creative approach to solving commercial or contractual challenges
* Confidence in presenting to and influencing C-level decision makers
* Strong negotiation skills and experience managing large-scale contracts
* Proficiency in MS PowerPoint, Excel, and Word – with great attention to detail


You bring energy, clarity, and a collaborative mindset. You take initiative and lead when needed – but you’re also ready to support your team to get things done.
  
  

Welcome with your application!
  
  

We are accepting applications via this job ad, and interviews are ongoing. A personal letter is not required, but we would like you to answer the questions we ask in connection with your application. We conduct assessments during the selection process to ensure an objective recruitment. Reference and background checks are conducted on the final candidate.
  
  

Great Place to Work
  
  

Health care allowance, parental pay, pension & insurance according to collective agreements
  
  

Dog zone & gym in the 3house
  
  

Great discounts on bicycles, public transport, and electric cars
  
  

Flexible holidays and five extra days off per year
  
  

Subsidized lunch
  
  

Generous bonus models or commissions
  
  

We are driven by constantly trying to improve things in new and different ways. Of course, we are at the forefront of developing future networks.
  
  

We see ourselves as a crucial part of Sweden's social structure because we know that reliable connectivity is a necessary foundation stone in today's digital world. That's why we see it as our job to keep our mobile network up and running year-round, 24/7, to ensure you can always count on being connected when you need it most.
  
  

Tre was born as a challenger and is an organization in constant motion. We strive to be at the forefront of everything we do. We are convinced that the people at Tre are decisive for our development.
  
  

No matter how you start your journey at Tre, there are endless opportunities to grow and develop with us.
  
  

WE THINK LIKE CHALLENGERS - In a constantly changing world, we stay curious and open minded. Born with a challenger mindset, we love pushing boundaries.
  
  

WE WORK LIKE CHAMPIONS - As true champions, we always do our best. We take ownership, set clear goals and stay focused. Together we´re on a winning streak.
  
  

WE ACT LIKE BUDDIES - Free to be ourselves, we treat each other with respect. Together we make a friendly bunch, born, and one tough force.
  
  

2003
  
Tre was the first in Sweden to offer video calls and mobile video streaming. At this time, seeing the person you are calling in the eyes is a completely new experience.
  
  

2006
  
Tre launches mobile broadband as the third operator in the world. Over the next five years, Tre will win awards for Sweden’s fastest mobile broadband.
  
  

2013
  
Hallon, Tre’s sister company, was created with the idea of being a simple mobile operator, free from any unnecessary fuss.
  
  

2019
  
It has been an eventful year! 3Världen was launched, allowing customers to surf in 80 countries at the same price as in Sweden. Then, 3Samla was introduced, enabling all customers to add more users to their subscription. Last but not least, Tre became the first in Sweden to launch a public 5G network.
  
  

2025
  
Tele2 Arena has been renamed 3Arena. With our strong passion for innovation, connectivity, and experiences, we will contribute to developing the arena and the area.
  
  

Johan Hörberg | Contact Person
  
  

Tre
  
  

Stockholm | Hybrid
  
Visit website

title: Join Spiideo as an Engineering Manager (Frontend)
description:
Jobbify är en jobbplattform för vassa kandidater.
  
  

För kunds räkning har vi publicerat denna annons, vill du komma i kontakt med den slutgiltiga arbetsgivaren kan du klicka dig vidare till annonsen:
  
  

At Spiideo, we're revolutionizing sports video analysis and live streaming. Our automated, cloud-based solutions empower thousands of professional teams, coaches, and media organizations worldwide to capture, analyze, and share sports content like never before.
  
  

As a fast-growing tech company, our culture thrives on openness, innovation, and a relentless focus on customer success. These values have propelled us to become a global leader in sports technology. We're now seeking a senior Engineering Manager to lead and inspire our frontend engineering team as we continue to shape the future of sports.
  
  

The Opportunity
  
  

We’re looking for a senior Engineering Manager with a rare combination of execution strength, coach-style leadership, and a proven ability to drive technical change and modernization. You will be responsible for Spiideo’s frontend team, guiding the architecture and development of our customer-facing interfaces across web and mobile.
  
  

In this hands-on leadership role, you'll partner closely with product, design, and backend teams to ensure we deliver performant, scalable, and delightful user experiences. You’ll also help us explore and apply emerging technologies like Generative AI to keep Spiideo at the forefront of sports tech innovation.
  
  

Your Responsibilities
  
  

Team Leadership & Development – Lead, mentor, and grow a team of frontend engineers, fostering a collaborative and high-performing culture.
  
  

Project Ownership – Drive the planning and execution of frontend initiatives—from concept to deployment.
  
  

Strategic Alignment – Collaborate with design, product, and backend teams to align frontend efforts with business goals and customer needs.
  
  

Technical Oversight – Guide architectural decisions, enforce coding standards, and ensure technical excellence in the frontend domain.
  
  

Innovation & Modernization – Evaluate and introduce new technologies, with a focus on performance, maintainability, and user value.
  
  

Stakeholder Collaboration – Communicate clearly and regularly with internal stakeholders to manage expectations and priorities.
  
  

What We're Looking For
  
  

Leadership Experience – 7+ years in software engineering roles, including 5+ years in engineering leadership, preferably within frontend or full-stack environments.
  
  

Frontend Knowledge – Understanding of modern frontend frameworks, performance optimization, and scalable UI architecture.
  
  

Execution & People Leadership – Strong project delivery track record combined with a coaching leadership style that supports team growth.
  
  

Modernization Mindset – Experience leading platform or architectural modernization efforts, with a forward-looking, pragmatic approach.
  
  

GenAI Understanding – Hands-on experience or strong curiosity about applying Generative AI in product and development workflows.
  
  

Strong Communication – Ability to build trust across functions and articulate technical trade-offs to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  
  

Sports Tech Passion – A genuine interest in sports and a desire to help shape the future of sports video and data.
  
  

What We Offer
  
  

Strategic Role – A key leadership position within a growing engineering organization.
  
  

Product Impact – Work on products used by professional teams, leagues, and broadcasters worldwide.
  
  

Modern Tech Stack – Work with React, TypeScript, modern APIs, and scalable cloud infrastructure.
  
  

Global Reach – Collaborate with teams across Europe and North America.
  
  

Competitive Benefits – Including pension & insurance package, wellness contributions, parental leave, and 2 hours per week for physical activity.
  
  

Location
  
  

This role is based on-site at Spiideo HQ in Malmö, Sweden. You will report to Engineering & Operations Leadership.
  
  

Application
  
  

We believe that when the best people work together in an open environment, magic happens. That's why we welcome applicants from all backgrounds to contribute their unique perspectives, skills, and experiences, fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce across Spiideo.
  
  

Screening and interviews will be ongoing.
  
Apply now and become an integral part of our success story!
  
We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Back End Engineer
description:
Your role
  
We are seeking a versatile Backend Engineer to join our dynamic team, contributing to the full software development lifecycle. You will be primarily responsible for backend development, utilizing Java and JavaScript to build robust and scalable services. A key aspect of this role involves designing, implementing, and maintaining efficient data processing. You will further contribute by handling the operational aspects of application deployments, ensuring high availability and performance.
  
  

Your role requires a collaboration across teams, acting as a crucial bridge between frontend and backend development teams. You will facilitate effective communication and ensure seamless integration of APIs and services. You will participate in troubleshooting and optimizing existing systems and identify bottlenecks in both code and infrastructure. Maintaining and improving application deployments is a critical part of your role.
  
  

Qualifications
  
Good understanding of Computer Science fundamentals, preferably a University level degree in Computer Science or equivalent education
  
You have many years of experience of building products involving both architectural design, development and deployment, preferably in Java
  
You have deep experience in developing server-side Java
  
You are experienced with server-side JavaScript in node.js
  
Proficient with operations in hosting environments, in particular with container-based deployments and system administration of a Linux stack
  
Good understanding of Web Architecture, in particular HTTP and REST
  
Knowledge of common data formats such as JSON, CSV and XML
  
Experience of Software Engineering best practices such as API design, Continuous Integration, Test-Driven Development, and Design Patterns
  
Experience of working in teams and agile projects
  
Ability to communicate fluently in English and Swedish
  
  

Bonus skills
  
Experience with ETL processes
  
Experience of creating and shipping full fledged software products
  
Experience implementing Software-as-a-Service for cloud environments
  
Familiarity with W3C Semantic Web technologies and Linked Data (RDF, SPARQL, SHACL) and associated frameworks such as Eclipse RDF4J and Apache Jena
  
  

What makes us unique?
  
**Flexible work environment:** option for several remote working days per week
  
**International Team:** we’re a mix of languages and nationalities
  
**Beautiful office with a lake view:** the office is located centrally with a view of the lake Mälaren
  
**Excellent Equipment:** we supply you with quality equipment when you work with us. Let us know what you need to thrive and we will get it for you
  
  

**More perks & benefits:**  

Swedish language courses
  
Generous training and wellness allowance
  
Free yearly health checks
  
Company bike you can use
  
Company events like ice skating, hiking, canoeing etc.
  
We strive for diversity in our team and strongly encourage applicants that are less represented in the tech sector.
  
  

About the company
  
MetaSolutions is a company based in Sweden, dedicated to innovative solutions for advanced data management by interlinking information using semantic technologies. Our vision is to be a leading company in supporting advanced data management processes using our product EntryScape (entryscape.com).
  
  

The company is today seen as a thought leader within Linked Data solutions in Sweden and other EU countries. Long term customers include the Agency for Digital Government (DIGG) where MetaSolutions has designed and developed the national dataportal (dataportal.se). Today, over 100 Swedish public organizations use MetaSolutions’ software EntryScape.
  
MetaSolutions is a subsidiary of the Swedish Internet Foundation with 120 employees in Sweden. The foundation is an independent, private foundation that works for the positive development of the internet and is also responsible for the Swedish top-level domain .se and the operation of the top-level domain .nu.
  
  

Everything we do at MetaSolutions is based on Open Source, Open Standards and Open Data. Our customers are mainly located in Sweden, Switzerland, Italy and Germany.

title: Konferenskoordinator sökes till vårt fantastiska team på Malmö Arena Hotel!
description:
Malmö Arena Hotel är ett familjeägt och färgrikt destinationshotell på bästa läge i Malmö Hyllie, endast 12 minuter från Köpenhamns flygplats. Med 395 rum är vi Malmös näst största hotell. Hos oss njuter du av en god natts sömn, kökets genuina mathantverk och den enastående utsikten i Skybaren. Hotellet ligger i Hyllie, Malmös mest hållbara stadsdel och ett av Nordens mest dynamiska mötes- och evenemangsområden. Vill du vara en del av Malmö Arena Hotel och bidra till att leverera en förstklassig service till våra gäster? Har du service ut i fingerspetsarna och brinner för att överträffa gästens förväntningar? Då är du den vi söker!Är du en positiv och lösningsorienterad person som älskar att ge service i världsklass? Trivs du med högt tempo, ansvar och varierande arbetsdagar? Då kan det vara just dig vi letar efter! Vi söker nu en konferenskoordinator till konferensavdelningen på Malmö Arena Hotel. Tjänsten är ett föräldravikariat på ca 1 år med start i aug/sept. Vikariatet är på heltid.
  
  

Om rollen
  
Som konferenskoordinator är du en nyckelperson för att våra konferensgäster ska känna sig välkomna, trivas och vilja komma tillbaka. Du hanterar förfrågningar, bokningar och planerar konferenser tillsammans med både gäster och kollegor.
  
  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:**  

* Hantera offerter, bokningar och konferensplanering.
* Säkerställa att lokaler är rätt möblerade, att tekniken fungerar som den ska och att allt är i toppskick.
* Daglig kontakt med gäster – från ankomst till avresa
* Löpande konferensservice, hålla snygga och rent i alla våra konferensutrymmen
* Användning av bokningssystem som Opera Cloud, Proposales och Truebooking
* Genomföra visningar med gäster
* Samarbeta med andra avdelningar och bidra till en positiv arbetsmiljö


**Vi söker dig som:**  

* Har erfarenhet från hotell-, konferens- eller eventbranschen
* Är stresstålig, kommunikativ och lösningsorienterad
* Trivs med både service och fysisk aktivitet (ja, vi lyfter möbler och flyttar tunga väggar!)
* Är flexibel och kan jobba kvällar/helger vid behov
* Har hög arbetsmoral, är noggrann och lättlärd
* Gillar att jobba i team men är självgående


**Extra plus:**  

Du gillar att komma med idéer, har ett öga för detaljer och förstår vikten av att gästen står i centrum – alltid.
  
  

Vi erbjuder dig en rolig och varierande tjänst där du får utvecklas, ta ansvar och göra skillnad varje dag.
  
  

Låter det här som du?
  
Skicka in din ansökan redan idag och bli en del av vårt härliga gäng! Du ansökan via länken nedan. Skicka gärna in den snarast men absolut senast den 11 maj.

title: Senior Solutions Architect
description:
**This is a remote position and we're considering candidates in Sweden.**

We are looking for a Solutions Architect (ProServ) to join our world class Customer Experience (CX) team. Solutions Architects at Grafana Labs provide customers with specialized business and technical consultation, and guidance to achieve their objectives using Grafana.

### **What’s that actually mean? It means our customers:**


Have a professional services partner at Grafana that understands their challenges and guides them to solutions through training, roadmapping, and specialized consulting. Have a partner that is not quota/sales-based, and can authentically have their best interest at heart. Have a partner that can share relevant stories and best practices across customers, helping them better achieve their own goals, while delivering a white-glove service engagement for offerings, features, and overall experience.

Our SAs need to be hands-on-keyboard. You need to understand the ecosystem of services that our customers use and work with the customer to ensure success with Grafana at the center. We’d expect you to understand why Kubernetes is popular, how it relates to Prometheus, the difference between logs and metrics, the difference between pets and cattle, and more...

Our SAs manage the life-cycle of our customer’s onboarding and adoption of Grafana offerings and features, with a commitment to deliver world-class experiences and time to value. You will be responsible for delivering packaged training, quick-starts, session cataloging, project and roadmap assurance, as well as specialized consulting for high-priority customers with complex technical requirements and resource constraints. This will include being an extra set of hands, hearts, and brains for customers (virtually or on-site).

Our SA is responsible for managing the ongoing support to customers to ensure they’re continuing to get value from our commercial products and OSS projects. They will monitor support requests to identify any recurring issues, acting as the voice of the customer, and work with our product teams to recommend changes and improvements to our products. You will be successful in this role if you still love to be hands-on on the keyboard, can play in the command line, but also enjoy customer engagement, project management, and technical delivery.

In addition to the required technical expertise, they’ll also require base project management skills to monitor the progress of the customer initiative.

### **What you'll be doing:**


* Effective in working with customers, including business executives, project managers, and IT development staff.
* Effective in understanding business needs and distilling the information into business and technical requirements.
* Comfortable working with complex business and technological requirements and translating into the design of solutions, including data visualization, workflow recommendations, migrations, and enterprise scale architecture.
* Ability to act as a functional lead and able to demonstrate clear approach to methodology as well as functional capabilities. Leads functional workshops with customers, documents requirements, and designs appropriate solutions.
* Speed is paramount. This team is nimble and is the fulcrum to accelerate the delivery of the solution for customers.
* Be a strong advocate for adherence to standards and best practices.
* Stay current on Grafana Labs, observability, and related technologies.
* You'll be a key resource for our Sales, Product Management, Engineering, Support, and Professional Services teams as they look to drive innovation and improvements into future product and offering enhancements.
* If you enjoy working with customers to help them succeed and thrive on working with leading-edge technologies, this is the role for you.

### **What you'll bring along:**


* 5+ years of experience working on deployment teams, using project management techniques.
* Direct experience with o11y.
* Best practices for both using and deploying an o11y stack (visualization, alerting, metrics, logs, traces) - preferably with Grafana products (Grafana, Prometheus/Cortex/Enterprise Metrics, Loki/Enterprise Logs, Jaeger/Tempo).
* A proven track record of successful delivery of customer projects, preferably enterprise o11y implementations for large customers
* Self-starter, adept at picking up new skills and technologies, and eager to break new ground.
* Excellent communication skills to communicate with customers, partners, and internal members.
* Vision to help us take our company to the next level.
* Kubernetes (kubectl, Helm, Tanka preferred).
* Experience with Cloud Platforms - AWS, GCP, Azure


In Sweden, the base compensation range for this role is SEK 836,741- SEK 1,004,089. Actual compensation may vary based on level, experience, and skillset as assessed in the interview process. Benefits include equity, bonus (if applicable), and other benefits listed on our careers page.


* *Compensation ranges are country specific. If you are applying for this role from a different location than listed above, your recruiter will discuss your specific market’s defined pay range & benefits at the beginning of the process.*
  


**About Grafana Labs:** There are more than 20M users of Grafana, the open source visualization tool, around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps more than 3,000 companies - including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay - manage their observability strategies with the Grafana LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise Stack, both featuring scalable metrics (Grafana Mimir), logs (Grafana Loki), and traces (Grafana Tempo).

**Benefits:**

**Equal Opportunity Employer:** At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organization and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organization as we grow.

*For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our* *privacy policy**.*
company_description: Grafana Labs is the company behind Grafana, the leading open source software for visualizing time series data.

title: Data Infrastructure Engineer - Google Cloud Platform
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****7-9 months**
  
On behalf of our client we need a data consultant focused on GCP for 6-9 months of an assignment. Apart from the below technical skills we would like this person to also be part of onboarding a full time employee that will take over from them. Primary work from clients office in Stockholm but for sure 1-2 days remote per week if needed


We are seeking a specialist to migrate our data pipelines from a third-party orchestration tool (currently running on GCP) to native **Google Cloud Platform services.**


**The role includes:**  

* Designing the architecture and implementing it.
* Setting up infrastructure and representing it in Terraform(probably).
* Choosing, configuring, and operating an orchestrator.
* Establishing reliable testing and deployment (CI/CD) practices. Testing - meaning it’s easy to run pipeline in some sort of sandbox without influencing prod.
* Migrating the pipelines to the new environment and validating their performance

  
Alex Kouchmeshki
Country Manager


alex@emagine-consulting.se
+46 722005458

title: Nattreceptionist Scandic Continental
description:
\*\*Välkommen till Scandic Continental, hotellet med det absolut bästa läget mitt i Stockholms stadskärna!\*\* Vare sig du välkomnar gäster till ett av våra 392 hotellrum eller till vår takbar med spektakulär utsikt över Riddarfjärden så kommer du konstant möta besökare från hela världen. Till Scandic Continental kommer våra gäster bland annat för att lobbyjobba, njuta av en AW eller för att uppleva en oförglömlig sharingmiddag i vår restaurang The Market. Hos oss kommer du att arbeta med kollegor som vet vad det lilla extra för gästen innebär och tillsammans skapa de bästa gästupplevelserna. Så vill du ta chansen att bli en i teamet på Stockholms mest centrala affärshotell? Trivs du i en miljö med högt tempo och drivs av att hitta lösningar då är det dig vi letar efter!


**Nu söker vi en nattreceptionist till Scandic Continental för sommarvikariat!**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en visstidsanställning på deltid. Arbetstiden är primärt lagd på natt, men övriga skift och tider kan förekomma.



Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------


Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.
company_addresses:
Scandic Hotels Deutschland GmbH
Gabriele-Tergit-Promenade 19
10963 Berlin
company_description: Nordiskt hotellföretag i världsklass som skapar enastående upplevelser för de många människorna. 16 000 medarbetar, 280 hotell i 6 länder.

title: Microsoft Security Specialist (Purview & Defender Suite)
description:
Are you passionate about cybersecurity and data protection? Do you thrive in complex environments and enjoy turning security challenges into streamlined solutions? We're looking for a **Microsoft Security Specialist** to join our growing team someone with hands-on experience in **Microsoft Purview** and the **Microsoft Defender suite**.

 **What You’ll Do:**

* Design, implement, and manage security solutions using **Microsoft Purview** for compliance, data loss prevention, and governance.
* Deploy and optimize **Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Identity, Cloud, and Office 365** to protect users and infrastructure.
* Collaborate with IT, compliance, and risk teams to align security configurations with business goals and regulatory requirements.
* Continuously monitor the security landscape.
* Provide guidance, best practices, and training on Microsoft security technologies across the organization.

 **What We’re Looking For:**

* Deep knowledge of the **Microsoft Defender suite**, including Defender for Endpoint, Cloud, Identity, and Microsoft 365.
* Experience with **Microsoft Purview**: Information Protection, Insider Risk Management, DLP, Compliance Manager.
* Solid grasp of Microsoft Defender suite, of Microsoft Defender for Cloud , and Sentinel (bonus).
* Microsoft certifications (e.g., **SC-200**, **SC-400**, **SC-900,** **MS-500, AZ-500**) are a strong plus.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to communicate security concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Requirement to be fluent in both English and Swedish due to communication with customers.

 **Why Join Us?**

* Work with a dynamic, forward-thinking team that values innovation and expertise.
* Access to continuous learning, Microsoft partnerships, and certification support.
* Impactful role in shaping security posture for clients and projects across industries.
* A Challenger culture that encourages you to be self-driven, curious and enables a culture where we work with knowledge sharing.

 **Orange Cyberdefense**


Orange Cyberdefense is Sweden’s leading company within cybersecurity. Our vision is to contribute to a safer digital society by preventing and combating various types of cybercrime. We offer our customers services in “Anticipate”, “Identity”, “Protect”, “Detect”, and “Respond”. We are 3000 colleagues globally, with 400 colleagues in Sweden.


At Orange Cyberdefense, we are all different but share a passion for cybersecurity; and that is our greatest strength. We take pride in our differences, experiences and backgrounds. We believe we must include everyone being able to provide solutions that suit everyone. That is why we ensure that we handle all applications equally.  



  

**Orange Cyberdefense**


If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact responsible recruiter: Fanny Westergren (Fanny.westergren@orangecyberdefense.com).
company_description: Orange is one of the world’s leading telecommunications operators : sales of 42,3 billion euros in 2020 and 142,000 employees in 26 countries.

description:
Are you passionate about cybersecurity and data protection? Do you thrive in complex environments and enjoy turning security challenges into streamlined solutions? We're looking for a **Microsoft Security Specialist** to join our growing team someone with hands-on experience in **Microsoft Purview** and the **Microsoft Defender suite**.

 **What You’ll Do:**

* Design, implement, and manage security solutions using **Microsoft Purview** for compliance, data loss prevention, and governance.
* Deploy and optimize **Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Identity, Cloud, and Office 365** to protect users and infrastructure.
* Collaborate with IT, compliance, and risk teams to align security configurations with business goals and regulatory requirements.
* Continuously monitor the security landscape.
* Provide guidance, best practices, and training on Microsoft security technologies across the organization.

 **What We’re Looking For:**

* Deep knowledge of the **Microsoft Defender suite**, including Defender for Endpoint, Cloud, Identity, and Microsoft 365.
* Experience with **Microsoft Purview**: Information Protection, Insider Risk Management, DLP, Compliance Manager.
* Solid grasp of Microsoft Defender suite, of Microsoft Defender for Cloud , and Sentinel (bonus).
* Microsoft certifications (e.g., **SC-200**, **SC-400**, **SC-900,****MS-500, AZ-500**) are a strong plus.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to communicate security concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Requirement to be fluent in both English and Swedish due to communication with customers.

 **Why Join Us?**

* Work with a dynamic, forward-thinking team that values innovation and expertise.
* Access to continuous learning, Microsoft partnerships, and certification support.
* Impactful role in shaping security posture for clients and projects across industries.
* A Challenger culture that encourages you to be self-driven, curious and enables a culture where we work with knowledge sharing.
