title: Lead FEA Engineer - Automotive Business
description:
Requisition ID: 22029
Job Category: Engineering & Technology
Career level: Specialist
Contract type: Permanent
Location:
Gothenburg, SE  

  

  

SKF has been around for more than a century and today we are one of the world’s largest global suppliers of bearings and supporting solutions for rotating equipment. Our products can be found literally everywhere in society. This means that we are an important part of the everyday lives of people and companies around the world.  

  

In September of 2024, SKF announced the separation of its Automotive business, with the objective to build two world-leading businesses. The role you are applying for will be part of the automotive business. This means you will have the opportunity to be a part of shaping a new company aimed at meeting the needs of the transforming global automotive market. Would you like to join us in shaping the future of motion?  

  

We are now looking for a  

  



**Lead FEA Engineer**  

**Automotive Business**

  


Join us as a Lead FEA Engineer and shape the future of FE simulation tools. You'll define best practices, write and validate work instructions, and support automation efforts. As an advanced FE user, you'll mentor others and lead structural simulations for product engineering and R&D teams.

  

  

**Key responsibilities**


* Develop and co-own the FE simulation tool roadmap.
* Define and optimize ANSYS usage within the simulation community.
* Perform advanced structural simulations, including fatigue, thermal, dynamic, and harmonic analysis.
* Preprocess complex housing/component geometry and create .cdb files.
* Establish and cascade best practices for FEA models.
* Support daily users with template-based models and macros.
* Lead continuous improvement and development activities.
* Mitigate technical risks via virtual tools and create test plans.
* Maintain APDL and Python repository for automation and data processing.
* Serve as the technical interface to software vendors and internal teams, while mentoring advanced users.
* Serve as the technical lead for software functionality and maintenance.

  




**Requirements**


* Expert-level experience in FE software (e.g. ANSYS and/or Abaqus)
* Proficiency in Creo and/or SpaceClaim for geometry creation and modification.
* Experience with APDL, Fortran, and Python.
* Master's degree in engineering.
* Ability to work between physical test data and simulation.
* Fluent in English.

  

  

**Why you’ll love this role**


* **Impactful Work:** Shape the FE simulation tool roadmap and define best practices that will drive our engineering excellence.
* **Mentorship:** Share your expertise as an advanced FE user and mentor a global community of engineers.
* **Cutting-Edge Projects:** Dive into advanced structural simulations, including fatigue, thermal, dynamic, and harmonic analysis.
* **Innovation:** Lead the charge in automating processes and optimizing ANSYS usage to boost efficiency.
* **Global Collaboration:** Work with internal and customer experts from around the world, leading across cultures and making a global impact.

  

  

***Join us to drive innovation in FE simulation tools, mentor global teams, and lead cutting-edge structural simulations!***

  


*SKF is committed to creating a diverse environment, and we firmly believe that a diverse workforce is essential for our continued success. Therefore, we only focus on your experience, skills, and potential. Come as you are – just be yourself. #weareSKF*  

  

**Some additional information**


Location: Gothenburg, Sweden  



For questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Anna Barkin Johansson, Recruitment Expert EMEA, via Anna.Barkin.Johansson@skf.com (please note that we can’t accept applications via e-mail)

  

  

**Is this you?**  

If the answer is yes, please submit your application with your CV in English no later than May 11th, 2025.  

  

*At SKF, we are committed to promoting fairness and inclusivity throughout our recruitment process. To achieve this, we may include assessments and verify the information in your application in compliance with country-specific laws and regulations. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to contact the recruiter.*

Gothenburg, SE  

  

  

SKF has been around for more than a century and today we are one of the world’s largest global suppliers of bearings and supporting solutions for rotating equipment. **Automotive Business**

title: Mechanical Engineer to support Gas Turbine operations
description:
We are seeking a dedicated and knowledgeable Mechanical Engineer to support our Gas Turbine operations. The ideal candidate will possess a strong understanding of power plant packages and relevant industry standards, along with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Provide comprehensive support to customers regarding Gas Turbine operations, ensuring adherence to power plant package standards.
  
Create and revise mechanical documentation utilizing AutoCAD and COMOS software.
  
Coordinate Engineering Change Orders (ECO) in alignment with manufacturing customer standards and procedures, leveraging SAP tools.
  
Offer technical support in response to site queries, ensuring timely and accurate resolutions.
  
Develop and maintain a comprehensive list of mechanical spare parts.
  
Demonstrate knowledge of Gas Turbine auxiliary systems to enhance operational efficiency.
  
  

**Required Skills and Qualifications:**  

Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering (B.E. / B. Tech).
  
2-4 years of relevant experience in the field.
  
Proficient in P&ID, piping layout, and piping components.
  
Ability to work independently and efficiently, demonstrating strong problem-solving skills.
  
Familiarity with COMOS/PLM systems is advantageous.
  
  

**Desired Skills:**  

Strong teamwork and collaboration abilities.
  
Professionalism and a robust work ethic.
  
Commitment to continuous education and professional development.
  
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to engage effectively with all levels of the engineering organization.
  
  

Öppen för alla
  
Vi fokuserar på din kompetens, inte dina övriga förutsättningar. Vi är öppna för att anpassa rollen eller arbetsplatsen efter dina behov.

title: Test and Verification Engineer
description:
MilDef är en global ledare inom robusta IT-system och våra produkter är designade för att prestera optimalt under de tuffaste förhållandena. Vi samarbetar nära med försvar och myndigheter för att leverera hård- och mjukvarulösningar anpassade efter deras unika behov. Nu söker vi en Test and Verification Engineer till vårt team i Helsingborg.

**Din nya utmaning**


Som Test and Verification Engineer får du möjlighet att ta dig an en varierad och betydelsefull roll, där du arbetar i olika projekt och är involverad i flera steg av processen med att utveckla robust IT-utrustning. Rollen består till största del av att testa, verifiera och montera nyutvecklade produkter.

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**

*

title: Field Service Engineer Nordic (m/f/d)
description:
Overview:

Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker develops high-performance scientific instruments and high-value analytical and diagnostic solutions that enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular, and microscopic levels. We have been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years and today, Bruker continues to build upon its extensive range of products and solutions, its broad base of installed systems, and a strong reputation among its customers. Worldwide, more than 9700 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 100 locations on all continents.

  

The function of the **Field Service Engineer (m/f/d)** is to provide expert hands-on technical expertise in all aspects of installation, commissioning, basic customer training, maintenance, fault-finding and customer support in respect of the company’s products.  

The primary objective is to be an efficient and effective member of the Customer Service team in delivering highly competent, effective and focused solution support to the customer base to achieve maximum customer satisfaction and to further the professional image of the Company. You will be working as a member of the Service Team involved in the installation, maintenance, service and solution support of our range of instrumentation.  

The position is home office based, preferably close to Stockholm/Sweden. Good travel connections, as well for international travel will be important.
Responsibilities:
* Familiarization with specific instrumentation prior to installation from issued documentation and/or participation in the final testing process in the factory
* Liaise with customers and colleagues in the site planning process prior to installation
* Inspect, install, set up, test and achieve specifications of systems and accessories at customers’ sites, and deliver basic operator training
* Carry out breakdown and planned maintenance at customers’ sites
* Provide technical, software and application related support and assistance to customers and to colleagues, either directly or by remote diagnosis
* Carry out procedures necessary to validate systems to certifiable standards
* Provide technical input to the sales team in non-routine sales cases
* Frequent travel within the Nordic Countries is an essential part of the job. Travel to customer sites abroad can occur, especially within Europe.
* Activities will cover all products manufactured or represented by the Company.


Qualifications:
* Qualification in electrical or electronic engineering, chemistry or biochemistry. Similar level of knowledge and /or skill gained by practical experience in the Mass Spectrometry field is a clear plus.
* solid technical or scientific background gained in industry or academia
* proven experience in field service work
* a current driving license
* no visa restriction preventing travel in the USA or EMEA
* good at building relationships through inspiring trust and confidence
* self-motivation and a willingness to work with others toward a shared goal
* the ability to contribute to a team effort, yet to accept responsibility for an individual role within the team
* excel at continuous learning in a rapidly advancing technological area
* capacity to take responsibility for the complete installation and commissioning of sophisticated instrumentation and to instruct users in its basic operation
* ability to diagnose causes of malfunction and to actively resolve customers’ service problems
* good computer literacy, including familiarity with data system hardware and industry standard operating systems
* Ability to communicate effectively at all levels with good spoken and written English, Swedish and Finnish
company_description: Bruker Corporation is a manufacturer of scientific instruments for molecular and materials research, as well as for industrial and applied analysis.

title: Staff Battery Cell Engineer, Cell NPI
description:
At Heart Aerospace we develop the ES-30, a regional hybrid-electric airplane with a capacity of 30 passengers, an electric zero-emission range of 200 km and an extended hybrid range of 400 km. Heart is targeting type certification of the ES-30 by the end of the decade.



Our headquarters is based in Gothenburg, Sweden and we are now opening up a R&D hub in Los Angeles, which will focus on the advancement of Heart’s hybrid-electric propulsion system and other key technologies.


**Your mission**



Heart Aerospace is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Staff Battery Cell Engineer, Cell NPI to join our growing and dynamic team. In this role, you will be a key contributor to the development, testing, and optimization of advanced battery cells specifically designed for the demanding requirements of electric aerospace applications. You will leverage your deep understanding of electrochemistry, materials science, and battery cell design to drive innovation and ensure the highest levels of performance, safety and reliability.

  

**Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:**


* Design and develop advanced battery cell specifications for electric and hybrid aerospace applications. Drive cell selection decisions based on the test results and vendor engagement.
* Lead battery cell integration into Heart Aerospace battery system (Cell to module to pack). Evaluate and select optimal cell chemistries, materials and cell form factor to meet performance and safety requirements.
* Conduct rigorous battery cell testing under environmental and operational conditions applicable to electric airplanes.
* Perform electrochemical characterization of battery cells and materials using techniques like cyclic voltammetry and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy.
* Implement and maintain stringent safety protocols for handling and testing high-energy battery cells.
* Conduct detailed failure analysis, root cause investigations and tear downs of battery cells.
* Analyze test data to identify performance limitations and implement improvements with suppliers to enhance energy density, power output, and cycle life.
* Ensure battery cell designs and testing procedures comply with relevant aerospace industry standards and regulatory requirements (e.g., DO-311, UN 38.3).
* Collaborate with battery pack engineers, systems engineers, software/BMS engineers and certification engineers to integrate battery cells into the high voltage system.

You will initially report to the Director of Battery and belong to the Battery team. Your place of work will be at our office located in El Segundo, CA (Los Angeles).


**Skills & Requirements**
-------------------------


**You'll Bring These Qualifications:**


* 8+ years of experience in battery cell design, development, and testing.
* Strong understanding of lithium-ion battery chemistry and electrochemistry.
* Product development experience for high voltage battery applications.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Experience with battery cell testing equipment, data analysis tools and electrochemical characterization techniques.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Verbal & written communication skills in English.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.


**These Qualifications Would Be Nice To Have:**

* Familiarity with aerospace industry standards and regulatory requirements is a plus.
* Experience with advanced battery technologies, modeling and simulation.

**Education**


* M.S. or Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering, Materials Science, Electrochemistry, or a related field.
Heart Aerospace has a clear mission. We work to decarbonize and democratize air travel. We believe in electrification. Not only to bring down emissions and build a sustainable future, but to make flying accessible for the many, around the world.



Electric planes are cheaper to operate and can unlock convenient and effective regional traveling, a market that today is restricted by the difficulty of making a sustainable profit. Our mission is about taking electrification to the skies, helping our customers build their businesses, and the traveling public to access an amazing and sustainable service.



Working at Heart Aerospace is not just a career; it is a chance to directly make the world more accessible and sustainable. Come help us write a new chapter in the history of aviation together!



We seek experienced and skilled professionals to join our fast-moving team developing a new electric aircraft. We’re in a very expansive phase and now is the time to join our team! Visit our **career site** and check out what it is like working at Heart.


*Heart Aerospace is committed to equal employment opportunity and providing reasonable accommodations to qualified candidates and employees pursuant to applicable law. We value and encourage diversity and solicit applications from all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, gender identity or expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*



Heart Aerospace participates in E-Verify.

title: Project Technical Engineer
description:
**Location:**

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0060304

2024-09-06
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Engineering & Science

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The opportunity**

In this role as a Project Technical Engineer at Hitachi Energy Service you will be a part of a HVDC Control & Protection Software team that is working globally. Our team is responsible for the entire delivery of control & protection in refurbishment projects, and we have interfaces towards other domains as IT/OT, Hardware and Operations. The need for knowledge in this area is increasing and we are therefore seeking for experienced or senior engineers to join our team


*“When a team works as a unit, everyone has an opportunity to learn from each other. This process leads to resource building and enables the team to become better equipped to deal with new challenges. Because of this, we at Hitachi Energy Service strive to place everyone in the same project team in groups that sit together, thereby we are simplifying information pathways and experience of transfer.” – Hiring manager Fredrik Antonsson*

**How you’ll make an impact**

* To be part of all phases of the delivery of an HVDC refurbishment project, which includes tender, design, testing, integration, verification, and deployment of the software functions needed for safe and reliable operations of plants and transmission links.
* There is also possibility to travel internationally for short assignments to our sites for commissioning and customer meetings.
* To work with close with customers and to train them.
* To have a big sense of responsibility and ownership, being capable of planning and organizing your daily work.
* Have the desire to push your own development/curiosity, we have the tools and mentors.
* To be a problem solver who takes initiatives to solve challenges together with colleagues.

**Your background**

* You hold a degree within a relevant field, such as Electrical Engineering, Power Systems, High Voltage, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering.
* You have work proficiency in English, both written and spoken. Additional languages, such as Swedish are an advantage.
* You have an interest or experience within software development and programming.
* You have an interest or experience in digital control technology, signal processing and filtering.
* You have an interest or experience from HVDC and/or electric power industry ex. AC substation maintenance.

title: Fullstackutvecklare C#/React
description:
****Vill du arbeta i ett fantastiskt team som jobbar nära verksamheten för att bygga plattformen som möjliggör att våra kunder får den bästa digitala upplevelsen när de ska boka och åka på resor!****
**Om tjänsten**
 Vi söker en fullstackutvecklare till vårt Fundamentals team. Teamet ansvar för plattformen som ligger till grund för våra kundkanaler (webbar och appar). Vi har ambitionen att ligga i framkant och jobba med modern teknik.
   

  

 Teamen ansvarar för hela kedjan från kravförståelse, utveckling, deploy till förvaltning och support. Vi jobbar agilt med continuous delivery. Det viktigaste för oss är inte bara vilka tekniker du kan idag utan din inställning, nyfikenhet och viljan att lära nytt och bidra till vår vidareutveckling och kultur. I teamet arbetar vi idag med en del par-/mobbprogrammering och nära verksamheten med snabba feedbackloppar för ständig förbättring.
   

  

 Vi är 13 utvecklingsteam på vår IT-avdelning och vi utvecklar våra system i Microsoft miljö med moderna tekniker, ramverk och verktyg såsom .NET Core, C#, Node, Azure, React, JavaScript, Typescript, MS-SQL, Redis, Visual Studio, etc. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper då vi ser att en bra teamdynamik är en förutsättning för våra leveranser.
   

  

****Vem vi söker****
 Till Ving söker vi nu en engagerad och leveransfokuserad fullstackutvecklare.
   

  

**Vi önskar att du uppfyller följande punkter:**
* 7+ års erfarenhet av systemutveckling inom C#.Net, Node.
* Erfarenhet av React
* Relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning.
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift.


**Det är meriterande om du även har erfarenhet av:**
* CMS (Umbraco)
* Headless
* Molnbaserade tjänster (gärna Azure)
* DevOps
* Par-/Mobbprogrammering


 Vi söker dig som är en teamspelare som värdesätter samarbete och aktivt bidrar till teamets framgång. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper då vi ser att en bra teamdynamik är en förutsättning för våra leveranser.
   

  

****Vi erbjuder****
 Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö där du får möjlighet till en intern karriär. Du får en omväxlande vardag tillsammans med härliga kollegor - vi arbetar i nära samarbete mellan de nordiska länderna för att ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året. Vi har bra reseförmåner och dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa i Nordic Leisure Travel Group!
   

  

****Övrigt****
 Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst och placerad på Vings fina huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Det är möjligt med distansarbete upp till 2 dagar per vecka när det passar med teamet/arbetet. Arbetsspråk är svenska. Intervjuer kommer ske löpande så skicka din ansökan idag!
   

  

 Har du frågor kring tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Susanne Almqvist på susanne.almqvist@nltg.com eller på telefon 070-951 34 32.
   

  

**I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av tester från Alva Labs – ett logiskt problemlösningstest och ett personlighetstest. Testerna utgår från vedertagen forskning och ger oss möjlighet att på ett opartiskt sätt bedöma dina styrkor och eventuella utmaningar i relation till aktuell tjänst. Under rekryteringsprocessen kommer du att få testerna skickade till dig med mer information, är du nyfiken redan nu kan du läsa mer om dem hos** 
**Alva Labs** 
**.**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**🏄‍♂️ Kul på jobbet**
**🤝 Tjänstepension**
**🌎 Reseförmåner**
**🦉 Utveckling och lärande**
**💗 Well-being**
**💼 Hybrid arbetsplats**
 Läs mer om vad vi erbjuder här
   

  

 Ving ingår i den nordiska resekoncernenNordic Leisure Travel Group.
   

  

 I gruppen ingår researrangörerna Ving Sverige, Ving Norge, Globetrotter, Spies i Danmark, Tjäreborg i Finland, flygbolaget Sunclass Airlines samt våra egna hotellkoncept Sunwing Family Resorts, Ocean Beach Club och Sunprime Hotels. Gruppen säljer ett normalt år runt 1 500 000 resor i de nordiska länderna.
   

  

 Arbetsområde
   

  

 IT
   

  

 Roll: Development
   

  

 Platser: Stockholm
   

  

 Distansarbete: Hybridarbete
   

  

 Anställningsform: Heltid
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag: 3 mars 2025

title: QA Engineer
description:
**Looking for a workplace for the future?**
 At Telenor, you own your career. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to make the most of your dreams and expertise while contributing to technological innovations that are barely even imagined today. Innovations that we know will change the map for how we communicate and live our connected lives in the future. Are you looking for a workplace where you can make a difference in what matters most – relationships between people.
   

  

**We are transforming**
 At Telenor we are accelerating our digital transformation. In the Consumer IT Tribe, we are building a modern and fast-paced software development organization with a mission to enable and accelerate Telenor Sweden's Consumer business. We have the accountability to provide fast-paced software development from business support systems up to the channel layer.
   

  

**What you will do**
 We are looking to strengthen our team with a QA Engineer that will be responsible for Quality Assurance of telenor.se purchase flows. This application is used by our end customers to buy hardware’s, subscriptions, sims and transfer their subscription etc. The main responsibility of the team is to build the frontend and a backend of orchestration services and API’s to be consumed by the client. You are a highly specialized QA Engineer, with a focus on web, motivated by technical challenges and delivering top quality. As a QA Engineer you are used to work in close cooperation with development team, coaching them, being an ambassador of good quality and driving all test actitivies within the team, following Agile methodology and continuos release process.
   

  

 That's including but not limited to creating test plans, as well as performing for example manual exploratory, system or accessibility test. At the same time, you will also work on designing, developing, and maintaining automated test frameworks and define our goals within automation and test in general. Close communication and collaboration are a crucial part working with multiple teams connecting to the system around this team's specific application that orchestrates workflows between different applications and microservices.
   

  

**Who you are**
 We believe that you are a person with a big passion for testing and quality and see the value that QA brings. You are structured and highly committed in what you do and understand the importance of continuous improvement and challenging status quo. You are a driven, self-motivated and take responsibility for your tasks with willingness to jump in where is needed for the team and ultimately the company to succeed.
   

  

 Must have skills:
   

  

* Proven experience as a Manual QA Engineer or similar role.
* Strong understanding of software development lifecycle and QA methodologies.
* Proficiency in writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans, test cases and bug reports
* Knowledge about Browser stack or similar for cross browser testing to test across different device combinations.
* Experience with Defect tracking tool (Jira or similar).
* Understanding of CI/CD (preferably Jenkins).
* Knowledge about A11Y audit and accessibility testing.
* Experienced in writing Nunit test using C#, Selenium.
* Extensive experience in Automation Framework Designing.
* Hands on experience on Selenium for automating frontend tests, parallelization and mocks.
* Experience of working with HTTP/Restful APIs, Postman/Curl (or similar API testing tools).
* Working knowledge of GIT.


 Preferred:
   

  

* Maven.
* AWS (for tracking events/logs using Cloudwatch).
* Elastic Stack (Kibana, APM or similar log aggregation/tracing tools).
* Grafana / Prometheus (or similar monitoring tools).
* Swagger.
* Jenkins.
* Performance Testing Tools (eg. Jmeter etc).
* Experience of working with Content Management System (Contentful or similar).


**Our promise to you**
*We are better together.*
 Here, you’ll be part of a family-like and inclusive culture, built on strong shared values and leadership that empowers you with both trust and confidence. We believe in enabling each other to act and make decisions, while always having each other’s backs through ups and downs.
   

  

*We support relationships and societies.*
 Telenor plays a vital role in the society, giving your work a greater purpose. Every day, we create value for millions of people and maintain a customer-first approach where human relationships are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

*We make room for life.*
 Work from home up to two days a week, where your role allows it. The rest of the time, we create magic together at the office. You also get two ‘give-me-a-break’ days per year for extra time off, and our flexible working hours help you balance your time. We also support you through every stage of life with our benefits package.
   

  

*We invite you to a career in motion.*
 Your development is at the center of our culture. We dedicate at least 40 hours per year for you to deepen your expertise, explore new areas, and develop in your role. Through Telenor Academy and other learning initiatives, you’ll have the tools and freedom to advance your career. When you want to broaden your horizons, we are present throughout the Nordics.
   

  

**Apply today!**
 Will you take the next step in your career with us? We look forward to your application! We review applicants on an ongoing basis, so don’t wait—reach out today.
   

  

 If you have any questions or want to know more, feel free to contact Cajsa Lundström, cajsa.lundstrom@telenor.se. Please note that we cannot accept applications via email.
   

  

**Good to know**
 As part of Telenor’s policy, we conduct background checks on final candidates for all recruitments.

title: Senior Firmware Developer
description:
**Be visionary**
 Teledyne Technologies Incorporated provides enabling technologies for industrial growth markets that require advanced technology and high reliability. These markets include aerospace and defense, factory automation, air and water quality environmental monitoring, electronics design and development, oceanographic research, deepwater oil and gas exploration and production, medical imaging and pharmaceutical research.
   

  

 We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Are you a** 
 senior firmware developer and algorithm specialist with at least 10 years’ experience
 **? Then join our innovative team at Teledyne FLIR defense!**
 Teledyne FLIR is a global leader in defense technologies and integrated sensing solutions with 15,000 employees globally whereas 1700 employees in our defense unit. Since 1978, we have been at the forefront of innovation continued to push boundaries. Our diversified portfolio serves a variety of applications in government and defense, helping military personnel operate efficiently and effectively in various environments.
   

  

 We are now looking for passionate and talented full-time consultant to join our team in Arninge/Täby to help us continue to lead the way in defense technology. If you're excited about making a difference in the world and working with cutting-edge technologies, this is the place for you!
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A Friendly and Inclusive Culture: Join a team that values collaboration, problem-solving, and creativity.
* Global Team: Work alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
* Great Team and Culture: Collaborate with other talented engineers in a supportive environment.
* Financially Stable and Growing Company: Be part of a company that is financially secure and expanding.
* Healthcare Benefits: Access to healthcare benefits, free gym, and various sports activities.


**Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain in FPGA embedded systems.
* Work with legacy code, including refactoring and managing large codebases.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and test software solutions.
* Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to peers.
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and tools.


**Qualifications**
* Must Have:
* Knowledge of FPGA development.
* Knowledge of VHDL/SystemVerilog/Mathlab/Python.
* AMD/Xilinx development tool Vivado.
* AMD/Xilinx FPGA family’s series 7 and Ultrascale+
* Development filter algorithms for image processing using FPGA.
* Experience with embedded systems.
* Experience with legacy code, including refactoring and managing large codebases.
* Experience with Shell/Bash scripting.
* Great if you have:
* Familiarity with Quest simulation tool including code coverage.
* Familiarity with Simulink/Vitis Model Composer
* Familiarity with Linux/Debian environments.
* Experience with Jenkins and Make.
* Understanding of Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban).


**Personal Traits for Success**
* Innovative mindset and creative drive
* To some extent organized
* Responsible
* Intellectually Curious
* Proactive
* Flexible mindset (things change rapidly in our daily work so this is a key trait)


**Security Clearance**
* Defense Industry Standards: Due to the high-security demands of the defense industry, you will need to undergo a background check.
* You need to be able to work in Sweden, and we perform security background checks on all our employees.
* This position requires access to export-controlled information or items (i.e., regulated technology or technical data per ITAR/EAR US regulations). Applicants must be eligible to apply for and obtain the appropriate export control license from the U.S. Departments of State or Commerce.
* We prefer applicants who are okay with working on-site from the office in Arninge/Täby.


 Join us and contribute to the next generation of defense technology!
   

  

 Teledyne and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.

title: Android Engineer
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?**
 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
   

  

* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world's #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 420 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv with high ambitions.


**We at New Initiatives team,** 
 work and operate like a high-functioning startup within Truecaller, taking new ideas from zero to one. The product ideas need not necessarily coincide with the Truecaller app and may be a completely new app / product that we build from scratch. The team has built apps like Guardians (Personal safety app), Open Doors (Audio social network), ZipZip (AI customer support agent) and Scamfeed (Anti-Scam community inside Truecaller app) & more.
   

  

**As an Android Engineer,** 
 you will be responsible for enabling and performing highly efficient application development for the Android platform. You will be deeply involved in the whole cycle of product development, from idea generation to delivery.
   

  

**The impact you will create:**
* Strong knowledge of the Android SDK
* Familiarity with RESTful APIs
* Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
* Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
* Fluent in English, in speaking and writing
* Experience in working with Agile methodologies
* Ability to make the right compromises to maximize early value delivery without compromising on quality


**What you bring in:**
* Write simple, understandable, testable, and efficient code with a focus on solid technical stability and great user experience.
* **(Builder Mentality )** 
 Take initiative, enjoy creating well-structured solutions, and have a hands-on approach to problem-solving.
* **(Curious and Open to Learning )** 
 Eager to experiment, quick to adapt, and committed to growing your skills and staying current with mobile development trends.
* Participate in and contribute to the team's Agile practices.
* Take responsibility in maintaining high engineering standards, commitment to the product and respect and attitude towards others.


**It would be great if you also have experience in:**
* JavaScript frameworks
* Multi-platform frameworks (Flutter, React Native)
* Backend or Backend-as-a-Service (BaaS) platforms (Firebase, Supabase)
* Side projects in various tech stacks
* And of course acts according to our values; Get shit done, Be helpful, Be fearless and Never give up


**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**
**Sounds like your dream job?**
 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
   

  

**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.**
 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
   

  

**What we offer:**
* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package** 
 : Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There's something for everyone!


**Come as you are:**
 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc.
 **All those things make you who you are, and that's why we would love to meet you**

title: Forskningsingenjör  inom mikroarkitekturell säkerhet
description:
**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Vi söker en forskningsingenjör för att arbeta upp till sex månader inom ett projekt om formell verifiering och mikroarkitekturell säkerhet vid Avdelningen för nätverk och systemteknik, KTH.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en del av ett projekt finansierat av Wallenberg Launchpad (WALP) och innebär utveckling av formella analysramverk för att utvärdera programsäkerhet mot mikroarkitekturella attacker. Arbetsuppgifterna innefattar att stödja forskningsaktiviteter såsom implementering av programanalyssystem och att bidra till designen av en säkerhetsanalysplattform. Erfarenhet av kompilatordesign och starka programmeringskunskaper är mycket meriterande.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
* En anställning på ett ledande tekniskt universitet som skapar kunskap och kompetens för en hållbar framtid
* Engagerade och ambitiösa kollegor samt en kreativ, internationell och dynamisk miljö
* Arbete i Stockholm med närhet till naturen (frivillig att ta med i svenska annonsen)
* Frivilligt att skriva ytterligare punkter kring vad KTH eller den specifika anställningen erbjuder eller gör oss unika


 Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta på KTH samt våra förmåner
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Krav**
* Avlagd examen på grundnivå eller avancerad nivå (högskoleutbildning) inom ämnet för anställningen eller motsvarande kompetens.
* Starka färdigheter i programmering och mjukvaruutveckling (med språk som C++ och Python), med fokus på att bygga skalbara verktyg som går bortom akademiska prototyper.
* Flytande engelska, då det krävs i det dagliga arbetet.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av programverifiering.
* Bekantskap med SMT-lösare och design av kompilatorpass.
* Medvetenhet om mångfalds- och likabehandlingsfrågor med särskilt fokus på jämställdhet.
* Som person har du lätt för att arbeta självständigt men trivs också med att samarbeta i grupp.


 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Fackliga representanter**
 Kontaktuppgifter till fackliga representanter.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Du ansöker via KTH:s rekryteringssystem. Du som sökande har huvudansvaret för att din ansökan är komplett när den skickas in.
   

  

 Ansökan ska innehålla:
   

  

* CV inklusive relevant yrkeserfarenhet och kunskap.
* Kopia av examensbevis och betyg från dina tidigare universitetsstudier. Översättningar till engelska eller svenska om de ursprungliga dokumenten inte utfärdas på något av dessa språk.
* Personligt brev, max 2 sidor långt


 Ansökan ska vara KTH tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdagen vid midnatt, CET/CEST (CentralEuropean Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

**Om anställningen**
 Anställningen gäller tidsbegränsat enligt avtal - i upp till 6 mån, med tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Strävan efter jämställdhet, mångfald och lika villkor är både en kvalitetsfråga och en självklar del av KTH:s värdegrund.
   

  

 För information om behandling av personuppgifter i samband med rekrytering.
   

  

 Det kan förekomma att en anställning hos KTH är placerad i säkerhetsklass. Om så är fallet för just denna anställning görs en säkerhetsprövning av sökande i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) efter samtycke. I dessa fall är en förutsättning för anställning att sökande blir godkänd efter säkerhetsprövning.
   

  

 Om KTH KTH är ett av Europas ledande tekniska universitet och en viktig arena för kunskapsutveckling. Som Sveriges största universitet för teknisk forskning och utbildning samlar vi studenter, forskare och fakultet från hela världen. Vår forskning och utbildning omfattar såväl naturvetenskap som alla grenar inom teknik samt arkitektur, industriell ekonomi, samhällsplanering, historia och filosofi. Läs mer här
   

  

 Anställningsform: tidsbegränsad anställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: PA-2025-1338 | Kontakt: Hamed Nemati, hnnemati@kth.se 000000000, Roberto Guanciale, robertog@kth.se 087906937, | Publicerat: 2025-04-29 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-25

title: CMC Designer (Cell Module Controller)
description:
At Traton, we are leading the shift toward a sustainable transport system. Electrification is at the heart of this transformation. To further strengthen our battery development team, we are now looking for a committed
 **CMC (Cell Module Controller) Designer** 
 to join us.
   

  

**Your Role:**
 As a CMC Designer, you will be responsible for the development and lifecycle management of our high-voltage battery cell module controllers. You will collaborate closely with suppliers, internal BMS teams, and other cross-functional partners to deliver best-in-class battery solutions.
   

  

 Key responsibilities include:
   

  

  

* Developing and specifying HV battery CMC components
* Documentation and contribution to change management processes
* Supplier interaction and execution of functional tests
* Collaboration with BMS development areas to ensure seamless system integration
* Troubleshooting and maintenance support for serial production and quality-related issues
* Analysis and optimization activities focused on cost reduction and efficiency improvements
* Ensuring compliance with safety and security quality standards (e.g., ISO 26262, IEC 61508)
* Supporting the international team with electronics expertise


 The role requires a solid understanding of energy systems, battery systems, power electronics, model-based design (MBD), and battery management software algorithms. A strong willingness to learn and the ability to work across diverse, cross-functional teams is essential.
   

  

**Your Profile:**
 We are looking for a driven and collaborative engineer with a passion for electrification and system development.
   

  

**You have:**
* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Systems Engineering, Materials Engineering, or a related discipline
* Several years of experience in electronic or mechatronic component development
* Basic knowledge and experience with software applications and embedded systems
* Excellent teamwork skills and experience working in collaborative, interdisciplinary projects
* The ability to communicate and coordinate effectively within international teams
* Strong communication skills in English (both written and spoken)
* Willingness to travel occasionally both domestically and internationally


**What We Offer:**
* A dynamic work environment at the forefront of transport electrification
* Opportunities for continuous learning and career development
* Working within an international and innovative team
* The chance to actively contribute to a sustainable and electrified future


**Drive the shift with us.**
 Apply today and become a key player in shaping tomorrow's electrified transport solutions.
   

  

**Application**
 Please submit your CV and relevant certificates. Screening and interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis. A background check may be part of the selection process.
   

  

**For more information, please contact:**
* Kristijan Begic, Unit Head of Stack Mechanical, martin.umbreit@man.eu


 We look forward to your application!

title: Refrigeration Technician
company_industry: HVAC and Refrigeration Equipment Manufacturing, Electric Power Transmission, Control, and Distribution, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Who are we?** 




  





  





 At Vertiv, we build products that keep critical technologies running 24/7. We are proud we were the first to protect mainframes with precision cooling systems. We were the first to introduce an integrated enclosure system to distributed networks. We help some of the largest names in the industry bring new capacity online faster and at a lower cost when search and social media increase demand for storage and computing. Our portfolio spans power, thermal and infrastructure management products, software and solutions, and is complemented by a network of nearly 250 service centers worldwide.
 



  





 We are now looking for a Thermal Engineer to join our team in
 **Stockholm, Sweden** 




  





**What will you do in our team?** 




  




* Respond in a professional manner to all assigned service calls while on duty.
* Perform all work in a safe manner and in accordance with established company safety policy.
* Perform all work using good working practice and current codes of practice/legislation relevant to assigned task.
* Assist in ensuring that the planned maintenance completion rate is maintained at a min 90%.
* Assist back office to schedule, plan and close any works as required, using established work flow procedures.
* Keep scheduling team informed of changes to your schedule and the status of all open jobs.
* Submit daily paperwork in a timely, accurate and complete manner and in case of Wireless Field Service ensure the job is debriefed in a complete and accurate manner at the customer's premises where possible
* Report sales or service leads to the proper department.
* Support company vision and management decisions.
* Ensure that all ISO 9001, ISO 14001 and ISO 45001 agreed processes are followed
* Ensure that all Vertiv processes are followed.
* Keep company vehicle clean and properly maintained.
* Protect all tooling and company property issued and keep calibrated as requested
* Work as part of the service team and support business needs.
* Provide a positive influence to peers
* Provide on site technical assistance with difficult problems
* Work closely & assist department managers, salesman, contracts engineer & managers with their day-to day operational duties.
* Attend customer meetings as required
* The employee ensure that any activity, task and responsibility required by role in terms of Export Compliance, Import Compliance, EU Arrivals and Despatching, as well as Supply Chain Security is managed and performed in full compliance with the Company International Trade Compliance Regulation certification program itself.



  





  





**What will make you successful?** 




  





  





 Good experience of working in a technical service environment with Thermal equipment or similar but the right personality is equally important.
 



  




* Computer skills including all Microsoft Office associated programs such as, Word, Excel, Outlook
* Previous environmental service experience
* Excellent customer service skills
* Strong communication skills
* Self-starter, ability to plan, organise and manage time effectively with ability to work under pressure.
* Clean valid driving licence.



  





  





**WORKING CONDITIONS:** 




  




* Will be required to stay away from home and travel within Sweden
* After-hours and weekend work, scheduled with little notice may happen.
* You will be expected to operate as part of a team
* Company uniform supplied, which must be worn whilst working.

title: Agile Release Train Architect in Data Platforms & Provisioning at Handelsbanken
description:
*We are looking for an Agile Release Train Architect to lead the architectural work within one of our agile trains for Handelsbanken's shared data platforms. You will be responsible for the overall architecture and supporting the journey towards the cloud in strategic architectural matters.*
**Your Team**
 You will be part of the Agile Release Train (ART) leadership team, alongside the Release Train Engineer (RTE) and Chief Product Manager (CPM). You will also collaborate closely with the solution architects in the area, Business Owners, and the line organization's management team. The team is characterized by strong collaboration, where knowledge sharing and common goals are in focus. Together, we work according to agile principles, with our responsibility being to develop and maintain the Data Warehouse, BI tools, Data Governance platform, as well as to to develop the target data platform in the cloud. You will also be part of the architecture forum to find solutions together and share knowledge with other architects in the field.
   

  

**Your Role**
 As an Agile Release Train Architect, you will play a crucial role in shaping and developing our shared data platforms. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining the train's target architecture. You will lead and organize the architectural work within the train and ensure that initiatives are aligned with Handelsbanken’s enterprise data strategies and target architecture. In this role, you will collaborate closely with other architects and train leadership to define and implement long-term solutions that support future business needs and technical requirements. Furthermore, you will prioritize and drive key initiatives, ensure that development initiatives follow architectural principles and design guidelines, and manage architectural deviations. As part of your work, you will coach other architects and promote skill development within the architecture team.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Your Profile**
 We are looking for someone with extensive experience in senior architect roles, focusing on both on-premises and modern cloud-based data platforms, as well as the challenges of on-premises to cloud transformations. You have deep knowledge in the data domain, including enterprise data warehouses, data governance with metadata-driven methodologies, data modeling, as well as modern "lake house" architectures and BI tools. With technical expertise and a solid IT background, you have also understand the long-term management perspective. Prior knowledge of AI/machine learning workflows and an understanding of data mesh principles is definitely advantageous in this role.
   

  

 You also have experience leading other architects and business experts to ensure that architectural work is strategically aligned and of high quality. Experience with agile methodologies, preferably in large organizations, is important for success in this role. As we collaborate across the entire group, you need to be proficient in both Swedish and English, both spoken and written. Prior experience in the financial services sector is also an advantage in this role.
   

  

 As a person, you contribute to an inclusive work environment by embracing different perspectives but can make independent decisions when needed based on business needs and regulatory requirements. You naturally think outside the box to come up with scalable solutions. Since you will be working with many different target groups, it is critically important that you can adapt your communication and visualize proposed solutions a wide range of different stakeholders. You organize, document, and plan your work well so that you and others can follow it.
   

  

**Welcome with your application!**
**We Offer**
* A trusted and stable employer
* Exciting and challenging tasks
* Good work-life balance
* Career development opportunities
* Clear corporate values around social responsibility and sustainability
* Competitive package of staff benefits


**Contact details**
**Hiring Manager:** 
 Graeme Newcomb, graeme.newcomb@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**TA Partner:** 
 Alva Jonerot, alva.jonerot@handelsbanken.se

 Susanne Ahlberg, susanne.ahlberg@handelsbanken.se
